Reviews.Title: “Wow. Incredible staff !!!”
Reviews.Author: BforBoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for 2 days in Feb/2012 for a work meeting. I was thoroughly impressed with the quality of service I was provided by the staff at this hotel! Just impeccable. They really do go out of their ways to assist you anyway they can. My room was on the top floor facing the water! It was just simply stunning!! It was a truly pleasant stay. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Great Views”
Reviews.Author: AndyouandI
Reviews.Content: We stayed here five nights while at a conference. The overall service was excellent. Our room (1007) was very comfortable, with great views of the harbor (we were in a room with a 180-degree view). The conference center is right across the street. Stanley Park is only a few minutes away by car or a 30 minute walk. The bus to Capilano Suspension Bridge Park is also right across from the hotel and leaves every hour. Numerous restaurants and eateries are within easy walking distance. We would definitely stay her again and highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel ......”
Reviews.Author: kirstyskennelmate
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights after a ski holiday in Whistler. The hotel is well situated and was quite quiet at the time we stayed. It was very comfortable and the staff were pleasant. It is not really a holiday hotel .....more for business. Good comfortable venue for exploring Vancouver which is a delightful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Stiletto666
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen for it's location to the water and being downtown near Gastown and the tourist office. Check in was a breeze and I have to say that the staff were quick, efficient and prompt. When I asked if they could call the Fairmont Jasper Park Lodge to check if my missing cell phone had been handed in they said the concierge would handle it. I spoke to the duty concierge Kate and she got straight onto it and checked for me which was great stating she would contact me or leave message of the results. Great, I go do some touristy things and come back to retrieve a message from the TV message board and not being able to access the second page of the message without the service have a coronary and stalling. Hotel reception printed the message for me and I go hunting for the afternoon concierge who was not available on several visits to the desk but on the third attempt Rodolfo contacted Jasper and organised for the phone to be shipped home to Australia. That was the brilliant and good side. I went to use the in house restaurant last night ( April 18 ) and was advised that there was a wait as a private function had taken over most of the restaurant and only the lounge are was available. I was welcome to wait at the bar till a table become free. No problems with that my problem was that hotel patrons staying here were not warned that the restaurant had limited service and also that the bar area was lit only by the lights behind the bar and the lounge area by candles only. No overhead lighting till it came back on mid meal and after the other part of the restaurant was being broken down after the private event. Perhaps I expect too much being used to Asian hotels where if there is an issue like that the guests are warned beforehand. This is the only real problem I have had with this hotel and noted it on the feedback form for the restaurant. It is not the staff's fault but it is something management needs to look in the further for consideration to the other hotel guests. One thing I have to say is that the staff make this hotel more than the location and the price to eat at the hotel is a little on the high side. Good restaurants are near by. Would I recommend staying here, yes but look at eating outside the hotel if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the water”
Reviews.Author: WesleyDorne
Reviews.Content: Staff was really nice and accommodating. The scenery from our bay view room looking over the water was beautiful. I recommend the bay view to the city view. If you have a car, you should just park across the street in the convention center's parking garage. The price for the garage there was $32 whereas using valet service would have cost $44 + tip.

Reviews.Title: “spendy but met all expectations for price!”
Reviews.Author: foodtravelqueen
Reviews.Content: my first Fairmont experience...cannot stop raving!!! fitness center and pool awesome!! room wonderful clean, spacious, had complimentary roll in fridge for my 6 nite stay! great location, friendly staff, quick wifi, great towels and luxury toiletries (a BIG ranking point for me when pay this price)!!!! so glad i chose here for the short walk to convention center....view of ship yard but still spectacular!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, service, quality”
Reviews.Author: Valhallagirl33
Reviews.Content: This most recent trip to the Fairmont Waterfront Hotel was my third in the past three years. It's a fine hotel with much to commend it. The location is prime. Within minutes you can walk the heart of downtown, Stanley Park, or, across the street, to the Skytrain station or Seabus to the North Shore. Speaking of the North Shore, the views of the mountains across Burrard Inlet from this hotel are sensational! Ask for a higher floor - I stayed on the 15th this past trip - and request one of the corner "Signature" suites which command exquisite views from no less than three beautiful vantages -- east towards the Second Narrows and Mt Seymour, and west towards the Lions Gate Bridge, Coal Harbour and Stanley Park. Even the spacious bathroom has a dynamite view of the harbour and Vancouver's North Shore mountains!!! The service at this hotel is warm and welcoming. From the valets and bell hops who greet you with a "welcome back" when you come back through the doors of the lobby, to the front desk and housekeeping staff, this hotel can pride itself on polished customer service. Personally I much prefer the Waterfront to the neighbouring Fairmont hotel, the Pacific Rim. Though the Rim is newer and more glamourous, it lacks the charm, warmth and sophistication of the Waterfront. Chacon son gout. I like the calm and spacious lobby and the open but quieter more polished feel of the Waterfront's beautiful Heron's restaurant and bar. Without doubt, this hotel is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “What a let down :(”
Reviews.Author: Perth4321
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine is a travel and lifestyle blogger and won a gift certificate to this hotel from an online blogging competition awarded by a large Vancouver tourism entity. As a going away present for my upcoming move to Australia she gifted it in turn to me. I called to make a reservation and all was well until I mentioned I'd be presenting a gift certificate for the room. I explained at the start it was for a "Fairmont Room". The girl at the front desk's tone immediately changed and suddenly "all the rooms were sold out" due to a "large conference" and only the "gold class" $399 a night rooms were available and would I like to book that instead and PAY for it out of pocket. She suddenly could not book me the room awarded by the GC. I pleaded with her that this was a very special event, I was moving out of Vancouver after 37 years here and could anything be done at all but she was completely unsympathetic and refused service. Completely biased service. It's a gift certificate, not air miles. I asked if she could check with the other Fairmont Hotel Vancouver to use it there? I can't understand or fathom why such a rude and unfortunate response. I went online to the hotel's website to see if it was indeed sold out but there were Fairmont Rooms available on the site for the evening in question at $299. Wow. I even over quoted on price, too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful brunch and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oceansara
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love the modern and chic, clean and crisp decor of this hotel. Outstanding staff and service and an awesome brunch as well as a uniquely convenient and beautiful location.

Reviews.Title: “Across From Convention Center & Waterfront”
Reviews.Author: NOAAtraveller
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Waterfront is very nice and convenient with the Convention Center and harbor across the street and a food court downstairs

Reviews.Title: “Classic elegance”
Reviews.Author: Caroline H
Reviews.Content: I have come to know and trust the Fairmont hotel chain to have some of the most consistent hotels and staff. The Fairmont Waterfront is one of my favourite hotels in Vancouver. I usually go for smaller boutique style hotels but this hotel has become such a staple within our family. The food is excellent, the rooms are spacious, clean and cosy. The staff are always the pinnacle of professionalism. I do not eat wheat or dairy and the chef made me a huge quinoa salad. These are the things that elevate a stay to fabulous for me. It also has a superb gym, hot tub and heated outdoor pool with magnificient views of the North Shore mountains and harbour. The location is perfect - minutes away from shopping on robson, pacific centre and gas town. Right next to the float plane terminals. I highly recommend the Fairmont Waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with This Property!”
Reviews.Author: Val_K7878
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont Waterfront for a recent business meeting. The desk staff greeted me with class. When I noted that the wireless Internet service had a charge, the receptionist referred me to the president's club application, and i was able to access the Internet free of charge, which meant a lot or me because I rely on FaceTime to communicate with my husband when I travel, and it was nice to not have that added expense. I was also given an upgrade to a waterfront room upon arrival, so I had an amazing view of the water and the mountains... Simply breathtaking! My room was excellent. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable, and I was able to sleep in the bed immediately (I have real issues in most hotel beds on the first night). The bathroom was spacious, and the staff kept the room extremely clean during my stay. I had absolutely no complaints. I would definitely stay at the Fairmont Waterfront again if I return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Travel the way it should be”
Reviews.Author: Tom C
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Fairmount Waterfront was fabulous. The view was stunning, the service was impecable and the location, for us, was exactly what we needed. My wife and I enjoyed evening walks with our dog on the sea wall and during the day we were within walking distance to most of our destinations. The entire week was most enjoyable and we will be staying at the Fairmount Waterfront when we return. The best all around value. However, I must say that the room was very nice, the cleanliness was not up to our standards. It was good but for this hotel chain it seemed a little less than what is expected.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Gold!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jimedm
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say this is by far the best hotel in the area!! I use to stay at one of the other hotels when doing business in the Vancouver area, but the service is what seperates it from its competition. The concierge staff is one of the best in Western Canada and are always friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “What you expect from a Fairmont property”
Reviews.Author: Amy R
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November, admittedly a chilly time for a waterfront visit! The hotel was beautiful, very nicely appointed. Our room was on the club level which conveniently had its own check in. The staff was beyond helpful and booked us reservations at an excellent local restaurant. The rooms were nice, not huge but still comfortable. The bathroom had cute toiletries although I feel like they could pitch in for a bit nicer hairdryer. It was ancient and didn't work that well. The breakfast in the morning was amazing and located in a very nice room with a view of the city. A great, relaxing place to stay in the city. The location on the waterfront really allows you to enjoy the beauty of Vancouver and the surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “TLC TAKEN TO THE LIMIT!”
Reviews.Author: KNRamdas
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Waterfront with a sore and inflamed right eye. I was tired and disheartened. I was greeted by warm and caring staff. The room was amazing - every thing I could hope for was at my service. All amenities were there, including my most prized electric kettle for making hot tea that does not smell of coffee (as it always does if you make tea in a coffee maker). The room looked out onto a green patio where I was able to sit and sun myself today. As I had to make a visit to the emergency room to have the eye seen to, the staff were so considerate and asked if I needed a ride to and from the hotel. A friend was taking me, so I did not need it, but when I got back, they asked how I was. In the morning I got a call from the general manager and the front desk person asking how I was doing. It was amazing and made me smile. Then this afternoon a small knock on the door announced a visit from a staff member bringing me honey and chocolates and a note to ask how I was feeling. Wow! Never has that happened to me in a hotel. I would be glad to come back to the Fairmont - this is a place where you feel treated like a special person and a member of a family, not just an anonymous guest. I am giving a speech tomorrow at UBC and when I needed to print it out, the staff at the front desk were so courteous and went beyond their required roles to be helpful. This is when an average business trip turns into something to be treasured. Thanks to the staff and team at the Waterfront a miserable start to the trip has turned into a desire to recommend the hotel to anyone visiting Vancouver. Rain or Shine you will feel fine at the Waterfront! I speak from first hand experience. Thanks to Lina, Ana Maria, and all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Oh Wow!”
Reviews.Author: magyarnyul
Reviews.Content: Stayed here beginning of March for a convention. Have stayed here before but this time, as boss is a Fairmont member we immediately went to the 9th floor. Oh Wow started from the time we arrived. Valet service was fast and efficient. 9th floor check in was easy. Rooms were great! They have breakfast served on this floor, as well as day time appies and an honour bar. Service was impeccable. I got spoiled on this trip i will add.... i would love to stay on the 9th floor again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: NorCal_ds
Reviews.Content: Right next to the Convention center. Easy to take the train from the airport to the hotel. Just walk across the street. The rooms are great size and have good views. There are a lot of restaurants and bars within walking distance. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The food at the property is good and the waitstaff is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Second Best hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Harry J
Reviews.Content: If you can't get into the Fairmont Pacific Rim this is your next best bet just 2 blocks away. Great harbour and mountain views. Comfortable rooms, well laid out for business or leisure. Across from convention center and hiking/biking paths to Stanley Park. Within walking distance of all the downtown sites or Seabus to North Vancouver. Rapid transit right there. Great restaurant and bar. Typically excellent Fairmont service. Fitness center and pool are first rate. Always a pleasure to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, gorgeous views!”
Reviews.Author: lady_winter2
Reviews.Content: First of all, we had a great deal here somehow. I think our room cost about $160 or so. Amazing for this lovely hotel, with floor to ceiling windows overlooking the ocean. I registered for the Fairmont club (free) so we had free wifi, and a little box of truffles from a local chocolate store (Chocolate Arts). The truffles were so good, I had to seek out the store and stocked up on presents for the family back home. Yum! The weather was great, so the pool was teeming with lounger-hoggers and kids. The kids even went to the hot tub! It was kind of annoying (although I know, had I been there with kids, they would be doing the same thing). Would be nice to have some adult-only posted times though... Otherwise, the hotel was just lovely. We had a car, and it was very tricky to park it as the meters are expensive beyond belief and so is the parking garage. If I'm ever in Vancouver again, I would love to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views in the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: RoseyEdmonton
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic! We stayed here for a few days for our anniversary and it was a great location. The staff were helpful and the rooms are super clean. The linens were clean and fresh and smelt like eucalyptus, very spa-like!! The pool was clean with an amazing view of harbour and mountains! The gym area has great views as well. The hotel is within walking distance to amenities and shopping and resturants! I look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & very welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: Graemergordon
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at the Fairmount Waterfront Vancouver three times, and never been disappointed. Not only is there easy access both to the convention centres but also to beautiful Stanley Park and all Waterfront activity. For once the Hotel name is not misleading. I've been in "Sea View" and Waterside" Hotels that have stretched that description, but not here. The two convention centres are only 50 and 150 yards away from the front entrance, and if it is raining, not uncommon in Vancouver, there is below ground (dry) access to the centres from the Hotel. The views in Waterfront rooms are spectacular. Across the Burrard Inlet to Grouse Mountain and her sisters. The staff have always been vey helpful and friendly without being "in-your-face" all the time. The Hotel pool is outside, so in summer is great, but from September through to about May/June is off limits to all but Polar Bears. The Gym and Spa are well resourced and well worth while using if that's what you want. However for joggers, walkers and runners, the route from the hotel, past the Convention Centre and the Harbour and into Stanley Park is a must! Stanley park is stunning with massive pine & Cyprus trees, not quite in Californian size, but for me just right.

Reviews.Title: “The Fairmont Waterfront is terrific”
Reviews.Author: BeachBumsDallas
Reviews.Content: A great location for seeing Vancouver, and fantastic staff. We spent a week at this property and the location on the waterfront is perfectly located for the rail system, bus system and tour buses. Convenient to the fantastic Stanley Park and the harbor. Staff could not have been more helpful. I was injured one day (not on the hotel property), and the staff included a first aid qualified person who pulled out an extensive first aid kit and was a great help in evaluating and dressing my injuries. They even followed up on me later to see how I was. The breakfast buffet was exceptional (we did a B&B rate). We did not otherwise eat at the hotel. Convenient to Gas Town and China Town also. Recommend the hotel and would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Good location ,fine if a bit jaded.”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveller1953
Reviews.Content: It may be a bit tired but our superior double was clean ,comfortable ,roomy and very reasonably priced that included gold level facilities Staff are just great and so helpful . Lovely marble hall areas ,superb conceirge .Spa ,pool and gym very good . Had two nights here before heading up to whistler and look forward to returning for one night before flying to Toronto .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: thatcraigguy
Reviews.Content: I was at the Fairmont hosting an event. We rented one of their larger suites to host the event. The staff were fantastic about making sure the room was available, that the ice was plentiful and to help us load things from the car to the room. Our guests very much enjoyed the view and the room. A massive suite at the Fairmont is not exactly a common stop for most people but I am any guest, regardless of their room, would enjoy their time here. A great high end hotel for Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pagliaccio
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel four times over the past few years. We have never had any problems, even when staying with an elderly and infirm parent, when my mother had a room that was well equipped for wheelchair access. Our son and his family live in Vancouver, When we arrive after an overnight flight it is evening in Vancouver even though our body-clocks tell us that it is the small hours of the morning. The restaurant staff are more than willing to find a table for us to eat with our family, including two very exited (but well behaved) grandchildren. The food and service in the restaurant are excellent. The rooms are excellent, modern and quite spacious, unlike many of the Fairmonts where, because of the age of the hotels, the rooms can be small by modern standards. There is good transfer to the hotel on the Canada Line from the airport. We get on the Sky-train at the airport and get off at Waterfont. We have to walk just a few hundred yards to the hotel. Thank goodness for rolling luggage. The hotel is, as the name suggests, right by the waterfront, and Canada Place, and not too far to stroll to Gastown. We could find less expensive places to stay in Vancouver: We could possibly find greater luxury (or would that be mere pretension?)

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay to date!”
Reviews.Author: wilburintoronto
Reviews.Content: This was the second time that I've ever stayed at the Fairmont Waterfront and I thought it was my best hotel stay to date. When I booked the hotel, I was worried that perhaps the furnishings and service were going to be horrible, as the Fairmont Pacific Rim seems to be the one that is getting all the accolades these days. I arrived on an early morning flight and I got to the hotel at 10am via the Skytrain - it was very convenient. Of course, I knew my room wouldn't be ready, but the front desk checked for me, just in case... and told me that they would give me a call on my cell phone when the room is ready to go. All of the staff were very friendly and I felt each one was trying to go above and beyond. The room that I was in, looked like it had been renovated recently and had newer furnishings. It was good to see that money was still being spent to maintain the quality of the hotel. Overall, the combination of a great location, amazing service, and above average quality of the rooms made this one of my best hotel stays to date.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location”
Reviews.Author: whistlerpam
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our second stay at this hotel and again had a lovely time. We had a fab corner room with 2 huge windows directly overllooking the harbour. Lovely and clean with evening turndown service. Unfortunately they charge for wifi access which really annoyed me seeing as you can get it for free in so many places, including the Pacific Coast coaches! Why??? Apparently it's free if you're in their Presidents Club so is worth registering before you go!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: yycskymiler
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the Waterfront (I suppose too much time spent at their Royal York property in Toronto has tainted me! crappy out-dated rooms, crappy service... but I digress) The service was friendly; the West Coast influenced decor was subtle, elegant and well done;, the breakfast service was great, food was excellent (good old Canadian Pacific Railway coffee - loove it!), the concierge provided us umbrellas to walk around with. I was happy to see that the room had a mini-bar station with water, wine and goodies laid out for selection with an easily found price list. I also much prefer the new toiletry line they've got in-room. They also brought up a travel sized anti-perspirant for me at no charge when I called the concierge after forgetting mine! Minor cons: No foam pillows in the room for those of you who are allergic (delivered upon request). Mediocre hairdryers but it was strong enough to get the job done in a reasonable amount of time. As an interior design afficionado, I love being blown away by hotel design. This was lovely, understated elegance but not statement-making. They do have naturally beautiful surroundings so perhaps they don't want to detract from such a grand view. All in all, a very happy business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy!”
Reviews.Author: Bobs-big-vacation
Reviews.Content: Classy luxury and service. A large spacious room with views of both harbour and downtown. A huge comfortable bed. Roomy bathroom, flat screen tv and coffee maker. Easy access to downtown and the waterfront. No negatives…oh maybe one…firmer pillows for our next visit please?

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous 5 star retreat in downtown Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: savarynana
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! The front desk staff was friendly and efficient, the room had the most comfortable king-size bed I have ever slept in and the in-room coffee was to die for! They even gave us a late check out on our last day so we didn't have to schlep our luggage around for 4 hours. Nothing but good things to say about this hotel, we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gwen9244
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Waterfront at the end of January 2012. The hotel is lovely and in a very good location. We were upgraded to a Waterfront room and the views from the room (once the cloud had cleared!) were spectacular. We could have sat all day gazing out of the window. The room was a good size, very comfortable and always clean and tidy. The hotel is very well placed for taking a stroll to Gastown or up into the main shopping area. The staff at the hotel couldn’t have been more helpful and I would especially like to mention Leigh Stratton. Leigh very kindly helped us with a delivery which was sent to the hotel some months ago. I would certainly recommend this hotel and, if we were to travel to Vancouver again, we would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: BoomerfromVan
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong staying here, location is perfect. The views from your room with the mountains/water on one side and the city on the other are great. The rooms are clean and a nice size, the hotel staff are so friendly if you need something all you have to do is ask. We love staying at this hotel and will keep coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Good food and service--beware thin walls!”
Reviews.Author: Monica88_10
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, food and location but one night a rowing couple in the next room kept me up because walls are quite thin. I told the staff and they promptly told the neighbors to keep it down. The staff was very prompt with other requests and Katie the chief concierge is extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location, love the view”
Reviews.Author: Lisatait
Reviews.Content: We are visiting Canada for the first time, & this hotel is the start of our Fairmont Hotel experiences ... But I must say if all the others are the same for the rest of our holiday, I will be one happy traveler! We stayed here based on location to the Convention Centre as we had a show to attend to here. The location was perfect, the staff could not do enough to assist, & we couldn't have asked for more ...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.... great Gold Floor just a few little things missing”
Reviews.Author: Geordie_calgarian
Reviews.Content: Accompanied hubbie on another Vancouver business trip and pursuaded him this time to stay at the Waterfront on the Gold Floor as I got a good rate online $224 vs $197 for the Hyatt (non club room) where he usually stays. Great welcome, we were already checked in given keys by the bellmen and headed up to the room. Room is lovely, spacious, spotless and appears recently redone. Fairmont has recently changed their amenities, now from Le Labo and I really like them. First of all I'll tell the good about the Gold Floor. Staff are very very friendly and if you ask them for something they'll do their best to make it happen, remembered our names right from day one (I'm in night three of a four night stay). Great breakfast, excellent nespresso machine, and although advertised as deluxe continental there is always sausage, bacon hashbrowns and another entree ie: quiche, eggs benny etc. Evening snacks have been very good - oriental one night with dumplings, sushi etc, another spanakopita, meatballs etc and always a cheese tray. Honour bar of course if crazy priced. A glass of the red wine they have is more than the cost of the bottle, which we don't like anyway. I went out and got us a nice bottle of Deadly Zins and we took up our own. No one said anything. On the flip side my biggest beef would be that the staff really aren't "there" in the lounge. Dishes sit waiting to be cleared for a long time, in the morning only once have I been offered a coffee refill without getting it myself and my biggest peeve is that there is no milk/cream on the tables, only in jugs in one area so if I have a pot of tea every time I pour a cup I have to get up and carry it over to add milk. I have had to knock on the kitchen door several times to get butter etc. Also, their games selection, not even a pack of cards was lackluster which is disappointing as most floors have these. Thirdly was the magazine selection which was nil - only free magazines were on display. There was a BMW out front with the hotel logo and hubbie asked how he could drive it and was told that he couldn't drive it, but it was courtesy car for hotel guests and if we wanted a ride somewhere, or a pickup we could be driven for free. We did do this last night and got a bit of a tour of downtown which was well worth the $5 tip. It is one of those hidden services though, I haven't seen it advertised. Hubbie also love the free pressing service, saved a few minutes in the morning. I do want to stress that the staff could not have been more accomodating, professional and kind - fix the stuff above and there is nothing I could complain about (which is pretty rare for me ;) Hands down, beats the Hyatt - no comparison in service at all which is crazy as my husband has stayed there every week or two for the last year. We did have a city view which is fine but I'm surprised they didn't upgrade us to a harbout view as the gold floors appear quite quiet right now.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service!”
Reviews.Author: julieame
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Waterfront for two nights prior to a cruise. It was a perfect location for a cruise, just across the street from the terminal, and well located to walk around the city. We booked through Luxury Hotel Resort Collection for less than $300 per night, including an amazing buffet breakfast plus a $50 dining room credit. In addition, we paid for a city view and were upgraded to water view. We also received early check in, and late check out. The front desk and concierge staff was so helpful -- it felt like they couldn't do enough for us. As a Fairmont Club member, which is free to join, internet was free. We would definitely stay at the Fairmont again if we return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely and Welcoming place to Visit”
Reviews.Author: katiegregory
Reviews.Content: We visited in January and spent 2 nights here after 12 nights in the the Fairmont Chateau Whistler. Both hotels are great. Location: This hotel is well placed to the waterfront (hence the name) and local attractions. As a tourist, it was good to be near the tourist information centre and the food court underneath provided a cheaper alternative to the hotel food. Room: We had a fantastic waterfront room on the 22nd floor. The views were great, the room was quiet and and it was stylishly decorated. I was very happy with the room, although alot of light did seem to filter through the bottom of the door to hall way. Staff: All the staff we came into contact were polite, courteous and willing to help however they could. Housekeeping did a great job of presenting the room and reception staff were prompt and efficient. Facilities: They have a pool, hot tub and gym facilities which we used and were very well maintained and it was lovely swimming on the roof of a building in the middle of a bustling city. Overall: This is our second visit here and I would highly recommend it to anyone. It is very well located, easy to find and offers a great service.

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: dgm10
Reviews.Content: This deluxe hotel is ideal for business or pleasure. Well located in the downtown business centre and adjacent to convention and port facilities. A great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect complimentary tea and coffee”
Reviews.Author: Heather J
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight with another couple. The expected style and quality of a Fairmont Hotel was all there, but we were appalled by the near-piracy price of in-room internet access (especially when there is a proliferation of free wireless hotspots through the city). In this modern day there is no excuse for not providing at least reasonably priced, or indeed free, internet to customers who are paying for a high standard of accommodation. And we were also disappointed to see one coffee pod and no black tea bags provided, for a couple. A call to room service resulted in a 40 minute wait for a staff member to hand over 2 teabags and one coffee pod only! I didn't realise we would stay at the Fairmont only to be rationed tea and coffee. All in all it gives the impression they want to force their customers downstairs to the restaurant, even for a hot drink. Overall impression of the hotel was let down by small features.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: awalker2012
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far my favourite to stay at in downtown Vancouver. The service from the hotel staff is nothing short of impecable - from the time of curbside check in to cocktails or breakfast in the lobby to any special requests you may have. Combine this with a great location and you have a winner with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A stone's throw from all the downtown action”
Reviews.Author: ClintonJ1
Reviews.Content: Both Fairmont hotels in Vancouver offer exceptional locations relative to downtown Vancouver but the Fairmont Waterfront takes the prize for aspect and modernity. We chose a one night stay on December the 25th and booked online, pricing was just as competitive through the Fairmont's online booking as via one of the consolidators though the consolidator suggested that internet access was included - it wasn't. You'll pay a premium for Car Valet and Internet and your Internet supports only one device - a problem if there are two of you with two or more devices. Staff are exceptionally service oriented and forthcoming with useful information, from the car valet all the way through to the concierge. We forgot our umbrella in the back of the car and the valet quickly and deftly extracted it for us so that we could meander up to the main shopping area of Vancouver. Rooms are well appointed and not at all run down, bathroom requisites are above average but disappointingly there were no slippers around that we could find. Good job we bring our own just in case! We didn't dine at the hotel though it appears to have a busy and appealing bar and restaurant. A Tim Horton's is conveniently found just near the hotel entrance as well as a Starbucks and during the weekdays there are other small places that provide food and snacks. With only a block or two placement from the start of gastown and the midtown though, you will not be far from somewhere good to eat or shop provided you are willing to expend a little shoe leather. You can self park, there are plenty of self parking locations in the area but when you are staying at the Fairmont, who ever self parks?

Reviews.Title: “Panoramic views”
Reviews.Author: Jinna_11
Reviews.Content: Beatuiful room.... The staff were exceptional. The hotel is located right along the water, for a breath taking view when you wake up. Its in a central location right in between gastown and Coal harbour. There is a fantastic hotel restaurant/lounge within the hotel with great food. I had ordered a dinner at Herons and was unable to finish it, t he staff kindly packed it up and put it in the room fridge for later. As For ground transportation you have the choice of Taxi cabs directly at the entrance of the hotel or the skytrain few steps away. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Vancouver Airport”
Reviews.Author: BruceWyder
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont on December 27th 2011 and again on January 3rd. 2012. Check in was great and so was check out albeit early morning. The rooms are fantastic and I have had different rooms/views every time I have stayed with them. The staff are superb. The food is excellent in the bar and for a five star hotel, not too pricey. Overal great, I stay every time I have an early flight

Reviews.Title: “Favourite Vancouver Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PickyInVancouver
Reviews.Content: I'm from Vancouver and my wife and I will stay here for mini getaways all the time. It's a fantastic hotel with a great view from the water facing units. The staff is awesome and very helpful and the outdoor pool is perfect on a sunny day. It's also right on the transit line so if you are coming from YVR it is super convenient. I'd recommend it to anyone and everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, and now my favourite”
Reviews.Author: Jim F
Reviews.Content: Wow, loved this hotel. We were staying at another hotel when my son reacted terribly to something in the room, so we rang the fairmont and asked for a room free of Chemicals.We were surprised to find they had the 21st floor specially designed for this purpose. Well... what a beautiful room, with an awsome view, and all the staff superb. Food, location, service were all outstanding. I have stayed at the Fairmont in Banff before, but this blew away all my expectations. We will always stay at a Fairmont from now on , as long as our destination has one. Thankyou Fairmont waterfront Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds Expectation”
Reviews.Author: Cathy S
Reviews.Content: This was our third Christmas stay at the Waterfront in the last four years spending 4 nights over Christmas. The service is always above and beyond our expectations., The rooms are well decorated and the beds are exceptionally comfortable. An added benefit is that this hotel is pet friendly. We had our two Pugs with us and I honestly believe that they were treated even better than we were, from door men who always had a treat, to the desk staff who came from behind the desk to give hen a pat and housekeeping who provided a bed and food dish. This hotel is always our Hotel of choice when visiting Vancouver. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love”
Reviews.Author: Qldred
Reviews.Content: Five out of five fairmont waterfront!! Thank you to the fairmont gold staff for making our stay superb! We will be back. Your attention to detail and desire to help with the smallest request made it a pleasure to stay at the hotel. Special thanks to Andrea!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: DerekWarren
Reviews.Content: stayed for only 1 night, but the service was excellent, place was clean, servers were great, and we felt like a million bucks!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on YVR waterfront”
Reviews.Author: KiwiWanderlust1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel right on the Vancouver waterfront. Excellent staff, and very clean and comfortable rooms. Only drawback is the decor a little dated. Excellent location close to the central city and the Seabus. Would recommend it for both holiday and business.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel met expectations”
Reviews.Author: johncrawcarp
Reviews.Content: Booked this property as a part of a New Years Eve party and overnight stay. The room exceeded my expectations for the reasonable rate paid. The view was classified as "city view" but actually had a "peek-a-boo" view of the harbour and Northshore mountains. It was a very large room with 2 queen beds (very comfortable) and a large sitting area with couch and chair. We had a small get-together prior to the Gala event and room service was accomodating with additional glasses. The only negative comment was that we booked the room for 3 people and the room amenities were based on 2 (coffee, bathroom supplies etc.). Security and the feeling of safety was excellent and the friendly accomodating staff from check-in to check-out was excellent. I was unable to use the in-room (on TV) check-out service and would suggest they give proper instructions if it even works at all. Fortunately, a quick call to the front desk and they checked me out within minuteds without having to wait in the check-out line downstairs. The Hotel advertised the New Years Eve Gala event and special room rate but I think it was a separate company that hosted the Gala (ClubZone)? The gala was a complete waste of money and not as advertised ($80/person +). No place to sit, DJ's that catered to the under 25 crowd despite advertising various 80's & 90's music and "mature event. The wine was horrible and priced at $9 for a 6oz. plastic glass! There were 4 of us and everyone was very disappointed with the event (40-50 years old). I would not recommend this type of New Years event and would suggest the Hotel not associate with this low class high priced event.

Reviews.Title: “Sunshine in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: wash15
Reviews.Content: What made this stay amazing is the service of the staff. My waiter at breakfast gave me a full rundown of what was included in my package deal (and politely pointed out tip was included). The next morning he remembered my coffee and breakfast preferences and called me by name. If you like to run, there is a great scenic run around the seawall (I actually fell in love with running on my first trot around the seawall). A nice touch was when I returned from a run, a valet handed me a bottle of water - didn't even have to ask, they were certainly anticipating my needs. I also wouldn't normally go to dinner in the hotel restaurant (especially since there are so many amazing options in Vancouver and Gastown), but was feeling lazy and decided to give it a try. I was so glad I did. My appetizers, entree, drinks were amazing and the waitstaff made me feel right at home. It took the dreariness out of dining alone. Exceptional service! My room was very cozy and the view was phenomenal - I looked out on the bay and the Olympic torch. I could have stayed in my room all week soaking in the view. I missed out checking out the rooftop garden, but will do so on my next trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been 4/5 on a different floor!”
Reviews.Author: JetRTW
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel really summed up what you hope for from a top hotel - friendly, helpful when needed and not overly intrusive. The concierge in particular stood out as being competent and friendly. The rooms were not to my decor taste but they were spacious and bright and the beds were comfortable - which is the important thing. As a family of five we booked two rooms under their family deal, which allowed for the second room to be 50%. This hotel is situated above an underground food-court with access to the Canada line, meaning you don't need to brave the cold if you don't wish to. Everything was great until we found out our rooms were opposite a conference room which was hosting a Christmas Party. This was noisy and really, really spoilt our stay. Also we found people had been on the terrace bit right outside our glass bedroom doors in the night, and, judging from the full ashtray left on our terrace table, they had been smoking I have written more about it here for those interested in reading the full story: http://jet-rtw.blogspot.com/2012/01/fairmount-waterfront-hotel-vancouver.html

Reviews.Title: “I'm sat writing this surrounded by cases”
Reviews.Author: JayGraham37
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Waterfront is ideally situated in downtown Vancouver, close to the area of Gastown which is well worth a visit. I would imagine that it would be ideal as a stopover for a cruise being right next to the cruise terminal. The hotel is clean and the staff very efficient and friendly. The only drawback is the lack of storage space. We arrived for a 4 day stay after 10 days skiing in Whistler, and so have 4 cases. we booked a Fairmont room for our family of 4 and there is just not enough space to unpack even one case properly. Therefore we are constantly steeping over our cases. This would not be an issue if using the hotel as a start up for a cruise as you could leave your stuff in storage, but it wouldn't take much to sort out, just putting some shelves in the wardrobe for a cart. I would recommend this hotel however and am being a bit of a nit picker

Reviews.Title: “5 day stay”
Reviews.Author: tracy s
Reviews.Content: this is a 4/5 star hotel very nice and modren, the concierge was very helpful, the gym and jacuzzi was'nt up to much but in general very nice we would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Christmas day dinner at Herons”
Reviews.Author: Ann B
Reviews.Content: Spent Christmas day dinner at Herons with family. Received personalize service and even the Chef came and made sure we were enjoying our dinner. Food was cooked to perfection and had a wonderful selection. Service was excellent and the ambiance was wonderful. Thank you to everyone for making our Christmas at Herons special.

Reviews.Title: “handy to the convention centre”
Reviews.Author: Jane M
Reviews.Content: Conviently located for the convention centre (or the cruise ship terminal), you can even get to the convention centre via underground walkway if the weather is too bad. There is a food court attached to the hotel which is handy if you just want a quick bite. The rooms are a good size and the bathroom had a lot of bench space, which is always a bonus. Service was friendly. The only negative I'd say is that the hotel doesn't have a lot of atmosphere, but there is nothing really to fault with the rooms or property. Personally, I probably wouldn't stay in this location unless I was going to the convention centre or cruise ship, or had another reason to specifically need to be in this part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moose1422
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to the gold floor which was awesome as it had some good perks. Private check-in, free parking, appies and breakfast all included. The only downside was the lounge was too small for the number of guests that could use it. We found it packed on Sunday morning and the staff couldn't keep up with the demand although they were working very hard (not their fault). Room was lovely and extremely clean. Beautiful location and central to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: mhap
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Watrfront is everything you would expect in a Fairmont hotel, professional, friendly staff, great service, comfortable rooms etc. It's location directly across from the cruise ship terminal and less than a 5 minute walk from the convention center makes it an excellent place to stay for business or if going on a cruise. I caught the skytrain from the airport and was pleased to find that the hotel was only a 4 - 5 minute walk from the station, it's a very easy and quick way to get downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver, what a great city!”
Reviews.Author: AnneCrt
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days in Vancouver in July prior to taking an Alaska cruise and how great it was to stay in the Fairmont Waterfront. It's a first class hotel with excellent amenities and accommodation. Very central and with easy access to all attractions and transportation and the cruise ship terminal. It was our first time in Vancouver and what a beautiful and vibrant city it is. Gas Town is the area to go to for either lunch or dinner and the side walk patios are perfect, even if the evening is cool, as there are huge heaters on all the patios. We'll definitely be returning to Vancouver soon and will stay at the Fairmont Waterfront when we do. Highly recommend this hotel and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great service, Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Jno1979
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at several Fairmonts in Vancouver, Jasper, Whistler, Victoria, and Seattle. I've always been impressed with the level of service that the chain offers, the Waterfront is no different. Fantastic views of the North Shore mountains and Vancouver harbour, and the convention centre area. The food at Herons was quite good, bell service was prompt, and even beat us to our room with our luggage. Beds are super comfortable, the Miller Harris toiletries smell great, and the room is well appointed. The hotel also has a resident Golden Lab you can reserve if you want to take the dog for a walk around town for an hour! I love the location at the cruise ship terminal, and its a short walk to the art gallery and some of the best food carts around town. Perfect hotel for a cruise out of Vancouver, or if you want a nice weekend away I can heartily recommend the Fairmont Waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Igloo44
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week with a friend who had never been to Canada. Vancouver is my favourite city in the world and I was looking forward to showing it off! I had emailed the conciege in advance for a few suggestions and both Rodolfo and Katie were wonderful! While we were there we stopped at the concierge desk everyday and dealt with Selima who was exceptional, she helped us book a trip to Whistler and had new suggestions for us everyday. All the staff we dealt with were wonderful, the doormen were friendly and remembered us each evening when we came back to the hotel and asked about our day. The reception team were all extreamly helpful, especially when we arrived with less than 15 minutes to get to Rogers Arena for a hockey game - they took our bags and said the keys would be waiting for us when we got back, it was perfect! The room was large, with two Queen beds and room for an extra bed when another friend visited for two nights. The beds were so comfortable I wish I could have stayed longer!! All in all it was the perfect hotel to spend a week at in my favourite city, and I hope to be back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for a Weekend Conference”
Reviews.Author: SniperMonkey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October for a conference. We had lived in Vancouver for 10 years and it was nice to return. 5 star service - from the front desk to the concierge. We arrived early but they informed us that they would give us a call when our room was ready. We left our bags at the concierge and went for some lunch. After lunch, our room was ready and they would deliver our bags to our room. We were a little concerned because sometimes that could take hours, from experience. However, we were pleasantly surprised that within 5 minutes of us getting into our room, we had our bags dropped off by a friendly gentleman. We were also able to leave our bags at the concierge on our checkout day as our flight was later in the evening. No bed bugs. This is super important to me since experiencing them in a Traveller's Inn in Victoria. The bedding was extra soft and we had a nice view on the 11th floor. The room was clean and the bathroom was spotless. Good quality linens, toiletries and robes. The location was perfect. Within walking distance to all the tasty foods I missed while away. 4 minutes to a Japadog. Steps from the Skytrain. No free internet, but that's the norm with downtown hotels. There was a Starbucks down the street if you really need internet. The Convention Centre across the hotel has a Check In kiosk if you want to check into your flight before you fly. As in all hotels, you could hear people in the hallway or doors slamming. It wasn't very bad though - much better than other hotels. I think it really depends on the guests and how respectful they are.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday to remember!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer S
Reviews.Content: Staff were amazing, room service was to die for..... I want to go back again and again and again!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: Drweddle_123
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this beautiful hotel for years and we now affectionately call the Fairmont Waterfront our "Home away from home". From the minute we drive up and we're greeted personally by the Doorman, then swept away to the front desk and greeted by name (keys are waiting for us!), then arrive in our gorgeous room (we prefer the signature room, but love them all) and a bellman arrives and makes sure we have everything we need, that's when we know we're back at the Waterfront. The location is perfect! It is directly across the street from the cruise terminal. We always advise our friends to stay at least a couple of nights at the Waterfront before or after their cruise. What a shame it go to Alaska and not see the most beautiful city in the world. From the Waterfront, you can walk to Stanley Park, Gastown, Robson Street, museums and great restaurants. The best Sunday brunch however is at the Waterfront. The rooms at the hotel are beautiful, comfortable, inviting, and most of them have awesome views. We've stayed on the Gold floor many times and it's always a treat, from the delicous breakfast to the honor bar. The Fairmont Gold representatives are always happy to help you in any way, from booking tours to making dinner reservations at the finest restaurants in the city. The best thing about the Fairmont Waterfront however, is the attitude of all of the people who work there. Year after year, we see the same people and they remember our names and go out of their way to make sure our stay there is the best ever! We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: coffeechik
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here on our wedding night many years ago and had a wonderful time then. Stayed over night for a Christmas function. We had just booked a regular room and ended up with one with a corner - two windows on adjacent walls. What an amazing view we had even thought we were not high up, The room was well designed with very nice furniture and an awesome bed with fantastic bedding. We slept great and heard no noise in the hall, from adjacent rooms or from outside even thought the pool was there. And yes, it was heated and open in December!! Will definately remember that next time. People were actually using the pool. The only two small negatives were the two huge long black hairs along the inside of the tub and the in in room coffee while it was Keurig made below average coffee. All the staff we encountered were beyond polite and professional especially the valet parking. What a fantastic hotel and an all around great stay. Would choose again for sure and recommend to out of town guests.

Reviews.Title: “Large hotel with personalized & attentive service”
Reviews.Author: RAKlein
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the hotel on a 26 hour stopover on our way from the east to Hawaii. The welcome to the hotel was cordial, the hotel itself very nice (good feng shui), and the location ideal. We had a corner signature room (180 degree view) that was well worth it ... lots of glass and a great feel -- a real contrast from a traditional hotel room. The room, as is the hotel, was clean, well-appointed, and comfortable. The bed gave a good sleep and the soundproofing in the hotel was excellent. The bathroom in this room was good-sized (and also had a huge window). All in all, the room was perfect and the hotel more than met expectations (except that the wifi didn't seem to work on any of our wireless devices --- got trapped in feedback loops that prevented a connection ... but I had my laptop and the wired connection worked fine).

Reviews.Title: “Waterfront... right on Waterfront.”
Reviews.Author: Kulin_Shah
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel. 4Star + Rating. good size rooms, good linen on bed which gave a very sound sleep. Onboard restaurant choice was not so great. Good Bar on the ground level. Well secured hotel. I would love to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: odhis3
Reviews.Content: Me and my girl friend we checked in at the fairmont waterfront in vancouver was amazing. Wow, the lobby was just exquisite and we knew we were in the right hotel and we were happy to stay there for a night. We had a nice room and the view was spectacular and breath taking!!. Looking forward to get there again next summer. Thanks!!.

Reviews.Title: “The best of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: hisfields
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Vancouver will be memorable in part because of our wonderul stay at the Fairmont Waterfront. The event that brought us to town was held across the street at the Convention Center, so the location of the Fairmont could not have been more convenient. The accomodations were perfect, the staff gracious, the views extravagant. If my business ever brings me back to this city, I wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel, right downtown, great service!”
Reviews.Author: urmtrout
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Fairmont Waterfront in early November of 2011. I had never stayed there in previous trips to Vancouver, preferring the Fairmont Vancouver (also an excellent choice), but it had no vacancies, so they suggested the Fairmont Waterfront. I am glad I took their advice. The location is lovely, right on the waterfront with a nice view of the water. Service, as seems normal in Fairmont Hotels, was personalized and excellent. I am a Fairmont President's Club member and really enjoy the extra special touches I get from that. I was met at my taxi by the bellman, who had my room key in hand thanks to pre-arrival check-in (what the Fairmont calls their "I'm on my way" service). No need to line up at the check-in counter; I LOVE that. They called me by name throughout - I felt so pampered and special. In addition, at my departure point flying to Vancouver I had a dental emergency and was scrambling to find a dentist. I contacted the hotel in Vancouver and the Concierge, Katie Pettit, arranged a dental appointment for me in the vicinity for that evening. That was a very reassuring experience and an extremely valued service. Aside from that, the rooms are very spacious, clean, nicely decorated, with a mini-bar, a Keurig coffee maker and also bathrobes provided. Very comfortable beds and bedding. All in all, a great experience, and the type of great service and accommodations that keep me coming back to Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if on a cruise, but don't go Fairmont gold.”
Reviews.Author: lily387
Reviews.Content: Fairmont gold is a non event. It was for us. On check-in in the lobby, , we were told " you are on the gold floor " in the same tone of voice one would use if describing the colour of the carpet on a particular floor. There was no mention of anything special that came with staying on the "Gold" floor, and really there wasn't any. Breakfast was pretty basic. A Continental breakfast, that was serve yourself. Coffee was from a jug. No waiter service. Make your own toast. The evening drinks and canapes were even a bigger let down. A selection of 4 or 5 canapes. A glass of pretty ordinary white wine $11 a glass plus tax. Have no idea what the cost of any spirits were. We had 2 glasses of white wine each and the bill was close to $50. The so called late check-out was 12.pm. As for the dedicated concierge team on the Gold floor. Where were they?. No idea. We never saw them.!!!.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a spectacular surrounding”
Reviews.Author: jetsetpanda
Reviews.Content: Compared to the other two Fairmont properties in downtown Vancouver (Fairmont Vancouver and Fairmont Pan Pacific), the Waterfront is the most reserve and intimate of the three sister properties. It bears the unmistakable elegance of the Fairmont brand yet its unassuming character is a charming selling point. The location is convenient to the Canada line metro - just get off at the Waterfront station and walk about 2 blocks to the hotel. However, if you plan to shop by Robson St. or the Pacific Center, then it is a bit of a walk to get there. Outside the hotel you can see the majestic snow capped mountains across walking towards Canada Place. The staff that I encountered at this property were friendly, polite and very efficient. In particular I find the desk staff at Fairmont properties to be more welcoming and warmer than their competitors. I had a nice standard twin with a view of downtown and the warm tones were inviting, especially during my cold and rainy stay. The outdoor pool by the health club has a majestic view but I would not suggest using it during winter time. Overall I had a very enjoyable stay and would not hesitate to come back to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch”
Reviews.Author: freods
Reviews.Content: This is a great property in Vancouver right across the street from Canada Place where the cruise ships dock. My wife and I spent time here waiting for our cruise departure and the convenience is hard to beat. The food was great, the staff was great, and the hotel was spotless. If you plan on an Alaska cruise I highly recommend staying here as part of your package.

Reviews.Title: “Simply worth it!”
Reviews.Author: hammsters
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights on a mini-vacation at the Fairmont Waterfront and enjoyed every minute of it. The location of the hotel is superb for taking in a water-front stroll, exploring some of the best things Vancouver has to offer, and it can't be beat if you're attending an event at the convention centre. We had a room high up with a city view, and it was lovely. The room itself was spotless and well-appointed, and the bed was super comfy. All the staff were sincerely helpful and friendly. We were advised by the concierge to become President's Club members so we could avail of the free internet. It was a simple and quick process and definitely worth doing. The buffet breakfast was superb, as was the evening meal we had at Heron's restaurant. The only downside is the price of parking, but that's Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Vancouver, BC”
Reviews.Author: travelgurl_55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in Bellingham, WA, and travel up to Vancouver as often as we can. We recently spent a night at the Fairmont Waterfront to attend the Circle Craft Christmas Fair (amazing artists!) and had a lovely time. Even though the Fairmont Waterfront is a large hotel, it has a "boutique" feel largely due to the exceptional staff. It was clearly a busy weekend for the hotel, but every staff person that we came in contact with was very helpful and friendly. We stayed on the 19th floor - cool! - and had a city view. The room was very comfortable and the city view is just fine - after all it is Vancouver, one of the most beautiful cities in the world! The location is really great if you want to visit historic Gastown - it's about 1 block away - and conviently located to stroll the waterfront, or walk up to the fancy shopping district on Robson Street. We ate dinner at the restaurant in the hotel, Heron's, and it was 5-star. I will return to this hotel and recommend it to visitors to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: MichelleHC
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Waterfront is located across from the cruise ship terminal, on the water in downtown Vancouver. From the moment you enter the hotel, you are greeted with friendly staff whether it be the valets, concierge or front desk staff. We upgraded to the "gold" floor which was a deal - $60 which included parking (alone is $40) and access to the gold lounge where an honour bar awaits - GreyGoose Vodka and an honour bar!!! Appetizers from 5 - 7:00 pm and a lovely buffet breakfast in the morning. The room was beautiful and does not look 20+ years old. Very comfortable bed, soft, white towels and evening turndown which included slippers. The pool is outside so a bit chilly at this time of year but it was open nonetheless. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Southern Hospitality from our Northern Neighbor”
Reviews.Author: Sandra R
Reviews.Content: This hotel & their entire staff was absolutely wonderful. We have never had such attentive service. Always with the welcome mat rolled out to welcome you back home after a day of sightseeing. After the very first moment you enter their beautiful lobby, everyone remembers your name & in my case, special needs or assistance with an electric scooter. If you want a beautiful hotel, attentive staff and superior service, your one and only choice when visiting Vancouver should be the Fairmont Waterfront. Note, our trip was both business & couple vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver Fairmont in November”
Reviews.Author: Joe A
Reviews.Content: Booked a last minute one night stay at the hotel. Had curbside check-in, keys and room allocation handed to me as I entered the hotel (President's Club member). Good room with all of my personal needs catered to (i.e. fitness gear). Had dinner in the restaurant (Heron's) where we had an excellent meal, served very capably by Emilee. Check out early in the morning was quick and easy. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Experience the City and Enjoy the Mountain Views”
Reviews.Author: Jenny0386
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont Waterfront for three nights in mid-October this year. You really must get a room with a great view of the mountains. This was my first time visiting Vancouver, and it was so special to be able to be located so centrally (close to Robson Street - great shopping and restaurants!) and then come back to a comfortable, clean room with stunning and serene mountain views. The location of the Waterfront highlights the best qualities of Vancouver while providing excellent service. The room was quiet, clean, and comfortable - the bed was especially comfortable! The staff at the hotel were all very pleasant and personable and because we brought a car, parking was easy in the hotel's garage and also felt secure. I highly recommend the Fairmont Waterfront to especially any first time Vancouver visitors. You will get the most of the Vancouver city experience and remarkable Vancouver panoramas.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the line customer service/location”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Fairmount Waterfront for my birthday weekend and I loved every bit of the experience. Been a Presidents Club member, I was greeted and checking in by valet, ushered to my suite, and may I say it was a corner high floor room above my expectations. The linens, bedding and overall condition of both room and bathroom was clean and welcoming. The only problem was the front desk forgot to ring me at my requested wake up call time and the fitness facility seemed a bit cramped for guest. But overall, my stay was very enjoyable and I can't wait to stay up there during the upcoming Xmas holiday - Jimmy D.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for enjoying funky Gastown!”
Reviews.Author: LJP99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our anniversary and it was great as we could walk to Gastown for dinner. They gave us a corner room with fabulous view and congratulated us on our anniversary. The bed sheet was clean, but stained. It was the only thing that wasn't perfect.

Reviews.Title: “First class treatment without all that over-the-top BS!”
Reviews.Author: Steve W
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived, and the young guys out front who valet park your car if you drive up (as it happens I walked in from the Skytrain station) and look after your bags welcomed me, it was a breath of fresh air. They weren't stuffy or condescending. They asked me if I was checking in. I said I was, and they asked my name. To my utter surprise, my keys were there waiting with them! They handed them over and I went right up to my room. This was without a doubt the fastest and most pleasant check-in I have ever had! The rest of my stay was equally nice. Sometimes when people use your name when they speak to you on the phone or in person it seems fake. Here it seemed sincere. And I have experienced lots of "Mr This and Miss That" in my day! My stay was not flawless, but it was certainly one of the best hotel experiences I have had. Simply because if they forgot some small thing, I felt it was totally OK for me to call them and ask to have it corrected. And they did.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel. Uneven customer service.”
Reviews.Author: rdabca
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel but I was disappointed by the brusque and unfriendly treatment I received when checking in at the President's Club desk. My husband had to attend a meeting and I initially checked-in before him. The hoops I had to go through to do this were amazing. While I assume this was for security purposes, it would have at least been polite to explain this to me instead of becoming irritated when my husband didn't answer his cell phone immediately. The customer service we received in the restaurant and during the rest of our stay in the Hotel were outstanding so I tried not to let the initial negative experience affect my overall opinion. However, we stay numerous times a year at different Fairmont Hotels and this is the first time I have ever experienced a truly rude employee and I'm not even sure why. Moving on, our room on the 21st floor had breathtaking views and was beautifully furnished with a lovely bathroom. The bed was so comfortable and comfy bathrobes were provided as well as slippers at turndown. We had a wonderful buffet breakfast the next morning and despite my initial impression would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BevAnne23
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, staff helpful, clean and rooms spacious. Totally enjoyed our stay, close to town but also only 20 minute walk around the waterfront to Stanley Park. We would definitely stay again. Great view of the harbour from our room. Beds were big and comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort”
Reviews.Author: lalenawalter
Reviews.Content: The beds are divine, I always have a great sleep here. Rooms are clean, but it is an older downtown hotel, so no nice marble bathrooms like the YVR fairmont. It is a little noisy, as you can hear the street noises, such as sirens. I did stay on Halloween weekend though, so the city was louder than normal.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful... and Stunning Views”
Reviews.Author: rabidcow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Waterfront on the 1st day and the last day of our honeymoon in Canada and we were delighted with the hotel. Our room is a 'Portside' room with a stunning view over the harbour. If you do get this room (or the corner room), do wake up just before dawn and you will be rewarded with a stunning sunrise over the harbour. The staff was exemplary. We had our needs attended too (even when we least expect it). On our last day, we asked the bell desk where is a good place to get water and was promptly given a bottle each - just like that. Now that is what I call service! The food at the hotel was great as well - I particularly think that the room service was great - it was reasonably priced and comparable to the restaurants below. We were also given good advice on attractions and the location of the hotel was great! Would I stay here the next time I am in Vancouver? Definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning location, attractive hotel -- but are others irritated by having to pay for the Internet?”
Reviews.Author: WhitehorseVancouver
Reviews.Content: I have been at the Fairmont Waterfront several times. It is in a great location on the Vancouver waterfront -- with remarkable views of the North Shore mountains, the harbour and one of the world's great cities. I have never been overly impressed with the lobby of the hotel -- it tries to be stately, but it ends up being cavernous. The rooms are very nice -- large and well-appointed. If you can get a waterfront/mountain view, you will simply love the setting -- particularly on one of the 10 days a year when it is not raining or cloudy :) The entrance way for first floor area, tied to large and useful conference facilities is a little off-putting, however. The staff are very helpful and highly professional -- this place knows how to hire the right people! My reservation was lost (always the possibility I forgot to make one). There was not great panic and they accommodated me very quickly. Efficient, friendly and knowledgeable staff make a huge difference when traveling, and they can make an average hotel property soar in my estimation. The Fairmont, at all of their properties, gets top marks for this. But I have one large complaint, and not just about this hotel. I am really tired of being charged extra for the Internet. In my case, the basic Internet -- not sufficient for properly downloads -- was covered as part of the conference package. But I really dislike the rigamarole of launching the website, filling in the forms, adding one's visa card, etc. Surely we are past this by now. Having full and proper high speed Internet at no incremental cost is a no-brainer in this day and age. Lowe end business hotels do it. As a rule of thumb, I will not stay in a hotel that charges extra for the Internet -- any more than I would stay at one that charges more for electricity, toilet paper or the basic TV services.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but don't forget to sign up for the president club before you go!!”
Reviews.Author: rawness
Reviews.Content: We were over the moon when we found a week in the fairmont for a bargain!! We were traveling round Canada for a few weeks and decided to book a nice hotel to look forward to at the end of it, and it was beautiful, nice staff( she asked if we'd like to be higher up for a better view ECT) lovely room and amazing view. The location was perfect everything within a few min walk. The ONLY thing I can grumble about is that the extra charges. We stayed for 2weeks in lots of different hotels and every place give free wifi in rooms but the fairmont charges around $15 per 24 hours for the Internet!!! I was a little gob smacked! So the lady on counter said if I singed up to the fairmont priesent club it would be free and I'd get other benefits! So of course I did it! Got free Internet all week and came back from a walk round the town and came back to cake and a personal card! Very nice surprise! Also used the BMW push bike for free although there was only one working so we had to pay to hire one from else where. Used the outdoor pool (yes in October it was heated!) and hot tub and gym were nice and clean! We had room service one night and it was beautiful and not overpriced for what you'd normally pay for a 2 course meal in vancouver!! altogether a wonderful end to an amazing holiday!!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, nothing out of the ordinary. Spooked out on the first night.”
Reviews.Author: EccentricDrill
Reviews.Content: Good location, easy to get to. Near enough to most attractions, but not the best around either. **skip next 2 paragraphs if you're easily spooked-out** Was checked-in on time and promptly, but the room was not ready. Was offered an upgrade to a room on the top floor, next to the lift shaft with an odd shape and design. The room had a "cold" feel and there was evidence of not being lived-in. Hard surfaces, corners, certain edges, cushions and bed covers were dusty. With a bed which could be folded in to a cupboard, it took me some time to figure that this could have been a lounge / sitting room for the adjacent rooms, left and right. After a whole day out, jet-lagged and not having a flat surface to lie-on for nearly 24 hours, my chi was certainly not at an all-time high. I was preparing for bed and sorting out my ipod. I am considered quite a "numb" and insensitive person. I experienced my first spiritual encounter just after midnight (I was not conscious of the time at that point). A tremendous negative and chilling energy swept through me and followed by sounds which were never familiar to me. Not wanting to spend any minute more than I could, with my luggage which I packed hurriedly, I sought rectification from the front desk. Kudos. Room 1824. The room-change was prompt, no questions asked. Room 1824 is spacious, having both the city and harbour-views. Close to 5-star sleep nights. I highly recommend the free bike rental service as it took me through to places like the West-End, Gastown, Chinatown, Grandville, Stanley Park, Lions Gate Bridge and even up to Park Royal. Despite having a meetings 9am-5pm through out my stay of 3 nights! Wifi is free for President club members. I think it sucks if it's going to be a paid service, cos there are other hotels that are offering as part of the package. This place would have been average, but sorry. Damage was done on the first night! Management: that room on the top floor, in my opinion, is not fit for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: moontheodos
Reviews.Content: No words for this hotel. Super location and views from the hotel. Walking time from the shopping area about 10 min.It is a pick up location for major sightseeing tours.Rooms are clean and spacious[stayed at room #2317] Breakfast and hot buffet were superb. Finally,people who work for this hotel are polite and always there to help you! Million thanks to all of you! I wish I will come back to Vancouver and stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Well-located, and great view”
Reviews.Author: WinnipegSteve
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a business trip, with a conference held at the hotel. The rooms were typical Fairmont - lovely and well-appointed. Service was impeccable, for the few areas I used. The location is literally steps from the water and BC place. It also is less than a block to the transit (SkyTrain) station, which has a direct route to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Never Disappoints, EVER!”
Reviews.Author: KendraLM
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel has the good fortune of long term staff who must be guided by the strategic principal that "Service is King" at all times. From the Restaurant Staff to the Welcoming Doormen to the Service and Support staff, this hotel AIMS TO PLEASE. This hotel has never, ever disappointed us and we stay here over 30 nights/season. It really does have the feeling of "being home" when you visit, a rare gem in the hotel industry. Would highly recommend staying here while visiting Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home for me”
Reviews.Author: Lunarcom
Reviews.Content: Travel brings me to downtown Vancouver about 12 times a year and each time stay at the Fairmont Waterfront if at all possible. Service is top notch, the rooms have always been clean and they work to resolve any issue or need that you may have. Like one time due to a screw up in flights I was showing up at 9 am, instead of 3 pm. Asked for a room and they made a special change so that I could be in a room way earlier than the standard check in time. I was in bed and asleep by 9:30 am !
