Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: Edna H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I organized a two night stay in the Fairmont Waterfront after our Alaskan cruise. Unfortunately my husband became ill and had a six night stay in a Vancouver hospital. The Fairmont Waterfront management and staff were absolutely incredible helping me with transport to the hospital as well as paperwork faxing and emailing. More than this their enquiries for my husbands health and their cheery greetings made my time in an unfamiliar city under difficult circumstances a pleasant one. I cannot speak highly enough of this Hotel and if at any time I was to return to Vancouver. I would not stay any where else. I think a comment by one of the front desk staff would sum up the attitude of this hotel, "we provide accommodation but we are accommodating" I would agree with this remark.

Reviews.Title: “Alaska Cruise Monopoly--no need to give good service!”
Reviews.Author: umy888
Reviews.Content: I expect the world of Fairmont hotels, and was pleasantly suprised with the Fairmont Pacific Rim! We had family staying there and visited them there often during our stay in Vancouver. I must emphasize that this was not the case at their sister hotel, "The Fairmont Waterfront". We were in a room where there was a large gap between the door and threshold and this allowed every little and loud sound to enter our room constantly waking up our two-year-old. I called the front desk to insist on a refund in the morning, but the manager would have nothing of it. She also called our room back at 11pm at night even after I insisted not to be disturbed as our baby was sleeping. When she called our baby woke up and could not get back to sleep. A true nightmare! I told here that I would have her job for doing this and her reply was: "Sir are you threatening my life?" "Sir, should I call the police" "Sir are you threatening my life?" I immediately went down stairs to talk with the manager above her and tell of the incredible reply she gave. He did not care either and I looked like a lunatic. Upon his reply I knew that if I was lucky I might just be able to walk away and go to my room and not be arrested. I hardly sleep knowing that these two had all the power and could have easily had me put in jail that night. You need to know two things about this hotel, first, they are a factory for people taking Alaska cruises. They are just across the street from the terminal. Because of this fact, they are filled to the gills each Summer. They do not have to provide any service as most guest are one-shot visitors taking an Alaska cruise. Don't take my word for this--I talked with a couple of the staff there who were very sympathetic to my experience and told me this. I wanted to know how a hotel and its staff could be so evil! Also, you are in Canada, not the USA, so don't expect the same level of service that dictates "The customer is always right"

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: female2
Reviews.Content: Beautiful ambience! Definitely will stay there again! It is pricy but worth it! There is a mall downstairs from the hotel. I went to the spa at the pacific rim as well. Gorgeous!!! Sooo worth it if you are staying there! View was stunning! I traveled alone as well but everyone was friendly and knowledgable! Fairmont in itself is quite expensive. This hotel at least allows for smoking rooms which I really appreciated! The waterfront station is across the street and 2 stops is robson street and pacific mall! Nice cafes around. Just relaxing really. The outdoor pool is small but worth it as it is heated! If you don't mind the price you will love it. Room service food was great! Tasty and they brought it pretty fast! Enjoy your stay when you go!:)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Irene M
Reviews.Content: The guys at the front represents the hotel extremely well. they are courteous, and welcoming. The accommodations are excellent. The view from our room of the harbour and mountains were spectular. Great staff make it an enjoyable and relaxing stay. The location is superb. Will certainly come again and bring friends and also recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service on top of the great view and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Hee Jip K
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff provide excellent services to the business travellers. The hotel can be very effective for both leisure and business travle.

Reviews.Title: “100 %”
Reviews.Author: wandawoobucks
Reviews.Content: I looked through some of the other reviews and see that most of the words I wanted to use have been taken, ie great, cannot fault it - I guess that says a lot. we stayed 3 nights at the end of Sept in a standard room at the back. we were not disturbed by any street noise or any other noise in fact. We then had one night a week later prior to coming back to the UK, we were upgraded to a Gold room which was also great. The beds are so comfortable and the hotel is run seamlessly and without fuss. The receptionist was very helpful and allowed us to use the spa to 'freshen' up prior to leaving late pm to go to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, great service and relaxing - once I'd solved the shower puzzle!”
Reviews.Author: rodeime
Reviews.Content: It's hard to imagine a better located hotel. Right on the waterfront overlooking the cruise terminal and Canada Place, it's a great choice if you're heading off on a cruise or looking for somewhere close to the tourist centre. I don't have a lot of experience with North American hotels, but the decor seems muted and austere and the Fairmont is another example. Don't get me wrong, it's spotlessly maintained and everything functions, but these interiors seem dated and very '80s. Canadians might be used to the cryptic shower control, but they don't make out-of-towners very comfortable. I worked mine out after a bit of head-scratching, but one of our party had to call the desk for help. A bit like solving a Rubic's cube before the water comes on. Not much fun when you're keeping people waiting for dinner. If you have a waterfront-facing room, you might find the blinking neon of Canada Place a bit much unless you draw the heavy drapes. I was impressed with the hotels rooftop herb garden and bee hives. The apiarist (Graeme, head of housekeeping) did a little demo for us and it was quite interesting. The honey is divine and so are the chocolate and honey truffles. Also worth investigating is the Vancouver "afternoon tea" served in the alfresco diner. Regional Okanagan wines, cheeses and honey. Yes, honey and cheese! Who'd have thought .. delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: anon186390
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Vancouver for 2 nights, and chose this hotel for its location. We were a little surprised that the hotel is not right on the waterfront, but "behind" another hotel. However the views from the signature rooms are amazing, and the location relative to the city is very convenient. We had a poor experience because of some issues within the hotel organisation which resulted in our room not being serviced, and things like newspapers and turndown not being happening, but we assume this was a one-off. Staff were helpful in trying to address the issues but never really managed to fix things even to inaccurate checkout account. But the individuals were friendly, and both of the staff we dealt with on the concierge were excellent, and made most helpful suggestions for improving the arrangements we were requesting, and made the bookings very efficiently. We only ate breakfast at the hotel, and althought he food was good, the ambience was of a business hotel rather than one for a leisure stay. The room was very well furnished, and the bed was incredibly comfortable. We stayed at 4 Fairmont hotels during this vist to Alberta/ B.C. and they really have got the comfort of the beds developed to a high degree.

Reviews.Title: “Waterfront Fairmont makes you feel special!”
Reviews.Author: Consumertravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waterfront Fairmont to celebrate my granddaughters ninth birthday. The staff at the Fairmont were so gracious and all the staff made her feel special by recognizing her. The staff is by far the nicest I have experienced in all my travels, everyone was helpful and willing to go of their way to help. The hotel is imaculate, rooms spacious, beautiful pool, spa excercise room and the food was wonderful in the restaurant. This hotel has a wonderful garden on the 3rd floor with over five hundred thousand honeybees that provide honey for the restaurant, now that is truly thinking of the enviroment! Wonderful location for anyone going on a cruise ship or for catching a float plane or just enjoying the beauty of Vancouver and feeling like you have space with the harbor. Definately a must!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Handtiques
Reviews.Content: WOW. What a view from our 21st floor room overlooking the port. Everything was perfect. Fine bed linens, etc... Just a short walk to Gastown.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Hotel, Great city Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: micmax21
Reviews.Content: Well stayed 4 nights at the Fairmont Waterfront in August 2011, We chose the Waterfront because of its location to the Cruise terminal. Really were surprised at the quality of the hotel and the rooms, If you are going on a cruise stay here before you go, as they will take your luggage to the terminal so all you have to do is cross the road. The staff made the stay really enjoyable. Great food in the hotel, but if you just want a snack there is a foodcourt down stairs, the best of both worlds. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Home from home.”
Reviews.Author: SusanK1973
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Fairmont Waterfront on many occations. Most recently we have stayed on Gold which is a hotel within the hotel. The welcome is second to none and the staff go out of their way to make their gusts as comfortable as they can. They are always on hand to answer questions, make suggestions for dinner or help to book a trip if needed. Because we've been a few years running the staff have become friends and staying there is more like going home than staying in a hotel. Thank you all for being yourselves and sharing your lives with us.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it -”
Reviews.Author: slj60
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Waterfront at the start of our tour of the Rockies. We had travelled from Toronto to Vancouver by plane and the hotel sent a limo to collect us from the airport. The accomodation had been booked by the Rocky Mountaineer as part of our tour of their Journey through the Clouds Discovery Drive, RM had booked all accomodation and travel for us and everything was very good. We arrived at the hotel and were taken up to the Gold Floor reception. It was a beautiful sunny day and our room wasn't yet ready. We sat on the terrace of the Gold Lounge and enjoyed the view sipping a glass of wine from the honesty bar. Our room was large and spacious and very well equipped. The bed was really comfortable. The Gold Floor staff were lovely, very helpful attentive and charming. The hotel is ideally located to tour Vancouver and has super views. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Let Them Handle Your Luggage!”
Reviews.Author: Bruce4730
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Fairmont Waterfront prior to our recent cruise. This hotel has always been our favorite in Vancouver as the service is normally fantastic and the location terrific. Unfortunately, staying there really caused a problem for our cruise vacation. The hotel offered to deliver our luggage across the street to the cruise ship terminal at Canada Place to be delivered to our cabin onboard the ship. Our luggage was properly tagged and we thought everything was great. Boy were we wrong. They took the luggage across the street to Canada Place pier, but split up the delivery so that one of our pieces was placed aboard the wrong cruise ship! We never did receive this piece of luggage. It has supposedly been located and is to be shipped to our home, but we didn't have the benefit of having our belongings at all during our cruise vacation. It was a 12 day cruise, and the luggage mishandling really put a damper on the vacation. I'm sorry I trusted the Fairmont to deliver the luggage across the street. I should have done it myself. My travel agent contacted them to let them know of the situation. They responded that they would be contacting me. So far, no communication has been received from them, and I find that very disappointing for a hotel that professes a luxury experience. The Fairmont failed to deliver on this trip, and really contributed to souring what would have been a wonderful cruise vacation. I will have to think twice about staying there again, especially since they don't appear to be interested enough to even contact me. My word of advice: if you stay with them, the stay will most likely be enjoyable (and expensive), but think twice about letting them handle you luggage!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Cheefee
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Waterfront Hotel for several nights before and after a cruise. What a wonderful experience! I stayed in a Fairmont Gold room and enjoyed the spacious room, extremely comfortable bed and beautiful harbour view. All the staff were friendly and welcoming. The patio was a lovely place to relax while enjoying the complimentary breakfasts or the evening canapes (both delicious). I would especially like to thank a member of the Gold staff, Veronica, for being so helpful. When I returned to the Waterfront after the cruise, I was delighted to be greeted by Veronica, who not only remembered my name, but asked about the cruise, too. She later had chocolate covered strawberries sent to my room along with a note welcoming me back to the hotel. It was all much appreciated. I ordered dinner from room service and also enjoyed several meals in the Heron restaurant. All were excellent. The hotel is also in a great location. Staying at the Waterfront helped to make my first trip to Vancouver memorable. I will look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JohnSFleet_Hants_UK
Reviews.Content: excellent location overlooking Canada Place - where the cruise ships embark/disembark; so ideal for our quick 2 night stop before going on an Alaska cruise. top quality room, very friendly and helpful staff. well located for Gastown, Stanley Park.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: KS_always_2011
Reviews.Content: l stayed at the Waterfront hotel and took part in the bee tour. The Bee Keeper was knowledgable and gave a rewarding tour, Definately would recommend it. What a wonderful hotel. The room was good and the view was spectacular.. All the employees made me feel welcome and that really made my stay..

Reviews.Title: “Good Option for Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: LilAl
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights, after arriving from Australia, prior to starting a tour of the Rockies. The Fairmont Waterfront was a good, functional option for us. The hotel has a full range of facilities. In-house restaurants are of good standard. The location near the waterfront is great - some nice sea air walks to blow away the jet lag. But we wish the seaplanes didn't start buzzing around so early! Travellers note - dining on the waterfront near the hotel is expensive and of average standard (typical tourist stuff). You can walk towards downtown for better and cheaper options.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have found a more perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Minerva22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at thge Waterfront with my mother for 5 days last year and after that awful long-haul flight from Australia, it was like checking in to paradise. At check-in, we were greeted by a professional and warm young girl who explained everything to us and made us feel really welcome. Our luggage was taken care of by a porter, and we hopped in another lift and up we went. The view we were hit with was amazing. We had a window facing Vancouver Harbour, with a brilliant view of the docking ships and the busy-ness below. It was really beautiful, and I spend a good 15 minutes taking photo after photo to try and capture the scene perfectly. The 1st thing that my mother discovered with a look that could only be discribed as "sheer joy", was that the beds seem to open up their arms and totally embrace you whenever you laid down. These are the best beds I have ever slept on in my life. We were both quite jet-lagged and decided to take a "nap" at 10am and woke up at 6:30pm... I blame the amazingly comfortable beds :) When we finally got ourselves out of bed, and started feeling really hungry, we crossed the road and had a meal at Aqua Riva which I highly recommend. After that we came back and had a cup of tea in the hotel restaurant/bar area. It was really relaxing and there is wifi down there so I got to update my travel blog while waiting for my tea to cool. Anything I called the staff about was never a problem or too hard. I discovered my 'universal adaptor" wasn't so universal and asked reception if they had one I could borrow. Success! The location itself id ideal, as you are literally parked infront of Canada Place, and from here all the tourist buses frequent and you can can hop on the Hop on Hop Off trolley too, which we did. The sky train was only a block or so away (how we came in) and there are taxi's constantly waiting outside across the road so if you need to get somewhere quickly you can. Highly recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect after cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: biomatch
Reviews.Content: We had been travelling on land and on an Alaskan cruise (Princess was great) for two weeks. This hotel with our crisp, modern room was a calm restful finish to our travels. Check in was friendly, smooth and luggage sent ahead was brought to our room quickly. We had an amazing view of harbor, pool and the "green" roof of the new conventtion center building. Our only complaint was that breakfast in the hotel restaurant was outrageously expensive and not that great. The Four Sails Restaurant in the facility is the subject of a separate review. Good location near the cruise port and transport.

Reviews.Title: “quick visit, lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: ptbooth
Reviews.Content: Sadly, I only spent one night at the Fairmont Waterfront for a business meeting, so I didn't get to enjoy much of what Vancouver has to offer. But the hotel itself was of typical high Fairmont quality, directly across the street from the cruise terminal. The room was spacious, as was the bathroom (with those very north american "extra wide" shower curtain rods) over the tub. The bed was very comfortable. Even though my room faced the downtown area, it was quiet, and I slept soundly. Food at the meeting facility was excellent, and multiple temptations left out throughout the day had me constantly snacking. I'll have to come back when I'm up for an actual vacation next time.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay :(”
Reviews.Author: lewis01utk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed at the Fairmont Waterfront in Vancouver in preparation for an upcoming Alaskan cruise. We booked the hotel using the American Express FHR program. The hotel was quite easy to find and an easy walk from the water front rail terminal. The front desk staff were friendly and we had very little wait before we were checked in and on our way to our room. We stayed in the king waterfront room category and it was fine (clean and well maintained), but for $400 a night I was expecting more. We booked this category due to the fact that with the FHR the hotel is supposed to upgrade to the next category up if available. The view was nice of the sea planes landing and of the water. We order room service and the burger I ordered was very good my wife's chicken sandwich was dry and flavorless, but with the FHR come an $100 food credit so we ate and went on about or day. When we returned for the night the room was quite hot. We turned the air down to 60F and got ready for bed. We both awoke around 1:00 am with the room still burning up, now faced with the dilemma I calling the front desk, complaining and switching rooms at 1:00 in the morning or sucking it up and going back to bed which is what we did. All in all the stay was fine (aside from the broken air conditioning) for a $100-$150 a night hotel, but as I said this room was $400 a night!! We stayed at an all inclusive Sandels resort for $300 for our honeymoon to put this in perspective. Also the room upgrade, as I said, did not happen and around 11:00 pm we went online to the Fairmont's website and the next room catagory was still very available. Given that we booked this hotel as a "Fine Hotel and Resort" all of these factors and the cost for such made the stay very disappointing compared to other hotels through the FHR program. If you're coming to Vancouver stay in the Shangra-La. The rooms are 10 times more posh than the Fairmont, they honored the room upgrade, the air conditioning works, and the room was $100 cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: leg27
Reviews.Content: The best hotel ever, efficient and friendly, Canada at it's best. Book the Gold option rooms for superb service without being over the top. Highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Up to the rooftop!”
Reviews.Author: jedigiraffe
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay. We spent one night here before our Disney cruise to Alaska, and they were perfect. From the Disney Cruise desk right there in the lobby, to the wonderful restaurant serving FRESH, healthy food, to the friendly people everywhere in the hotel, it was just right. We especially loved the beautiful garden on the rooftop, and the view of the Fairmont's own beehives! Honey from the bees is part of the yummy breakfast, and the hotel restaurant uses herbs from the rooftop garden as well. Lovely people, perfect location... wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “The most awsome experience”
Reviews.Author: Ken F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Waterfront for 2 nights prior to going on an Alaska cruise. The cruise departure terminal is across the street. The Fairmont checked our bags (with customs) and sent them ahead to be waiting in our rooms on the ship when we arrived. This left us several hrs after checkout to go get lunch and visit some more of Vancouver prior to our 5 pm departure. What else would we have done for several hours carring luggage around if this wouldn't have been one of their services. The Staff, service in the Fairmont Waterfront was amazing, from dinner suggestions, reservations to excursions and different modes of transportation to and from different sites. The lounge & breakfast were fantastic with the terrace and the spectacular view of the harbor and mountains. One of the best experiences we have ever had. Nothing was left to chance and everthing was executed perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel...beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: JuneDuke12
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great, and in walking distance of so many nice places. We had a beautiful view of the harbor from our room. The service, food, etc. were very good. This has to be one of the most beautiful cities in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Wow.... this is a super-nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JSS3
Reviews.Content: Our cruise line, Sillversea, selected this hotel as part of our package and it was a pleasure to stay there for 2 nights. It is across the street from the ship dock. The staff was outstanding. The room was clean and QUIET. My wife was impressed with the pillows and duvet. We had never stayed in a Fairmont before, but highly recommend this one. We had high tea at the Fairmont Empress Victoria too, but that's another review.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VIEWS, SERVICE & ASSISTANCE EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: OzTrav1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont Waterfront before and after a cruise along the inside passage. The room we had was large with very comfortable kingsize bed and a very roomy and lavish bathroom with fantastic views across Vancouver Bay. The assistance we received for getting to the port, dining out at night and also various tours was excellent. All staff that we dealt with were always very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Big, lively, stylish”
Reviews.Author: Ennea
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at a very nice 20th anniversary rate and were given an upgrade to a large room with a great harbour view. Enjoyed our stay to the fullest. Nice pool. Nice setting. Busy coming and going as a large hotel should have. Very efficient concierge. Great service, except for housekeeping forgetting to restock coffee and minibar.

Reviews.Title: “great location in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: spontane0us_famly
Reviews.Content: we stayed here over the holidays and enjoyed very nice weather and a great vantage point for our daily travels around this beautiful city! the service and hotel were perfect - very friendly people, eh?! and nice big - bigger rooms, no hotel room is really that big. nice view but somewhat blocked especially if you're on a lower floor -- we were upgraded to a higher floor but our view was still blocked. oh well, but we could see the north vancouver mountains and waterway.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Hoteldiva72
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay. Staff was friendly and helpful. We had the opportunity to experience a bee tour which was fascinating and exciting led by an extremely personable beekeeper.

Reviews.Title: “exceptional service, great location”
Reviews.Author: sheree h
Reviews.Content: Whilst the Fairmont Waterfront is centrally located to Vancouver's services and attractions and boasts spectacular harbour and mountain views, it is the outstanding and efficient services provided by the concierge and porter staff that sets the hotel above the rest. Their customer service skills, attention to detail and comprehensive knowledge of the area are most commendable. Additionally, the hotel is barely a few minutes walk from an array of public transport options, restaurants, shopping etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Fairmont Waterfront”
Reviews.Author: Nick D
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Waterfront delivered outstanding service during my last stay there in August of this year. I wanted to particularly pass along my appreciation for Rodolfo Parra - one of the Concierge Desk employees. Mr. Parra was exceptionally professional and going-well-above-and beyond in helping secure a pass for me and my girlfriend to the sold out 2011 Celebration of Light Fireworks Festival on August 6, 2011. It is precisely because of great people like Mr. Parra that the Fairmont experience stands head and shoulders above that of the competition. Thank you again to the Fairmont and all their hard-working, excellent staff whose service exceeds their guests' needs.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient central location, elegant and modern building, stunning views across the Harbour and beyond”
Reviews.Author: TonyHughes6
Reviews.Content: We had a one-bedroom suite for 3 nights, which was the ‘City’ section of our ‘Rockies’ holiday. The suite was on the 22rd floor (one from the top), overlooking the Harbour and the Conference Centre, with Stanley Park and the Lions Gate Bridge in the background. This waterfront view was absolutely stunning. Our two teenage daughters had one room (with a Queen bed and bathroom with shower) and we had the adjoining room (with a folding Queen bed and full bathroom). The suite was very well-appointed, extremely clean and (because of the enormous picture windows in both rooms overlooking the waterfront) very light and airy. The hotel itself was very stylish, both modern and elegant, with a light and airy feel to the lobby. The Reception and Concierge staff were friendly, approachable, knowledgeable and extremely professional. The hotel also had a health club and an outdoor (heated) pool, situated in a lovely rooftop garden, with bees and hives (but not near the pool!). We ate out in Vancouver for the three nights, but we did have breakfast in the hotel on two occasions: one in the Herons Bar downstairs and once in our room. Breakfast in the Herons Bar was buffet-style, with a wide selection of dishes, including freshly-cooked omelettes made while you waited. Not inexpensive, but you could have as much (or as little) as you wanted of everything. Room service breakfast was served on time and as we requested. One problem we experienced (which had also happened a week before in the Fairmont Lake Louise) was the unexpected ‘wiping’ of our magnetic door keys. This meant we couldn’t get into the health club and were ‘challenged’ by a member of staff as to our identity when the key very obviously wasn’t working. Whilst the staff were quite polite, we felt the assumption was that we were ‘imposters trying it on’ as opposed to guests who had a problem with their card. It was a most unpleasant experience ending with one of the pool staff escorting my wife and daughter back to the room (just to check the room). When new keys were issued at the Reception desk, I was given the counter-intuitive advice that I shouldn’t put the credit-card sized keys anywhere near my credit cards, as this could be causing the problem. But what would one naturally do with credit-card sized keys, but put them in one’s wallet (where other cards are….). It made me lack confidence in the hotel’s key system (not to keep people out, but to allow them in!) and that the hotel staff felt the problem lay with the guests and not the system itself. The keys issue aside, we had a great time at the Fairmont Waterfront Vancouver and would recommend it as a stylish place to stay, with great views and a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Only worth it if you get a good price on the internet...”
Reviews.Author: CareyGLondon
Reviews.Content: Start with the good: most comfortable bed I have EVER slept on and (if you have a harbour view room) - great views. The rest: hotel devoid of any character or charm and that includes the staff. Staff are perfectly civil and polite but there is absolutely warmth or personal interest. This hotel still charges for wifi (Canadian $13 for just one device, one connection!). Breakfast prices are horrendous too. We paid nearly Canadian $65 for pancakes, coffee and juice for two.

Reviews.Title: “You can't judge a book by its cover”
Reviews.Author: DNDee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four days in July. The hotel is gorgeous from the outside, all glass and modern. Our room, however, was quite outdated, especially the bathroom. The color scheme, an orangey coral, was downright hideous. Housekeeping was not up to par. The carpeting was dirty and stained and the desk had a large circular burn mark, probably from the in-room coffee pot. The toilet didn't look particularly clean when we arrived, but I thought that was probably just due to age. However, after spending the day touring this beautiful city we returned to our room, lifted the toilet lid and there was urine and toilet paper in the toilet. Housekeeping 101 should include daily toilet brushing! On the up side, the bed was very comfortable and the hotel's location is great. When we checked in, we were told we were getting 2 double beds, but were given a king when we requested a different room. I would have preferred being on a higher floor, we were on 7, but the view was still very good. The concierge was helpful and friendly, as was the rest of the staff. Next time we'll stay somewhere else, maybe across the street at the Pan Pacific or the downtown Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: Olds442MN
Reviews.Content: Concierge Level is treamendous. View is outstanding. The pulse of the town is here baby.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, fine accomodation!”
Reviews.Author: VisitorTraveller
Reviews.Content: Tips first (since not everyone reads the whole review): (1) Join the President's Club (it's free, and you can do it from the Fairmont's website, before you arrive) to get free Wi-Fi and a few other small perks. (2) Room service is VERY expensive -- food is overpriced, they add 17% gratuity plus other fees...we paid over $50 for one cheeseburger, one chocolate shake and some juice. (3) There's a car and driver that seem to be sporadically available if you need transportation - ask one of the doormen or the concierge...apparently it's kind of a case of "IF the car is available and IF a driver is availalble..." The best part of this hotel is the location. Right across from the Convention Center, on the waterfront, and half a block to Gastown. An easy walk to anything downtown, even to Denman, English Bay and Stanley Park. Rooms are well laid out, reasonably large, and quiet. The TV quality was not good (no HD!) but there are a lot of channels. The bed was comfy, the shower was OK (towels not the best, they seemed overly bleached and not very "thirsty"), and there's a good sized desk for those unfortunates who have to get some work done. I didn't use the (outdoor only) pool, but did use the exercise room, which is small but adequate, with 3 treadmills, 2 Stairmasters, one rowing machine, a couple other machines, and weights. We did run into someone who'd brought his dog, and he told us there's a $50 (one time, not every night) charge for keeping a dog in your room...he seemed happy with that. Front desk and other employees were very friendly and professional. All in all, the pluses far outweigh the minuses at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “stayed on business but it was like a vacation”
Reviews.Author: Brian R
Reviews.Content: All staff are friendly, courteous and happy to see you. I am always well greeted by the door and front desk staff and housekeeping does a great job keeping rooms spotless. I like the easy to use temperature control in each room and every room has a view. The beds are the most comfortable I have ever slept in. Your body seems to melt in to the mattress. I especially enjoy the fitness facilities at the health club and like the outdoor pool which is refreshing after a day's work. The location is pretty central, close to Waterfront station to get to the airport, the north shore and the rest of the city, close to Stanley Park and close to our office. I find it is nice to go for a walk along the harbour and enjoy the life on the waterfront in the foreground and Stanley Park and the mountains in the background. I am looking forward to my next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Assistance by Conciege”
Reviews.Author: Mikecpp
Reviews.Content: The Concierge Desk and the Team serving there was of great assistance to us. They arranged a room upgrade, a city tour, a bus transfer from Vancouver to Seattle and helped find my granddaughter's cell phone that was left behind in the room when we checked out. A very professonal group dedicated to guest services.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed with check in”
Reviews.Author: travelfuntimes1
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel but check in left more to be desired to say the least. Was spending one night in the hotel to attend a wedding. Luckily we got dressed before checking in. We tried to check in early as we were only staying the one night. Although I could understand that they could not accomodate us, we were not offered anywhere to get ready. On top of that we were checked in late. Our room was not ready until about 4:30pm and check in is at 3:00pm. They said they would call on our cell but didn't. The least they could have done was let us know that our check in would be late. We had to call them at 3:00pm when we had not heard anything. If we were staying more than 1 night it wouldn't have been that bad. They did however hold onto our luggage and the gents there were efficient. I don't know if I would stay here again for the price we paid. You also have to pay for parking which was $45+. Very high when you can park nearby for $14.00 (on the weekends) - 24 hrs at Easy Park.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel, managed superbly. Definitely will be back soon.”
Reviews.Author: justshootme7
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers some fabulous views. Our room was so comfortable, which we especially appreciated since it rained for two out of our three days. The restaurant served fresh beautifully prepared food, and we especially enjoyed their breakfast and tea time. They make their own honey, and grow their own herbs. Get to the rooftop. The concierge staff is top notch, and is very helpful with sightseeing suggestions. Mr. Pullan, the manager, came from the Fairmont Orchid, and has applied all that aloha spirit to this hotel. Always helpful with a smile, he runs this hotel superbly.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: goodtimes1950
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 days before cruise. Beautiful waterfront high room where we could watch the ships come and go. Walk to everywhere. Hotel breakfast was included and fabulous service and food. Walk across the road to ship after hotel delivered our luggage. Great views of Grouse Mtn and nth Vancouver. Returned for 3 more days a month later received a lovely upgrade. Great gym and lovely roof top garden, bees and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: MrTrig
Reviews.Content: Staff were exceptional, riding teh bicycles around Stanley Park was a joy with our teenage kids. The location is great for waterfront activities and yet still a nice walk to downtown shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: KCFanSheffield
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four days in mid July. This hotel is in the best location in the whole of Vancouver. Having never stayed in a Fairmont hotel I was expecting great things. I was in a port side room on the 21st storey and what a view. I had Canada Place one side and the Vancouver Sun building on the other side. The best thing about the hotel was the view. When I booked I recieved a free upgrade to the next level room. The staff I spoke to were friendly and helpful. I talked to a member of staff who seamed to know nothing whatsoever about Downtown Vancouver - I know that all hotels have a conciege but I still think that staff should know a bit about the area they are in. The staff on the conciege desk were very helpful, though one advised me as a single woman to go to Lighthouse Park in West Vancouver - which I have been to on a previous trip to Vancouver and I felt it was a lonely place when in a group, in the middle of a sunny day in August. Lighthouse Parlk is a lovely place to go and very convienient because the bus to Horseshoe Bay stops at the end of the park but it can be very lonely especially once you leave the main path. The room itself was huge - two double beds, a huge flat screen TV, desk and chairs. I never managed to get the room warm enough (i used both douvets). There was air conditioning but it seamed to be just consist of a thermostat on the wall. I was disappointed to find the towels were only standard hotel size - I did think that a luxery hotel would have big luxorious towels, but it was not to be. I was more disappointed when I looked closly at the bathroom: - the lightswitch had been screwed on at an angle, with one screw partly hanging out - how tatty! - the bathroom door had two different coloured doorhandles - one was silver and one was gold in colour. To say that the literature in the room talked about little details I felt that little details like this let the room down. The only way to keep any food cool in the room was to use the ice bucket. There ws a fridge but it was also the minibar. The minibar fridge had a tab on the front so that once you had opened it to look anyone knew and I would guess that the items inside were probably electronically tagged/monitored so that if they are moved the front desk know and it automatically charged to the room (WATCH OUT this is happening more and more, especially in posher hotels. Note the word moved - it can still be there but you still get charged). DO NOT under any ciircumstances use there business centre to access the internet - it is 50c a minute - you soon spend a lot of money. I ended up spending $30 over only four days. Use an internet cafe. Apart from the location the only advantage I did find was that when I came back late from a Kenny Chesney concert at Rogers Arena there were still bellmen outside both the Waterfront and the Pan Pacific across the road. The hotel is joined to the waterfront shops which has a selection of diffferent shops including a photographers, newsagents and also restaurants. The tourist infomation is also in the same building but accessed from the far side of the building to the Waterfornt entrance. For me the best thing about this hotel is its location. From here you can walk all the way to Stanley Park (or for the energetic all the way round as well). Just the walk around Canada Place and the Convention Centre is nice, with the views across to North Shore. There is an escalator entrance to Waterfornt station across the road fro the hotel entrance. From Waterfront station you can get on the Seabus to Lonsdale Quay (North Vancouver) to go to Capilano Suspension Bridge and Grouse Mountain, the Canada Line to the airport, the Skytrain and the West Coast Express to various suburbs of Vanocuver. A day pass for all buses, trains, Skytrain and Seabus, which includes North and West Vancouver costs just $9 from tickets machines in all stations. I didn't use the restaurant so I don't know what it was like.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tim064
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights at beginning of July and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Staff were very welcoming and helpful. Food and drink cost are what you expect with this star hotel. Hotel has lovely roof top swimming pool which opens at 6.00 am - handy with the jet lag!! Location was great for us, we wanted to visit stanley park and had booked a seaplane/whale watching tour, both were in walking distance. Few little coffee shops/eateries nearby. Added bonus of pick up location for alot of organised trips being just outside hotel. Short distance to city centre which is easily walkable. I spent quite a bit of time researching hotels and wasn't disappointed with my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Canada1andonly
Reviews.Content: Another very good Fairmont experience, our only disappointment was not having a room with a view. Good location in downtown Vancouver within a minutes or so's walk from waterfront, Gas Town and shopping on Robson Street. Vancouver is a busy bustling destination.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location especially for cruisers”
Reviews.Author: Canberra_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night after an Alaskan cruise. The hotel is within a 100 metres of the cruise terminal so no taxi is necessary. It's also linked to an underground shopping centre where you can also reach the underground train. Our 12th floor room was bright, spacious, beautifully furnished, sparkling clean and had a lovely view of the harbour. Dinner at their restaurant was nice but service was slow. The staff seemed pushed. Breakfast was interesting and of good quality. I would recommend this hotel for its quality and location which is right in the heart of the action in Vancouver. It's ideal for the night before or after a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with great view”
Reviews.Author: Cake7
Reviews.Content: We ended our Alaskan cruise in Vancouver and could easily walk from our ship to the hotel. We had a large room on the 23rd floor overlooking the port. The view was spectacular. Everyone from wait staff to the concierge was attentive and friendly. The flowers in the lobby were unusual and beautiful. We had a so so dinner in the dining room, but the breakfasts were excellent. I HIGHLY recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Nerad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right on the waterfront across from the convention centre, with quick access to Stanley Park and the downtown business core, and walking distance to a ton of nice restaurants. The room I had was just lovely, not too small, overlooking the waterfront and Stanley Park, and looking at North Vancouver and Grouse Mountain. Very easy access to the Canada Line train from the airport - Waterfront station is just across the street. A very nice location to stay if on business, or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: EJFelton
Reviews.Content: One of the only places a chemically sensitive person can stay without being sickened by fragranced rooms and cleaning chemicals. And the pool is chlorine free. The staff is great, most of the rooms have wonderful views, the room service is excellent. I also like the location on the waterfront and a block from downtown shopping. There is also retail and food court in lower level of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmonts are our hotel of choice in Canada”
Reviews.Author: chris528934
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel 4or 5 times now and it has always been consistently excellent. Ideally located opposite Canada Place if you are going on a cruise(as we were), it is still within easy walking distance of uptown and shopping areas. We stayed on gold level which gives you evening drinks and canapes as well as b'fast in your own lounge and a gold level concierge to take care of the nitty gritty. Food is great and rooms are comfortable. Staff are the usual fairmont mob ie very friendly and helpful. Our luggage was delivered for us to the cruise terminal and our whole stay was relaxing and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: smr01
Reviews.Content: We had a family party of 4 adults and 3 children (13, 9, & 3 years). When I made the reservation I requested a 2-bedroom suite with separate living room. The accommodation had 3 connecting rooms – bedroom with 1 bed, bedroom with 2 beds, and "parlor" with murphy bed. All of the beds were comfortable but the parlor did not have enough seating for all of us without some of us sitting on the murphy bed. The price we were quoted was the equivalent of 3 rooms, and I thought it was overpriced for what we received. We could have had 2 x 2-bedroom Fairmont Gold rooms (with access to the lounge) for less. I did not think that we had good value for the money, and the rooms were clustered around the elevator which meant that we heard the dinging everytime the elevator doors opened. The children were not allowed to sit in the public lounge because alcohol might be served, and there was not enough seating in the lobby. We arranged for a birthday party dinner in the restaurant. Because of some severe food allergies in the group we worked with the restaurant manager before hand, and ordered a special birthday cake. The food, service, and the cakes were wonderful and I could not be happier about how that all turned out. The hotel is very conveniently located and I would stay there again, but I would definitely look at all of the room options and offers to get a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has great location”
Reviews.Author: slbe
Reviews.Content: Love the different Fairmont properties. This one has an outstanding outdoor pool with mountains in the background. Staff were very helpful, great service.

Reviews.Title: “Bullseye with FW!”
Reviews.Author: bucescabana
Reviews.Content: I owe Ian P. a review, so I am late, but not that late! Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights at the beginning of June, in the city for a course, but also finishing my vacation in BC with my family. Work booked me on the Gold Floor, so the service experience was outstanding overall! Veronica the concierge was a pleasure to deal with, always helpful. The only thing I did not really enjoyed was the Lounge on the 9th floor, too small when weather does not permit to stay on the patio. As a LOUNGE, the attending crowd was taking far too munch time (reading newspapers forever) to rotate and allow the others to find spots at the tables; I found this really a negative influence in having me utilize the lounge too often. The rooms, I can say, I will be extremely interested how rooms will look like with the next renovation, whenever that will happen... because now, I found the rooms at par with the expectations of the people getting on & off the cruisers (you can not notice how the average age changes dramatically with the arrival of the ships). Even if I am in my early 40's, I can say that I peaked more at the neighboring property, newer and fancier, or the Shangri-La property. Plus there are so many other hotels in Vancouver to get the right market for the right money. Hopefully business will stay there, because Vancouver is the ULTIMATE PLACE to be! Did not have the chance to use the other facilities or restaurants, but all looked appealing... See you... next time!

Reviews.Title: “We had a fantastic time, the staff were friendly and extremely helpful always with a smile and cheerful greeting”
Reviews.Author: sean094
Reviews.Content: Stay here whenever you can for a great experiance. Ideally placed with the tours starting across the street. Perfect for the night before your cruise with luggage transfer to back life really easy and staff that cant do enough for you without being overbearing.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down best of the Fairmont group in Canada”
Reviews.Author: Cakelady75
Reviews.Content: From the moment our cab pulled up and we were greeted till the moment we were helped into our cab back to airport we had nothing but curtious and friendly. The bellmen were our first impression and it carried through to the rest of the staff we encountered. Check in was seamless and friendly. The room was a deluxe room with a wonderful view of the harbor. Clean with 2 queen sized beds a beautiful bathroom with fluffy rise for our use. The concierge were all so helpful and obliging. There restaurant recomenatins were spot on. Booked tours for us as well. We had lunch and dinner in the Heron restaurant wow! The chefs must be complemented on presentatin and taste. The dishes we had were so good. Breakfast was great as well as we had limited time and chose to eat in the coffee shop at the Heron Starbucks style coffees and morning treats. Perfect if you are on the run. Can't wait to stay here again on our next visit. Never got to use the pool facilities as it was cold during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exemplary Service”
Reviews.Author: Jonathon001
Reviews.Content: We live about an hour outside Vancouver, BC so when we go into the city for hockey games, theatre etc we often overnight. We always stay at the Fairmont Waterfront property. The service is impeccable. The staff look for ways to make your stay pleasant. For example my son is on his way to university next year. When we arrived at our room we were very pleasantly surprised to see a cake with "Good Luck at McGill" Wow. My son had his grad dinner at this property a week earlier so I guess the staff put 2 and 2 together. What a nice touch. We stay in a gold room from time to time and it's a real treat with excellent food and a huge outdoor patio. Great people, great property, great location. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “We love the Fairmont Waterfront, will be back and will recommend this hotel to everone!!”
Reviews.Author: thwerner24
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, the staff is amazing and the location is ideal!! We had rooms that overlooked the harbor and the view was gorgeous. I would imagine that the city views would be just as spectacular. It was wonderful to be able to sit on our patio and look out over the harbor, walk the gardens and view the apiaries.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and stunning views”
Reviews.Author: GastroInn
Reviews.Content: Great service, Doorman and Bellhops were impressively helpful as were reception and restaurant staff. The location is perfect right on the waterfront next to Cruise terminal so we just walked off our cruise ship and into the hotel lobby - 2 minutes! Bedrooms have stunning views, particularly liked the Harbour view rooms. Reception accommodated us early as we had come in early from the cruise. Stayed twice and bellman kept spare cruise luggage while we toured the Rockies and all reunited when we returned to stay again 10 days later. Managed to leave one item behind when we left the second time. Returned to the hotel in a hurry and the chambermaid had already spotted it and secured it and returned it promptly so managed to get off to airport without delay. Only has one restaurant option but it is very good and our helpful (English) server looked after us really well. Plenty of other restaurants close by so no real issue. Breakfast option of cooked to order or buffet so plenty of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Spectular spot.... can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: pbinney
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with the location, service and staff at this hotel! Every aspect far exceeded our expectations. The food is top notch , the staff is friendly and super helpful and they do everything to make sure that your experience during your stay is both unique, comfortable and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Excelant, can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: reedandrail
Reviews.Content: Our room on the 19th floor was everything you could want from a hotel 2 comfy king size beds, pleanty of room, nice big bathroom with good size bath and shower, towels that covered you up even if you are not a stick insect! And the view. Well what a view..... over the habour towards goruse mountin. The hotel was just as memrable as the activertise on our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, genuinely helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: ellabecca
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a wonderful 5 night stay at the Fairmont Waterfront. Our stay began with a room mix-up, which was quickly remedied with a better room and a coupon for hot chocolate chip cookies. Our room was bright and clean with a wonderful view of the waterfront. The beds were comfortable and turn-down service was provided each night. The best part of our experience was due to the incredible concierge staff. Each staff member was a joy to speak with and truly knowledgable about the area, much more so than any other concierge I have interacted with. The hotel appeared to be a popular stay for the cruise-ship crowd, so the lobby frequently became over run with guests. The building is atop of an underground shopping concourse and food court, which was quite convenient. While not in the center of the downtown area, we were located in an enjoyable neighborhood with easy access to the walking/biking path along the water that also connected to Stanley Park. Fitness Center was clean and well stocked with equipment. Its best feature is that it is open 24/7. The pool was also very nice, though with more limited hours. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks”
Reviews.Author: cclisch
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had booked a gold level room at the Fairmont Waterfront for next weekend since a friend of ours was getting married. The room we booked was nonrefundable and nonchangable. My husband's father was diagnosed with cancer last week and we knew we would not be able to make the trip. He called the hotel to see if we could possible let another guest at the wedding have the room since we realized that it was nonrefundable. The hotel management was kind enough to say since it was because of matters well beyond our control they would refund the entire amount with no penalty. Thank you. We look forward to visiting this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: BeeHYW
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, hip, stylish and gorgeous room! Walking distance to Heart of the city though a little far from Sky Train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay & location”
Reviews.Author: Montysadog
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay at the Fairmont. Room was wonderful with a view over the waterfront. Used the gymnasium and outdoor pool and were happy with what was provided. Hotel is situated perfectly for access to Stanley Park , Gastown and the shopping district.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: JodiRussAJ
Reviews.Content: I had to go to Vancouver for a conference, and my husband and I decided to bring our 18 month old along. We were worried about staying a week in a hotel with him, but the staff at the Fairmont were SO helpful! They brought us a crib, microwave, high chair, even a diaper pail -- all the baby comforts of home! The location is great; the rooms are nice and clean, and the beds are super comfortable. We will definitely being going back to Vancouver (a beautiful, fun city) and we will definitely be staying at the Fairmont when we do!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Pre / Post Cruise”
Reviews.Author: Ted_NYC
Reviews.Content: We are an extended family of 7 who stayed at the Fairmont Waterfront in late June prior to an Alaska cruise. We were so impressed with our one-night stay that we booked the hotel for a one-night stay after the cruise, even though we had already booked a different hotel. The service was excellent, the location was perfect, and the rooms were modern, spacious, and clean. Overall, we believe that we received great value for the money we paid. I would highly recommend this property. BTW - we also stayed at the Fairmont Empress in Victoria for one night (also post-cruise). That was also a good - but very different - experience. Tip - internet access is free if you join Fairmont's loyalty program (President's Club). Membership is free.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and was it worth it?”
Reviews.Author: Kentishmaid67
Reviews.Content: I was here for a week while my husband attended a meeting that was held in the hotel. If one wanted to use the Internet in your room one had to pay. In my husband's case it was free in the meeting room. For the price the hotel charges for the rooms one would expect Internet connection be inclusive. If you need the Internet go down to the shopping mall below the hotel and go to the photographic shop - they charge you $2.00 for 15 mins and are very pleasant. Our room. that overlooked the cruise ship dock, was always looked after well by housekeeping. However, one day, as I was paddling my toes in the bath, I noticed that there was a tide marke around it!!! A previous occupant of the room must have had a bath and it had not been cleaned. Overall I would say the hotel was fine but very over priced for what one got. I realise this is Vancouver but I am sure there are other hotels which offer the same kind of room, in a good location, but at a more reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking View”
Reviews.Author: Honestray
Reviews.Content: This is my second time at this hotel. I enjoy the Fairmont Waterfront for the breathtaking view of the harbour and mountains and its floor to ceiling windows. What a beautiful view to have when having breakfast and seeing Vancouver wake up in the morning with the business people taking helicopters to get to work, etc. Both my room and bathroom were larger that usual and very clean. Furniture is up to date and on the modern side. Food within the hotel is excellent. Had great tasting pacific salmon at the hotel's Herons restaurant and a very good steak through in room dining service. I also enjoy the location of the hotel for dining, i.e. walking distance to the chic restaurants in Gastown. To me, this is an ideal hotel when coming to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional, Rude and Hostile Staff”
Reviews.Author: Nailah28970
Reviews.Content: Not only didn't the phone in my room not work for two days, the front desk staff (Jane) was very nasty and unprofessional. She cost the hotel one guest (a colleague checked out the next morning and went to another hotel). Jane needs to be seriously retrained or permanently removed from working in the hospitality industry as she has left a horrible impression on the Fairmont and City of Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “A place to relax and celebrate your anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Boogalie
Reviews.Content: Location There is a Sky Train Station right across the hotel. It's just one train ride from the airport. There are lots of bus stops near it as well. You have beautiful view of the water. It is just steps away from Gastown. It's in a safe and commercial are of downtown Vancouver. Amenities I had access to the Fairmont Gold. It is located on the 9th floor of the hotel. There is an outdoors space again with beautiful views of the harbour and downtown. The fairmont gold has one computer station but there are no line-ups or anything. The lounge is quite quiet, very neat and comfortable. I didn't have time to check out the pool of gym. Food The Fairmont Gold lounge serves breakfast from 6:30 - 10 am on weekdays, hors d'ourves from 5-7pm and snacks like cookies in between. Food is served in buffet style and included in the price you pay for being in the Fairmont Gold section. Alcoholic drinks are self-served and will be charged to your room. The food was really good and satisfying especially the breakfast. Service The service is excellent. Employees are helpful, informative, and friendly. They are very helpful in directing guests to tourist spots and restaurant. They'll print out the transit routes for you.

Reviews.Title: “great location great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mad.nomad
Reviews.Content: great hotel. for conference center or for tourism let down by very slow service at the breakfast restaurant. Choose a water facing room. The Gym is small but good selection of equipment,

Reviews.Title: “First class”
Reviews.Author: rcscpstraveler
Reviews.Content: Great staff. Excellent rooms. Harbor views. Quiet and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: JECan
Reviews.Content: I am not always a fan of the Fairmont but I found the Waterfront a very nice hotel and the service was fantastic especially on the Gold floor. The Gold floor lounge and breakfast area are very nice and you feel comfortable meeting there during the day. The concierge at the desk was most helpful. The room was nice. Would like a little nicer bathtub but overall I would definitely choose this hotel for business and personal again.

Reviews.Title: “A standard conference hotel but with a great view”
Reviews.Author: SRBT
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont Waterfront for a recent conference. It is located on the water and very near the conference center so that was a positive. We were upgraded at no cost to a port view. However, there were multiple points of confusion with our reservation: they sent my roommate to a completely different room, then said we'd have to pay for both for the entire week (they eventually did only charge us with one room) and then added an extra night (also subsequently removed). I'm not sure if their systems were overwhelmed with the conference or if this is their M.O. Also, the internet in the room was not free and they didn't offer free lobby access. Regardless, nice clean rooms, attractive common areas and nicely located in beautiful Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sue M
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Waterfront is a beautiful hotel with a fantastic view of the harbor. Of course, I was on the 21st floor so my view was particularly good. Noise was not a problem so I slept very soundly. The rooms are large, clean and very well equipped. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms, the food and parking are very expensive but probably comparable in price to other hotels of this quality. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent view/location, poor upkeep”
Reviews.Author: TheRanj
Reviews.Content: Spent the night here with a few other couples to celebrate a special event earlier this year. While we were happy with the deal for the hotel, we weren't happy with the upkeep of our room. For a 5* hotel our room was not clean, and thick dust everywhere on the tables/etc. A complaint to the management their got nothing but a stock reply saying it would be better next time. For this much money I would not come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great transit hotel for Cruising”
Reviews.Author: petergarsonwest
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel's service to be exceptional - especially the service levels received from Rodolfo at the Concereige Desk.!!

Reviews.Title: “really nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: deppypung
Reviews.Content: The Farimont waterfront was a great place to stay- the room was nice, though very yellow! We had a nice view of the water, and we really enjoyed that! We had an issue with our TV, and within 20 minutes of calling to let the front desk know we had maintenance there replacing it with a new one. Very impressive! Room service food was good, and there isn't a bad menu. It was nice to come home late after the game and have some good food. My only complaint really, and it's not a huge complaint, was the poor shower. Seems kind of petty, but I like a shower with some pressure, and this was not one!!! Overall a good stay, and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location with great views over the harbour”
Reviews.Author: Steve-Rob3a
Reviews.Content: A short undercover walk from the excellent skytrain from the airport, this hotel was well located close to the cruise terminal, the historic Gastown, and a short bike ride to the beautiful Stanley Park. The hotel is very comfortable with very courteous and helpful staff. Our room was a good size with large windows providing great views over the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “too expensive and not very nice”
Reviews.Author: canadianvicky
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for a wedding last month. We have stayed all over Vancouver in the better hotels as we go there 6 plus times a year. we stayed at a Fairmont property because the wedding party was all there and it was an easy walk to the service. it is your typical Fairmont. Well trained staff and clean. the room was nothing special and the bathroom was small. the two things that really upset me and will make me not stay there again..the TV reception was very poor and NO HD! the screen was getting all types of interference and "snow" as we call it (yes I know the technical term and what causes it) Also they charged me $15.62 for internet! ..what is this vegas! all the other hotels I have stayed at in Vancouver have included internet. (Plus $32 to park my car seems a bit step as well. ) For $289 a room night there was nothing special. When they got done, nickel and diming and taxing me our room was $393.48 for the night and I could not even see the puck during the hockey game on their crappy TV service. Fairmonts are always expensive and you can stay at the same or better hotel for less right around the block..

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: Flashover1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont after arriving at the Canada Place Crusie Terminal. The ship arrived about 8 a.m. and we were off by 9:15. Walked across the street and checked in immediately. The front desk staff made every effort to accomodate us and gave us a beautiful room with a view of the cruise terminal. The bell staff were very friendly and prompt with our luggage. The room was well-appointed with extremely comfortable beds (great pillows too). Perfectly clean and updated. The location was just right for us to tour the city and close to AVIS rental car pick up the next day. We had dinner in the restaurant and were most impressed with the service and quality of food. Very expensive meal, but we thought the price was fair. Note: our only surprise was that our 8 year old daughter was not allowed in the hotel lounge area ( due to alcohol being served) so we had pre-dinner cocktails in the completely empty dining room - next to the lounge. Great stay and we would not hesitate to return even if not arriving on a cruise. It was a good location from which to tour downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet, sweet satisfaction!”
Reviews.Author: discerningdweller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here midweek for business in early January when the town was still sleeping off its New Years' party hangovers. Consequently, the hotel was nice and quiet - such that I was comp'd a free room upgrade to a beautiful harbour view room! When vacancy permits, free upgrades are permitted, which I love about Fairmont. As I had signed up for the free Presidents' Club ahead of time, I had free WIFI during my stay. The staff were supah-friendly and as a solo female traveller, made me feel safe and comfortable. I dined in the lounge one night, where the wait staff were all very pleasant and offered great service. I custom designed my own pizza, which was phenomenally tasty - perfect for a cold winter's night! I had stayed at this hotel about 15 years ago and can say that not much has changed structurally, but the decor, bedding, etc has definitely been updated, as with the televisions. I'd return for the location, service, facilities and view!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not superb”
Reviews.Author: sbkPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice but not worthy of the same rating as a top hotel. I arrived late last night, and was handed keys at the entrance as a "President's Club member." The keys hadn't been activated, however, and didn't work in the door. Room is nice (nice size, room has side view of water. . and air conditioning equipment on roof next door). No separate shower. No bathrobe. Called to ask for the New York Times to be delivered in the morning, and was told it can be obtained by walking to the Pan Pacific Hotel across the street. (Message to self: I should have stayed there!) At 6:30am, the alarm rang. I guess management doesn't instruct cleaning staff to turn alarms off when people leave. I'm hoping the rest of my stay is smoother.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - but wifi charges are disappointing”
Reviews.Author: WendyAM
Reviews.Content: Arrived late on a weekend evening. Checked in fast and went to my 17th floor room. It was huge. Corner room, with fabulous views over the bay one side and the city the other. Huge bed with great pillows and linens. Good sized closet and drawers, TV, refrigerator, good sized desk/chair and armchair. Bathroom well equipped and a good size. Make up mirror with light, hairdryer, soaking tub with shower over, plenty of towels and bathrobe. Good quality toiletries. Safety deposit box in room. Good lighting. Everthing about the room was great....except the charge for wifi. I hate having to pay for wifi - if smaller, cheaper hotels can offer it for free, I fail to see why higher end hotels have to charge for it. And not only was there a 13.95 dollar 24 hour charge, but it was per IP address. I had an iPad and a laptop with me - luckily, I realized and didn't incur almost 28 bucks a day for both of them. If you're a couple staying and have separate devices, these charges would add up. These days, wifi should be a hygiene factor and not an add on. The other thing I'd have changed is the policy re changing linens. I was careful to hang my towels up so they didn't replace them each day (to save water and energy), but then I found a small card, on the third day, on the nightstand over the far side of the bed which said if I didn't want clean linens every day, then I should put the card on the bed. It was such a small card that I hadn't seen it among all the other pads, pens, booklets, etc. They'd be better off actually putting it on the pillow for a guest's arrival. I hate wasting energy and having had clean sheets every day was unnecessary. The staff were all very friendly and the one time I used room service, I was pleased the tip was included in the charge and the person who brought it refused my offer of a tip and told me I'd paid it already in the charge. The room was tucked away in a corner and I didn't hear any noise from other guests, either through walls or the usual foot-fall in the corridors. I didn't use the spa, gym or swimming pool but it all looked well equipped. The location of the hotel is great - just across the road from the waterfront, and about half a mile's walk to Stanley Park, where I hired a bike for the afternoon. The Convention Center is a two minute walk away. There are fast food outlets, coffee shops, a nail bar, and some other souvenir and gift shops beneath the hotel, and access to the Skytrain, which takes you to the airport within 25 minutes. All in all, I couldn't fault the hotel on comfort of stay - but the wifi charges really irritated me. I don't get that I can pop next door to Starbucks and use theirs free for the price of a cup of coffee, but several hundreds of dollars of room charges at the Fairmont Waterfront and they still want me to pay extra for wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Canadoc
Reviews.Content: I am a picky person. I expect excellence and this hotel delivered. I was at a conference at the Vancouver Conference centre which is just across the street. I looked at the options and chose this hotel although their Pacific Rim hotel sounded nice as well and is just around the corner. I drove right up to the entrance for valet parking. It cost around $50 and was good until 6 pm the next day. This was perfect because I checked out, went to the conference and then walked back and got my car. The bell men were awesome. Attended to me right away. When I checked my car out they even asked if I would like some bottled water for the ride. The lobby is gorgious. High ceilings. Perfectly designed. The checkin was efficient. The check in woman was pleasant and helpful. I got a room on the 17th floor with a harbour view. The floors are triangle shaped so there are three view options. I could see the whole harbour, North Vancouver, and part of Canada Place. The room was lovely. Clean. Tidy. Well furnished. Comfortable bed. Nice bathroom. Lots of little touches . Mini bar etc. I got room service . I think I gained 3 pounds it was so good. Nice sleep. Quiet rooms. Easy check out. Everything was great and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “What a great Experience”
Reviews.Author: joshbash
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 great nights. Everything clicks here. From the front desk to the concierge, to the views. Great location, accessible to the waterfront at Canada Place, the Convention Center, SkyTrain and SeaBus, the West End and Gastown, etc. Enjoyed the jacuzzi and the pool, even though temps were pretty cold for this Floridian.

Reviews.Title: “luxury”
Reviews.Author: kennyaberdeen
Reviews.Content: Excellent base to see beautiful Vancouver. Hotel offers all you'd expect from a 5 star establishment

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Choice”
Reviews.Author: BigPl8Man
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights while in town for a conference. The hotel is essentially what you would expect from the "Fairmont" brand of hotels. It is well appointed and most of the finishings are high-end and high-quality. The best feature of the hotel is the location. It's right at Canada Place, which makes it perfect for just about everything in the city. The standard rooms are standard "business" style rooms. They are clean and have comfortable beds, although the room I had was starting to show its age. The curtains were very old and in need of replacement. That being said, the hotel is excellent in all other ways. Great service, great location, and decent food options inside the hotel. If you need a large fitness center, then this is not the place for you, as it only has a very small fitness room with a handful of machines.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service, Great Food, Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: dezignerfb
Reviews.Content: We were in Vancouver for a couple of days to do some shopping and I had a business meeting to attend. The Fairmont Waterfront was our choice because of location in the downtown sector. From the greeting at the front door to our leaving we were impressed by the quality of service, cleanliness of the hotel, atmosphere and professionalism of the staff. What impressed us the most was the Herons Restaurant staff. I have a onion allergy. When I mentioned this to our server she said she would tell the kitchen. This happens quite often when mentioning my allergy. What does not happen is when the server came back she brought the chef to talk to me. After a short discussion he said he could adjust my entree choice with no problem. He also went through the trouble of creating a salad for my appetizer choice that was no longer on the menu. I have eaten at a lot of high end restaurants (and not so high end) where they have been very accomodating for my allergy but this was the first time the chef actually came out to talk to me about it. KODOS to the server and the chef for going that one step further. I can't say enough about how impressed my wife and I were for the level of service we received during our stay at the Waterfront. All round service, quality of food, great atmosphere, fantastic view from our room will bring us back again to the Waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Service Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: Bossnass
Reviews.Content: The staff went out of their way to make my birthday a very special memory. If you are privileged enough to stay at this establishment, be certain to see where they keep their bees. The staff are attentive to detail and are concerned about the comfort of their patrons. I highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: GMI54
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Hotel Waterfront is located next to the harbour in the centre of Vancouver. The Convention Centre is next to the hotel. My room was spacios but it sould be refurbished in the next time! One can see everywhere that the hotel is not any more the newest. Furthermore, the quality of the breakfast was only standard and it seemed to me overpriced!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay again”
Reviews.Author: sharpee2
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights for a conference. I thought the concierge was exceptional. Gala Dinner in main room was unreal. Room was always clean and great location to convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: claw73
Reviews.Content: We chosed a harbour view room at this hotel for one night for the ease of transfer to Whistler via Pacific Coach, who picks up at the hotel. Although the older of the two Fairmont hotels at the Waterfront area, we could not fault it for its excellent location and the brilliant staff. Sure, the decor may show a bit of its 20-year history but the lobby was regal, the room was beautifully appointed with the most comfortable beds, and they would fit 2 queen-size beds in there for 2 adults and 2 children (ours were 13 and 10). We used the pool and hot tub (heated and pleasant even with the freezing weather). We had a lovely drink at the lobby bar, tended by a very knowledgeable and friendly bartender. I would thoroughly recommend the buffet breakfast which came with our package. The staff could not do enough for us, and our children felt very pampered with all the attention. We had made-to-order pancakes in addition to the whole complement of hot and cold breakfast items. Well done for making our stay so welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at Vancouver Waterfront”
Reviews.Author: VCG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at the Waterfront at Canada Place. I landed after a tiring long haul cross continental flight and decided to take the cab to the hotel. Costs about $35.
