On return I took the Canada line train back to airport. Cost $3.50. The train station is less than a 5 minute walk from the hotel. So if you dont have too much luggage take the train. Takes as much time and cost 1/10th. Hotel lobby was nice, nothing great. Check in was smooth. I had a corner room at the 21st floor that gave me views of both the city and the harbor. Room was huge. Good size bathroom. The only small issue I would have would be lack of eating option in the immediate vicinity but nothing is more than a 5 buck cab ride away. As I was an elite member got free internet which normally costs $13.95. The only small tip I have is about the Wall Street Journal. Unless you tell them it gets automatically dropped at your room door. They charge 5 bucks for a 2 buck paper. Found this unnecessary. Remember to tell them not to give you the WSJ and you are fine. The room cost me $199++. Considering Vancouver waterfront this rate was not bad. There is a brand new Fairmont 2 blocks from this one, Pacific Rim. Looked a lot more modern. But was a lot more expensive also. Overall if you get this hotel for 200 or less its surely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views”
Reviews.Author: Jargoni
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay here. The room was very comfortable, and a had a great ocean and mountain view. The restaurant was good (had both dinner & breakfast). Location's nice for walking trip in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay! A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: docojos
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Fairmont Waterfront last Feb. for 4 nightts because she attended a conference in the nearby Convention Center. To start with, the location is EXCELLENT. a few steps away from the convention center and if it's raining, there's a tunnel that connects the hotel to Canada Place just across, which then has a connecting tunnel to the Convention Center. Gastown and downtown are adjacent to the hotel, as well as the Skytrain from Vancouver airport, which also has access from the lower ground of the hotel. The seabus is also nearby. There is also a very good food court at the lower ground of the hotel. Now on to the hotel itself. The staff, from the concierge to the front desk to the housekeeping staff were very friendly and efficient. Kudos to the restaurant staff. who aside from being efficient and friendly (and generous with the blueberry pancakes!), were very attentive during breakfast. The hotel room was all right, at par with other rooms from similarly classed hotels in terms of amenities,but definitely bigger than the rooms in Pan Pacific across the street (maybe even almost double the size), where other delegates from the convention stayed. It was clean, cozy, and the bed was very comfortable. We had a good harbor view. The bathroom was clean, and bigger than what I saw in some of the photos posted by others. There was a mini-bar and fridge in the room. Internet seemed to be a bit expensive though, but good thing we enlisted in the President's club, so we were able to get it for free. Never got a chance to try the pool or fitness club. Maybe next time. As a whole, I strongly recommend this place. We had a very comfortable stay and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Best of a fabulous bunch!”
Reviews.Author: littlesnowcub
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived at the Fairmont Waterfront I was treated like a princess. Impeccable doormen only too happy to take care of my luggage as I arrived early. Friendly front desk, gorgeous hotel lobby. Herons Bar and Restaurant lovely place to relax during lunch. Room was on 11th floor with spectacular harbour views. Super friendly housekeeping and Royal Service. Brought me an adaptor and toothpaste at no extra charge as had forgotten my own! (oops). Food in Herons on evening very tasty and homemade honey custard ice-cream to die for. Very helpful concierge on making my way to the airport....all in all a FANTASTIC stay. Thankyou again Fairmont :)

Reviews.Title: “Not really a "Fairmont"”
Reviews.Author: doeskin
Reviews.Content: Not sure what others are seeing in this hotel and we are normally fans of the Fairmont group (we have stayed (9) nightsat various Fairmont hotels so far this year 2011), but this particular hotel does not meet up to normal standards. Architecturally speaking this hotel was designed from the outside in; meaning, room layouts and interior spaces are awkward at best. The bathroom in our room has a "cheapo" white steel bathtub and "cheapo" 4" ceramic tiles ... the kind that you find in a Super 8 or similarly priced hotel. There was mold in the shower, funny patchwork caulking and a variety of water diversions in an attempt to correct architectural desigh failures. Other than the broadcasted Faimont logo amenities, one would not know this is a Fairmont hotel. One other interesting feature of this hotel .... Parking is an additional $43.00 per night ... interestingly this is for the valet service only .... the fine print on the claim check states that the hotel takes NO responsibility for the vehicle and that it may actually be PARKED someplace out ON THE STREET. You discover this as you read the fine print on your claim check. Even at $259 per night, we expect more than this hotel can provide, particularly, when everything else is an add-on (bottle of water $6.50; parking at $43/nite) .... check out the base boards surrounding the server stations in the Heron restaurant during the daylite hours .... at a place that achieves $50+ for breakfast for two??? Not sure what others are seeing ... this is fairmont by name only. We should mention, The housekeeps are delightful; the front desk at checkout is up to par; the doorman are pretty busy joking around with themselves and seem not to notice the guests coming and going ... the front desk at check-in is marginal.

Reviews.Title: “Good For an Overnight”
Reviews.Author: RobynPringTravel
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in a Fairmont I didn't like. The Fairmont Waterfront in Vancouver is no exception. The staff is wonderful, and well organized. The hotel offers good food and lovely views of the water. The location by Gas Town is the best thing about it. We were able to easily explore both Gastown and Chinatown on food from the hotel and the trolley for the hop on hop off tours stops right across the street from the hotel. Generally, I like hotels with a lot of character and charm. This hotel is a pretty standard, modern business hotel, which is not my favorite. Rooms were a little on the small side, and decor is nice, but minimal. The Fairmont makes up for it with the location and friendly staff. We were only here for one night and found it perfectly comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: killipfamily
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel a number of times and we are always impressed with the service and the welcome we receive. The staff are always polite and extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in lovely city!”
Reviews.Author: McClures
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in the Fairmont Waterfront on arrival in Vancouver. Check-in swift and pleasant. Room on 7th floor overlooking the city, extremely clean. Due to the time difference to the uk, we woke early so ventured to the outside pool by 6am, which was a plus! Health club was great, could have shower in changing rooms as it had all the extra amenities needed. Buffet breakfast was enjoyable. Big thank you to Elizabeth for her excellent service and enthusiasm. Would stay here again no problem! Hope we have the same pleasurable experience at the Chateau Whistler next Friday.

Reviews.Title: “Quality”
Reviews.Author: Goldlox1969
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Canada and stayed at the Fairmont for a couple of nights. The location is very nice - close walking distance to both the city centre (for shopping) and the historical foreshore area (for restaurants). While we had an initial hiccup with our rooms (we were given a room right next door to the gym and pool area - with a common area out front that we didn't like due to lack of privacy) - we were able to move to a different location (albeit it with a bed that folded down from the wall). Overall the hotel was excellent - as were the staff For restaurants - we stumbled accross the Water St Cafe (Gastown - over the road from the Steam clock). Initially it looked a bit fancy for our family of 5 (mum and dad and 3 kids) - but they were very accomodating with excellent Italian food and great friendly service. We also went to Granville Island and tried the "Sandbar" restaurant - or something like that. Also highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “A retreat in the big city”
Reviews.Author: TravelMynx
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Waterfront Vancouver lives up to the Fairmont name. A modern looking building just minutes away from the waterfront train station, it was very easy to get to from the airport. The staff was courteous and quick checking us into our room and asking if we needed any help with our bags. Upon entrance to our room we were greeted with a large floor to ceiling window with a view of Vancouver's downtown. Our room was a double non smoking room with crisp looking inviting linens on the bed and a flat screen TV. The rooms were quiet allowing us for a wonderful nights sleep in the most comfortable pillow top beds adorned with a plethora of different pillows allowing us to find the perfect one. We had joined the Fairmont Presidents club, and were treated to free wi-fi and a news paper in the morning. The hotel offers complimentary in room coffee and tea. Would we stay here again? Yes. We were a short walk from Fabulous dining and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scooterguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before a cruise. I made a reservation directly through the hotel's website, booking a city-view room. At check-in, I asked if about the possiblity for an upgrade to a harbor view. Unfortunately, there were none to be had without a charge. However, the nice desk clerk offered to put us in Room 416 which is a corner room and had windows on both sides. I accepted and when we entered the room, we were like "WOW"! The room was huge, as was the bathroom. We were extremely pleased and had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: westcoast_canada
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the property for four nights over the New Years period. The hotel was excellent, room very spacious, clean, comfortable furnishings, pleasant decor and well appointed bathroom. The service from the valet, bell persons and front desk was phenomenal! We both spent plenty of time using the fitness facilities. Enjoyed the hot tub, steam room and outdoor pool even though it was a little chilly. Herons serves great Martini's and the hotel boasts a central downtown location. I would highly recommend this property to others.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travellingcutie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont Waterfront this weekend on a one-night getaway from our kids. We took the Skytrain to the Waterfront station and were happy to see that the hotel was right across the street. Check-in was easy and our room was even ready at noon, three hours before check-in time. The lobby was beautiful, our room was clean and nicely decorated, and we were pleased with everything. After checking in to the hotel, we took the Skytrain back to the shopping district to walk around. The main shopping area is within a kilometer (0.6 miles) of the hotel, so not a long walk, but if the weather is bad (as it was for us), it's a quick train ride away. We had breakfast at the Heron's Restaurant included in our room package, and enjoyed that as well. The food wasn't anything too special, but was nice and there were lots of options. The service at the restaurant was very nice and we felt well-taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for the trip”
Reviews.Author: DofSales
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to attend a function at the convention center. Had a nice room, well appointed. Nothing special for the price paid. Seems like more you pay for a room, the less you get, had to pay for internet, bottled water, etc. Don't get me wrong, the hotel was very nice, rooms comfortable and staff very accomodating. The fintess room was well appointed, apprecaite the great selection of equipment, spa, pools, steam rooms, very relaxing after a long day, good work out. Food pricy, but it is what it is. There is a convenient food court right next door, and pubs with good food near by within walking distance. Nice hotel, good staff, would stay here again in a heart beat if need be.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - great service”
Reviews.Author: MadaBill
Reviews.Content: We were at the end of our holiday, had two days in Vancouver before flying out, made a great choice on this gem of a hotel, got a signature room overlooking the harbour and close to most ammenities. From car valet and check in, laundry service and conceirge knowledge everything went well. Food at breakfast and dinner was fantastic. We went out as well as stayed in but the venue would be ideal for business people wanting to stay over here No complaints at all regarding this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Pros and cons, but fantastic view and location”
Reviews.Author: wifitraveller
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the location as we were attending a trade show across the street. There was lots of shopping and restaurants within walking distance. We had Fairmont rewards which allowed us free Wi-Fi, courtesy shuttle and phone calls. We enjoyed the jacuzzi and steam room, but it was a little chilly for the outside pool. The view from the 23rd floor was amazing! Cons: room was very stuffy and dry, shower didn't work the first day, housekeeping walked in without knocking, our door was left unlocked after hk had been there and some of our clothes were misplaced in storage. Pros: check in/out was fast, staff was courteous and helpful, they allowed us to leave our vehicle there for 6 hours after checkout, comfortable bed, very clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Prebbletonite
Reviews.Content: Check in was very efficient and although we were early for check in they apologised for our room not being ready and gave us another on the gold floor. Room 0802. The room was small slightly dated but the view was there and having the added bonus of the gold floor amenities certainly made up for any space lost. It was the service given to us on this floor that made this hotel for us. The concierges could not have been helpful, friendly and very effecient. The service they gave us was unbeatable in all my travels. The location of the hotel cannot be beaten either, the waterfront is just across the road, so to the skytrain entrance 250 mtres away and Gas town around the corner. We did not eat at the restaurant itself but did have room service one evening, which was fairly average food wise, but it was fast and once again came with the best of service. This hotel stood out for it's service and it's friendly atmosphere and we look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “They have thought of everything”
Reviews.Author: pepperr
Reviews.Content: It really is a wonderful place to stay on business - and I suppose leisure but I have not had the time to do much exploring. I definately would return!! Ask for a port view room - well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: andycoaching
Reviews.Content: We had our first 3 nights in Canada at this hotel. Check in was quick and efficient. The room was spotless and well equiped, however there was a "Romance pack" with goodies like wine and snacks etc. What came as a surprise was that hidden within the pack was a contraceptive, which may prove to be embarrasing to anybody sharing the room with their young family.There was agood supply of cofee and different teas, however as any tea drinker will tell you Coffee mate is no substitute for milk, why not have the small pots of milk instead of the coffee mate which I thought went out of use in hotel bedrooms in the mid 80s. Our main reason for staying was that we had a 3 nights for the price of two through our travel company if booked before the end of march. All in all a good hotel but nothing stood out for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good waterfront location”
Reviews.Author: Pinner Traveller
Reviews.Content: We spent our last 4 nights here at the end of our British Columbia and Montana holiday. It is every thing you expect from a Fairmont and this type of hotel in such a location - it felt more of a business than a leisure hotel. The new Vancouver Convention Centre is just across the road and some of the 4000 lawyers attending a conference were staying in this Fairmont. The hotel was, however, very good. Service was always very friendly, helpful and efficient though a few more staff on the Front Desk at check-out time would be useful. We only ate in the restaurant twice - once in the evening and for Sunday Brunch both of which were enjoyable with well cooked food and the brunch was particularly good value. Finally, the hotel is well located for many of the city’s sights and the excellent Vancouver Visitor Centre which is almost next door.

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be deceiving ...”
Reviews.Author: actionj007
Reviews.Content: Being a high-end hotel at the breathtaking view of the water ... expectations of this hotel was higher than usual. The hotel lobby was typical and the rooms were quite dated. I felt like I was in the Motel 6. We had breakfast at the restaurant which is nothing to write home about (well maybe here ... hahaha). Overall experience was so-so.

Reviews.Title: “if you like a room with a view....”
Reviews.Author: kare789
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Vancouver the day before our cruise departed. We took the sky train from the airport and it was a very short walk- downhill- with our suitcases. We arrived early in the morning and we were allowed to check in at 10 am. Can you imagine! We had a signature king room. There was a floor to ceiling picture window in the bathroom and 2 floor to ceiling picture windows in the bedroom area, which was very large. The decor wasn't cutting edge modern, but it was very nice. I literally went on a mission to try to find a spot of dust in the room, and I failed. I have never seen such a clean hotel room. The coffee maker consisted of a kettle and a coffee press instead of the usual little coffee pot. We thought that the hotel food prices were expensive, so we had supper at Gastown and breakfast went to the food court beneath the hotel for breakfast- where there are many options available. The next morning, we just sauntered across the street and boarded our cruise ship.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: happyroo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night prior to leaving on a cruise from Vancouver to LA. The location is perfect as you are directly across the street from the port and the hotel will take your bags and check them into the ship for you. The hotel is a short walk away from Gastown (we had great food at The Steamworks pub), not far from Pacific Centre Mall and Robson Street for shopping (15 min walk). We were on the 22nd floor Port side so we had a lovely view. The room was a great size ...ours had a king bed that was very comfy. Had a desk with internet access, if you are a member of the presidents club internet is free otherwise there is a daily rate. Other than a large stain on the carpet in the foyer, the room was spotless. The bathroom was large and functional. The fairmont provides the usual amenities...my husband likes them very much, I find the smell of the shampoo & soap more ...masculine? We had forgot a few essential items and there is a little mini mall in the basement of the hotel where you can pick up anything you need. There is also a food court down there. We enjoyed cocktails one evening in the Heron's lounge, servce was pleasant, ambience was nice and the snacks we ordered were very tasty. Transportation is convenient there...you are across the street from a skytrain station that can take you to the airport and taxi's are always available.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: ken07641
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Waterfront for 3 nites, Wed, Thur and Fri nights. The Hotel is at the Vancouver waterfront across from the Pan Pacific Hotel and adjacent to Gastown and Harbour Center and within walking distance of many attractions and many eateries including SteamWorks and Old Spaghetti Factory. The high-rise hotel has a very spacious, impressive entrance & Lobby and a (pricey) Restaurant with a rooftoop outdoor pool and indoor hot tub and workout area. Excellent rooms & ameneties, clean and nicely decorated hallways and a city view or harbor view. Staff was friendly and courteous. Pricey unless you score one of the internet-advertised specials. The hotel is about a 20 minute ride from the Airport - we used the fixed-rate $39 towncar service that has a contract with the Airport (there also Taxis and train service direct from airport to station adjoining the hotel!). Watch for 3-nite specials, internet specials and Manager's specials on the Fairmont website. For Cruisers the Hotel is across the street from Canada Place Cruise Terminal and will take your luggage to the cruise ship and check it in for you. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for convention/ cruise fellows”
Reviews.Author: juzatourist
Reviews.Content: It's just across the street from Canada Place and the Vancouver Convention Centre (East and West), so it's definitely the place to stay if that's where you'll be. The rooms are fairly large, some with nice views of Canada Place. Amenities are typical, though I was missing a hairdryer. They brought it up when I rang about it. I didn't have any major like or dislike about the place, though some of my companions find the rooms a little old. It generally worked for me. The only issue is if you'll be in your room in the day; do expect to hear the cruise ships, helicopters and sea planes quite a bit. I can imagine it gets fairly noisy (and crowded) during the peak season. The upside is you get a pretty good view of the harbour if your room faces it. At the basement of the hotel is a small mall with book shops, food court with McDonald's. Across the street is Starbucks, and a short 2-min walk away is the Waterfront train station. 5 mins away is Gastown with its shops selling tourist paraphernalia. Downtown shopping is about 10 min on foot. All in, fairly convenient if you'll be at Canada Place.

Reviews.Title: “Smart, business orientated, city hotel with value niggles”
Reviews.Author: AlanE53
Reviews.Content: Spent our final three days of our three week vacation in and around Vancouver in this very smart establishment. Everything one would expect from this level of hotel, Efficient, attentive and knowledgeable staff. Spotless rooms etc, but not unlike many hotels geared mainly to business clients that I have stayed in over the years. Not quite 'on the waterfront' - the Convention Centre and another plush hotel are across the street and literally on the 'front line'. The value niggles are the cost of breakfast - equivalent to an evening meal in decent restaurants, expensive wi-fi and use of PC's (although I was able to access and print my airline boarding pass for free) and the cost of telephone calls - even for toll free numbers and even more that the cell phone companies roaming fees!! Excellent position for walking the harbour walls, getting to the heart of downtown and transport links - particularly the Seabus and the Skytrain to the airport

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, personal service - would like to return”
Reviews.Author: Alex69
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay then came back for a further 5 night stay on this holiday. We were very fortunate to have a room on the gold floor and we cannot fault the warm, friendly and attentive service we received from all the staff that dealt with us. There was always someone available at the desk if you had any sort of query and we could not fault any aspect of the service we received. There was always a warm and personal greeting (but not intrusive) when we visited the lounge for breakfasts, canapes and general relaxation. As for a previous comment suggesting that other hotel guests not staying on the gold floor were using the free breakfast facility, I cannot understand how this can be true. The staff in there know all the guests personally and it's a really intimate lounge area that does not accomodate hoards of people. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and they were able to provide us with realy helpful info on how to get the best out of the city including the best way to get to the various attractions that Vanvouver has to offer. Our room was spacious, quiet and had a great view of the Canada place area, we thought the free breakfasts really tasty and we did use room service dining for a couple if meals when we first arrived and thought the food was delicious. The housekeeping team keep the rooms in top notch condition and were always very attenentive if you needed anything. We were particularly impressed by a chap called Nick who came chasing down to the ground floor taxi area as we were about to leave for our next destination. He had found my husbands i-pod adaptor and had run down from the 9th floor to return it to him. We found this was another indication and reinforcement about what a great team they have at the Waterfront. We have stayed at another 5 star hotel in Vancouver and would choose the Waterfront over that hotel any day! We would love to stay here again if we return to Vancouver, I hope this is not too far off.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel spoiled by the details”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Fisher
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Canada we stayed at a number of Fairmont properties. They were all luxurious, as expected for the price. However they all (including the Waterfront) had a number of irritating factors which spoiled the pleasure of staying there. Internet - when cheap motels offer free broadband, it is no longer acceptable for hotels to charge for this service - especially not at the inflated rates charged by Fairmont. Internet is an essential service for travellers these days, and should be included gratis. Television - for some reason, the Fairmont properties have some sort of proprietary TV service which was accessed via a difficult to use menu system. It was just irritating. Then to cap it off, our TV got a Windows error and rebooted! Fridge - I wanted to keep my bottled water cold, but the fridge was locked! Apparently you have to go to reception and swipe your credit card in order to get the key! This is just ridiculous. In summary, these are some fine properties, but are spoiled by these unnecessary complications. I'd rather stay somewhere cheaper but friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it for the view alone...!”
Reviews.Author: Baillie3370
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights before going on an Alaskan cruise. The hotel is ideal if you are thinking of staying somewhere before cruising as it is directly opposite the cruise ship docking area. I upgraded to a deluxe portside room and the view was fantastic. I looked out over Canada Place to the harbour - lovely weather made it even better! The room was as expected for this standard of hotel - clean and plush, (the fluffy bathrobes added that extra touch) large flat screen tv and plenty of storage. The hotel is right next door to a food court so no need to worry about breakfast or snacks and the city tour bus has a stop just outside. Also the tourist information is close by so no excuse for not knowing what to do or where to go..!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, efficient and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Zeddog
Reviews.Content: Fast and efficient President's Club check-in (join up online for free and avoid the lines at checkin at any Fairmont - worth it for that alone !!). Nice rooms, comfy pillows and beds. Great shower. Very helpful concierge and bellboys. Nice restaurant/bar. Decent location near Gastown and the Waterfront district. Recommended :)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Grover3175
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Fairmont Waterfront at 1.00am after a tiring 20hour flight from Melbourne Australia. We had requested a fairmont room on level 12 or higher for the views, when I asked at the desk which floor we would be on we were told we had been upgraded to gold class on level 12, this included a free breakfast each morning of our 6 night stay, access to the gold class lounge and patio with free soft drinks, tea & coffee and free wifi for our laptop.The service was faultless and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. This was a great start to our 5 week holiday in Canada & USA also a perfect location if doing the inside passage cruise and gas town.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: australia3491
Reviews.Content: We booked the fairmont gold package and stayed two nights last weekend. What a disappointment. For over $400 a night, we expected more. The gold level rooms are on the lower floors, 8 and 9, and are not high enough to have a great view of the harbor or city. No wifi in the rooms, for a hotel this new and rated this high I was a little surprised. The Gold room hosting free breakfast and afternoon cocktails was a circus. Although it is supposed to only host guests from the 8 and 9th floors it seemed most of the hotel stopped with with their kids for free breakfast and cocktails. We skipped it and went to cactus club up the street (fantastic by the way). The exclusive concierge was rarely at their post at the gold room as well. After complaining, the manager did offer us free breakfast on the ground floor the last day, but $40 in credit doesn't really fill the deficit. For all you fitness gurus, the gym is halfway decent for cardio. good new cybex machines, but only free weights to 45lbs.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous everything!”
Reviews.Author: jennie-jay
Reviews.Content: Luxury hotel right across the road from the cruise terminal. Breakfast buffet and Sunday brunch absolutely superb - fairly expensive but excellent value when you consider what was on offer. Staff brilliant, nothing was too much trouble - exemplary service throughout. The best hotel bed I have ever slept in and the pillows were indescribable!

Reviews.Title: “Eco-friendly. Gay-friendly. Everything friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Crazyladybird
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here on our honeymoon for a few nights and were really impressed with our experience. We were upgraded on both our outward and our return trip and were left complementary chocolate strawberries and a welcome note in our room, which was a nice touch. The rooms are nice (but not as amazing as you would perhaps expect) but what set the hotel apart was the excellent customer service that we received. Everyone - from the hotel check in desk, through the staff at the rooftop pool, to the concierge - was extremely helpful and pleasant, which really made our stay. We were impressed with the effort that the hotel chain was making to be environmentally friendly and also found it to be gay friendly and very welcoming. They had even changed the "his and hers" robes and slippers to "hers and hers" robes, which showed an amazing attention to detail and set them apart from everywhere else we stayed. The hotel was in a perfect location opposite Canada Place and we had a great view of the Canada Day celebrations when we arrived. We would stay here again, without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect much and you won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: garyfong
Reviews.Content: Last time I was reserved at this hotel, the front desk staff was so frustrating that I went out to the valet parking to cool off. I asked the valet attendant if the service was always like this, and he discreetly said, "you'll be happier next door". and I checked into the Pan Pacific. We stayed here this time, and despite being Fairmont President Club (whoopee, free internet but no WIFI-just wired, newspaper) and an Amex Centurion cardholder, we got the worst room with two double beds. This was our 3rd anniversary celebration trip. We asked the front desk if there were any Kings, and if you go to a Fairmont hotel, get used to the answer being, "no". All the time. And get used to sloppiness with the details. They will forget things. A lot. No minibar key. Room service with one set of one fork missing. We got upgraded to the club floor. This hotel is like a business class hotel without WIFI. The beds have some kind of lumpy topping that makes your back sore. Desk with a plug in the lamp that doesn't work. Fairmont is an odd chain. Beautiful properties and oddly aloof service. Some people try hard to be pleasant, but it's not consistent like at a Four Seasons. The feeling you get at Fairmont Hotels is, "it's a privilege for you to be served by us"

Reviews.Title: “The Fairmont is ready for room update”
Reviews.Author: matissegirl
Reviews.Content: The Farmont is a very beautfiful hotel. There is no spa at this particular site. the Concierge staff was top notch and planned several flawless day trips for my family. Our rooms (2) included breakfast. It would be $52.00 for the buffet otherwise. Our room had a lovely, but smallish marble bath, but our rooms needed new upholstry adn carpeting. Large flat screen TV's were nice at night . Views of the harbour were amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Paolo55
Reviews.Content: As advertised, the Fairmont Waterfront has a water view of Vancouver Harbor. It's obstructed by the Pan Pacific Hotel at Canada Place directly across the street. No matter, I had a lovely view and could watch the float planes taking off for parts north and west. In fact, we took one such plane to Vancouver Island to visit Victoria. (Unfortunately, our first attempt was canceled due to fog; and our successful attempt landed us in the provincial capital just in time for rain.) Service at the Fairmont is spectacular, with faultless and enthusiastic service from Lucas at the Concierge desk. In-room breakfast was delivered fast and drinks at the bar down in Heron's had cheerful bartenders. The expensive parking (we had a rental) was handled with a smile, as well. All in all, a 5-star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: debs0712
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel. Staff was very friendly and efficient. Loved the apricots that they put out for all the guests in the afternoon. Breakfast buffet was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: Worlwide
Reviews.Content: This Fairmont is exactly the kind of expensive hotel one expects to find next to a conference centre in North America. It is a clean, nodern and nicely decorated high rise, and rooms have views over the busy harbour. The rooms are large, athough with limited drawer and cupboard space, but are well equipped (lovely smelling toiletries!) and include tea and coffee making facilities, hairdryer aand iron and ironing board. No line to dry clothes though. The people on reception were bubbly and helpful as were the concierge and bell hops. The buffet breakfast was good, and there is an outdoor pool, and a gym. One big gripe... Despite the fact that this is an expensive hotel, there is no free wi-fi, and the connection is very expensive. Take a tip from me. Blenz and Starbucks are both just across the road. Enjoy a coffee and get your internet accesss free!

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont - whats all the fuss about”
Reviews.Author: JaniePet
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and was led to believe that it was one of the best hotels in Vancouver. Having stayed in hotels all over the world ranging from bed and breakfast to 5 star this was one of the most average hotels I have ever stayed in. On our last night we stayed at the Best Western and it far outwayed the Fairmont especially on value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but you pay to use Wifi”
Reviews.Author: CriticP
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very comfortable and the staff very helpful but the management need to get into the 21st century regarding internet use. We travelled for a month in Canada and stayed at 9 hotels. All of them except the Fairmont had free wifi. They wanted to charge around £10 for 24 hours. I had to use cafes. All of these had free Wifi!!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: spagirl42
Reviews.Content: nice room, comfortable bed, clean. Nice staff. GREAT LOCATION WITH WONDERFUL VIEWS-- THE BEST IN VANCOUVER not the most luxurious but worth it for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: ivanrmcc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three weeks during the 2010 Olympics and even with all of the extra crowds this place functioned perfectly. Wonderful beds !!

Reviews.Title: “aperfect answer to a small crisis”
Reviews.Author: toneydolls
Reviews.Content: We had planed our trip to Alaska (for our 50th Anniv) starting with a 2 day layover in Vancouver. Upon arriving at baggage pickup, we found that my luggage was not there. Lost again!!! This was the 4th time the airlines had lost "my" suitcase. The problem was, we were just starting a 3 week trip. We arrived at the hotel very stressed to say the least. Every one connected with the Fairmont tried to put us at ease. Our room looked out over the cruise ships docking slip. It was clean and confortable. The personel at the front desk rounded up items for me to use, then made sugestions as to what we could go see and where to eat. My suitcase was delivered at 3am. It was delivered to our room at 6 in plenty of time for our first tour

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not superb”
Reviews.Author: Lindalouwho0
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a corner room on the 23rd floor (room 2307), which is one of the rooms shown on the hotel website. It has two huge windows on two different walls, so the view from this room is spectacular. You'll see mountains and water in much of the direction you look, but the Pan Pacific Hotel was erected so that you also see that as part of your view. The style of the rooms is slightly bland and dated, and the bathroom could definitely use some finery added to it, i.e., the bathtub sits amidst tile placed in such a simple and slightly haphazard way (it is not expensive tile, but looks very inexpensive) that it is not a great "bath experience" if you like to sit and soak in the bathtub for any length of time. Basically the staff was very helpful and accommodating and the first day we arrived we gave the concierge a hard time trying to figure out what we were going to do that night, and they kept their cool as we called them a number of times and asked a lot of questions (this was a last minute trip for us so we were not the most organized). That said, one of the concierge staff told us there were no sharks in the water because the waters were too cold for sharks (there are five different species there) and another told us there were no ferries in Vancouver! I know why he said this, as the ferries don't run directly from the waterfront, but the "sea bus" does, which is really a ferry that looks like a bus. We were watching the "sea bus" go out into the water as we were talking on the phone with the concierge who insisted there was no ferry. I think the concierge folks are not trained as well as they could be -- generally young and a bit green. Also, the hot tub is not usable. It is indoors, and has two doors on one wall of the room it is housed in that lead to outside where the pool is and are clearly meant to be open for ventilation purposes. We went into the tub and our eyes were watering horribly within one minute due to the chlorine in the air in the room. We called the front desk and asked if they could open the doors up, and were told they wouldn't do that anymore because someone accidentally walked into the tub from outside and didn't see it there, so it had now been deemed a security problem to open the doors. When we said there was no way to use it because it was a health problem with the doors closed, we were told that it is going to be remodeled in A COUPLE OF YEARS and that maybe by the time we came back it would be better. Terrible. For a $300.00 per night hotel, the experience in general could use some upgrading, but overall, not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning views, but resting on its laurels?”
Reviews.Author: majelperth
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Waterfront hotel in Vancouver has been around since the early 1990s and has one signal advantage over many other hostelries in the city: it is (nearly) smack bang on the waterfront, with stunning views (for most patrons) over the harbour to North Vancouver or east to Burnaby. This view is especially good from one of the expensive corner rooms (the best are the signature room in which I stayed on this trip); but they are probably quite good from the others too. Because it has a great view, and because it is right opposite the Canada Place Cruiseship Terminal, it is a hotel commonly used by passengers after or before a cruise. In our case, it was a post-cruise, single-night stay to stretch out the holiday one day longer. This situation - the view and the cruise-line association - presents the challenge of the Fairmont Hotel: yes, it is a very good and the view is great, but, it feels like a hotel that knows how good its view is, knows that passengers will stay there a lot as part of pre-arranged package deals with cruise ships, and has just lost that special something needed for the hotel to really earn top marks on consistent service and real 'welcoming'. Here is a really good example: There is a $4.50 tray charge on room service - OK we have just about accepted this as regular hotel travellers - but there is a required 17% gratuity. Sorry, but this is not a gratuity: it is 17% on top of theprice. Either let guests tip the wait staff, or put the price up. The breakfast menu for in-room dining is confusing and expensive - one cannot have cereal as part of the continental breakfast - one has to have it separately, for another $6.00. Toast costs $3.00 (and so on). And there is a tray charge for breakfast - even though, usually, this is not the case. Yet, when the breakfast arrives, it is lovely, elegant, beatifully presented and the 17% gratuity would be fine, since the server was really good. Therefore, the hotel's problem is that it wants to be 'great' but has to keep reminding guests, in little ways, the 'great' costs a bit more. Personally, i'd pay another $5 pp for a breakfast without the niggles and wouldn't even notice. (But, they forgot to deliver the newspaper!) As another example: we arrived to discover only 1 robe was in the room; as if by magic, another one appeared from housekeeping without us even asking - great! But, then someone attempted to clean our room at 10 am on the day of checkout (which was 12 noon) and, 5 minutes later, her colleague barged in looking for her. While the concierge, bellhops, and 1 of 2 front desk people were super friendly, the turndown housekeeper was peculiar - which leads me to another point. There is a little card in the hotel room saying that housekeeping is only available from 8 to 4, but if one needs a refresh or turndown, then please contact reception. Since we were there for one night we decided not to have turndown service (since we were just relaxing in our room): yet the person came knocking wanting to do it?! Ultimately, the Fairmont *IS* a great hotel: luxurious and well appointed, nice touches, great location. It is doing a very good job of being a 5-star, opulent hotel - BUT for whatever reason - perhaps its business model, perhaps the issues relating to cruise line packages? - it undercuts the opulence with a rather picky feel to it - like the little signs, the extra charges, the overall sense that, at times, you just need to wait in line until the hotel gets to you. Perhaps, too the Fairmont struggles to be price-competitive and thus tries to maximise inhouse revenue for lower-cost rooms? Only because there are better hotels in Vancouver - the Delta for example - and the Pan Pacific is more convenient from the Cruiselines, I would not recommend the Fairmont - a tough call and one I hope it can fix, since it has great promise as a very good 5-star hotel. Just needs to start acting like one :).

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Imbatman
Reviews.Content: I had the honor and priviledge of staying at the Fairmont Waterfront last week for 4 nights and really appreciated the extra steps the guests took to ensure a great experience. All of the ladies at the front desk were plesant, confident and capable of making decisions. I also really enjoyed the Bell crew. I had the chance to interact with a couple of them and really felt like these guys were paying attention. I was pretty impressed with Bogdan's ability to remember my name and some of the restaurants I tried while in Vancouver. I realize there are systems and mechanics behind this kind of delivery, but I'm impressed with the intent behind those processes. I had the breakfast buffet everyday and I felt there was an appropriate amount of repitition and variation. As a hospitality "geek", i really enjoyed seeing the herb garden on the 3rd floor where they keep the bees. I now have a really cool and unique story to tell my friends about my trip to Vancouver. I even received a small jar of honey when I arrived from the guest services team. Thanks for contributing to a great vacation

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: whammers29
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights after a cruise that finished in Vancouver. You just walk out of the cruise terminal and there it is, accross the road. Service here was great from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. The bell boys couldnt do enough and the receptionists gave us great advice on where to go and what to do. The hotel is in a quiet part of the city but a 5 minute walk and you are in the middle of everything. Word of warning, dont bother with the red trolley tour. We paid a fair amount each for a trip that should have lasted until 6pm. At 5.10pm the driver parked up on a street in the gas lamp district and said his shift was done and basically dumped us all on the street. We had to walk back to the hotel which was a fair walk. Not impressed with that at all. Granville Island market is a must, some amazing food there, bread, cheese, meat, olives, cakes. We went there and got a picnic and then went to Stanley Park to eat it. What a great thing to do. You can also hire bikes in Stanley Park. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “I love staying here... beds are THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: gourmettravelmama
Reviews.Content: Service is always outstanding ! The beds make you almost not want to leave the room but Vancouver has so much to offer! I have never had anything negative to say when staying here and I love coming back each time! The location can not be beat and there is FAR less traffic in this hotel compared to the Pan Pacific across the street

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: maldivesod
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific hotel. I had a standard room and it was VERY spacious, spotless, and very nice decor. Comfy bed. Nice city views as well. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Great location, directly across the street from Canada Place for a nice walk, and an easy five minute walk to the Skytrain station to catch the Canada Line to the airport. I would not hesitate to come here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: wileytravel
Reviews.Content: Love the view. Close enough to walk to all my business meetings and some great restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Never disappoints”
Reviews.Author: CheltenhamLarry
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel, in a beautiful location, in the most wonderful and hospitable city in the world. Stayed here often and never want to leave. The friendly staff and the expertise of the chef made it difficult to leave the hotel even though Vancouver is my very best place to be with so much to do and see. Thanks to all at the Fairmont for yet another fantastic stay, you will be seeing us again soon.

Reviews.Title: “What a view! 3rd time's a charm at the Fairmont Waterfront!”
Reviews.Author: GM33
Reviews.Content: If you get a great rate like I did, do not hesitate to stay at the Fairmont Waterfront particularly in their deluxe corner rooms. With floor-to-ceiling windows on two walls, I was treated to spectacular north and west views of Coal Harbour, Stanley Park, the Lions' Gate Bridge, the North Shore mountains, and the snow-capped Lions (mountain peaks). I was pleasantly surprised that the photo of the room on their website actually matched what I found. In addition, there's a huge window in the bathroom with just as great a view as the main room. Just a warning for light sleepers... you will hear the seaplanes taking off starting around 7:00 a.m. but that comes with the territory with staying in any hotel in Coal Harbour. On my first trip I had a room with a city view. The room was nice and spacious, and everything you'd expect from a high quality hotel like the Fairmont. On my 2nd trip I had a partial city and partial water view. Both experiences were great. But if you're in a position to pay a little extra for the corner rooms when you get a deal, it's well worth it! In addition, the service was impeccable and all the staff were very pleasant. They pay attention to the little things like making up the room at the most convenient time or setting up the table for room service breakfast comfortably at the window so that I could enjoy the view (far cry from some other hotels when they plonk down a tray balancing awkwardly off the desk or side table). Finally, the location is unbeatable... across the street from Waterfront Station so you can easily get to and from the Vancouver airport by skytrain, short walk to Robson Street (shopping) and Stanley Park, 5 mins away from the seabus to North Vancouver. You can get to all the important places by walking or by using the skytrain. The one small downside... I wasn't able to get late checkout to 1:00 p.m. but I just used the hour to walk around the seawall before taking the skytrain to the airport to catch my flight. I will definitely be back to this hotel in the future!

Reviews.Title: “wow, great service, great views!”
Reviews.Author: littlemisscontent
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the Fairmont Waterfront. The staff were extremely helpful and we loved the hotel as soon as we pulled up in the limosine from the airport! (Limo's from the airport in Canada are so cheap!) Room: We were upgraded as part of our honeymoon, we got a corner room with a rounded window, views of the water and also the mountains and the city. The bed was plush, beautifully decorated and huge! We were so comfy getting rugged up every night in the flufffy quilt and gazing out the window to the beautiful city lights. The bathroom was great, very large, with a shower over bath, but still with all the amenities you could want. The room had loads of storage and plenty of space. It was really well decorated. Gym: Not state of the art but did the job. I used the weights, sauna (eucalyptus steam room!!!!) every day and the hot tub. The pool got use from other guest but us Aussies thought it was just plain freezing! Restaurant: We didn't dine here but from others we heard it's great! Food in the local area: We loved the japanese place that the concierge actually drove us to in Gastown, it was upstairs and cheap with loads of food and wine... great Christmas Eve! Our all time favourite was Steamworks in Gastown. Great food, generous serves and great home brew! They also sell coopers pale ale in the bottle shop next door! Other than that we ate out at a "fancy" place suggested to us by a younger hip concierge, and though we got smashed on vino, cocktails and shots, we spend around CAD$260 and didn't really rate it too highly over other places. We also ate at Grouse Mountain in the pub, which was extremely yummy, with the best views of Vancouver, and other than that stuck to basic food. Vancouver seemed a little bit of a sleepy town, not somewhere you'd go looking for "nightlife" and a night out dancing till dawn. It's cosy, safe, and great value for money with great service. Hotel in general: they were lovely enough to give us high speed internet access for free in the business centre every time we wanted it. I think this was becuase their normal service was down. They also were helpful with our questions as to what to do, where to go and where to eat everyday. Given we were there for xmas break, we didn't realise a lot was closed down! Great hotel though, and so happy we stayed their over the original Fairmont!!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at It's Best”
Reviews.Author: EdmAng
Reviews.Content: Of course, you can expect nothing but the best from the Fairmont. It was my first trip to Vancouver, and I was there for the Olympics! The rooms were modern, and spacious, not like the other Fairmont's I have been at; older rooms, and quite small. We were in a hospitality suite for some of our meals or in the restaurant, and the food was excellent, and the staff were top notch. I always try and use hotel workout facilities, as I figure I have no excuse not to work out when it is only a few floors below! The equiptment was all up to date, it wasn't a large area though. I love the ladies locker room; they have all the ammenities to shower and get ready for the day, and my favourite part of course is having a steam after! I was sad that their outdoor pool was closed during the Olympics, as I guess it is pretty amazing. I would definately recommend this hotel, it was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel,I want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Deanfrank
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August for a few days. loved it, great location, lots of great restaurants close by, staff was great, very friendly and helpful, would love to go back on business or leisure with my wife.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: FotiniPatris
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Clean. attentive staff. comfortable. Nice office center. ocean view. great location next to robertson for shopping & restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Party central”
Reviews.Author: redrider4545
Reviews.Content: Was great place and fun location near the center of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great people, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Jameslb
Reviews.Content: Visited Vancouver at the start of our honeymoon and stayed here at the Fairmont Waterfront. The review title says it all really! We got upgraded to a corner room which had good views of the waterfront - definitely recommend these rooms for the views. Note - you will hear the planes and helicopters taking off and landing along the water from around 7am. Didn't bother us, but something to be aware of. We never ate dinner in the hotel, but the breakfast is good, as is Scoozis just up the road (a recommendation from the concierge, who along with the guys on the door were very helpful with advice). We also enjoyed good meals also at Backus (French), Miku (Sushi/Japanese) and Kamei Royale (Sushi). Also, suggest hiring bikes and taking a ride around Stanley Park - happy days!

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: Emmasthomas
Reviews.Content: Over the last 4 years I must have stayed 100 nights or more here and always been blown away by the service and standards. Yes I got bored with the room service menu after a while but then they offered to make any dish they had the ingredients for, yes the TVs in the cheaper rooms are 'only' about 28" but why go to a hotel to watch telly? I did once have a faulty bed side light (which was quickly fixed) and three fire alarms in all my stays but all in all it's probably the best hotel in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Fairmont stay”
Reviews.Author: Siun
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights at the Fairmont Waterfront and booking another stay shortly. Great hotel with the stellar service I've found at every Fairmont. Room spacious and comfortable, housekeeping checked on most convenient time to clean which is wonderful when working in your room, room service was tasty and so nicely served and the location convenient with metro right across the street and taxis always at the ready. And as at all Fairmont's, the staff makes the experience - the bellman even tried to turn down a tip after arranging a taxi, holding and then loading 3 rather heavy suitcases ... these people know how to do it right!

Reviews.Title: “December in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: alexgwatts
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 15th Floor of this hotel with a partial harbour view. Very comfortable room with all the usual comforts. WiFi was not available although you could use the internet if you had a pc. I only took my iPhone and so would have prefered WiFi access. Restaurant was very good, the food was delicious and very nicely presented. We had a delicious bottle of Canadian wine from a list that was dominated by wines from BC. Conveniently located for all public transport this was a good choice of place to stay in the city. I don't think that there was anything that I did not like about it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good service”
Reviews.Author: 66mercgirl
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and a good size, nice view. Decor is sort of dated...doesn't look like they've changed much since it was built. We got a corporate rate and felt it was fair, not sure I'd want to pay full price. Excellent location- walking distance to everything, although we didnt walk much as they provided us with a chauffeured car at no cost, we were spoiled! I guess the guy had no bookings that evening so they gave us the car and driver when we asked for a cab. Nice upgrade! Only major complaint was the hot water in our room was lukewarm at best, although that must have been a localized problem as our friends in the adjacent room had hot water so we showered there in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “always excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: polybear720
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Waterfront is one of the jewels in the fairmont crown; great service, rooms are good, one bedroom suites are excellent, excellent food and ideal location and views. I always look forward to going back

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at the Fairmont.”
Reviews.Author: robinavirk
Reviews.Content: It was a great location; water views and downtown experience. It was fabulous. The room was well decorated, clean, and had everything that we needed for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay there just for the experience - then stay elsewhere....”
Reviews.Author: Duchess333
Reviews.Content: The famous Vancouver Fairmont is a gorgeous, landmark hotel known from all over the city for its teal green aged copper roof towers. Steeped in history from all the stories it holds think of 'the shining' for hotel feel and grandeur along with the white gloves and top hatted greeters and doormen as you pull up to check in or arrive back from a day of shopping/walking the traveller friendly downtown core. We travelled for a 3 day weekend from Victoria having just moved to BC from the eastcoast. Shortly after arriving with our teenage son and 11 year old son a knock on the door and a white gloved silver tray of chocolate chip cookies and large glasses of icy milk for the kids (lucky them! no fair!) - - even the teenager didn't complain about the snack for once.....the room was small and not at all what we expected. The bathroom was vintage with porcelin tiles and sink and what looked like original faucet fixtures which was charming but the low tub with no character just didn't impress along with the skimpy sq footage in the bathroom also. We didn't have enough drawers or closet for all of us to unpack properly so it was definately cramped but once out of the room the hotel offered lots of free roaming and wandering with no boundaries except the gold floor which needed a card to access. The pool was less than I'd expected after the grand entrance and priority treatment you receive during check-in but it was lovely to have the terrycloth bathrobes to return to our room in instead of traipsing waterlogged in a towel too small to dry you off or being forced to change in a sterile locker room. Overall the stay was lovely but when you're staying in a city and exploring the area the amount of time in the room is usually minimal. For our family we have 'been there. done that' - and won't return to the Fairmont Vancouver largely because of the tiny rooms and high prices they charge simply because they can............fyi their sister hotel in Victoria, B.C 'The Empress Fairmont' is equally gorgeous and we stayed there for a low rate of 89.00 in the spring compared to the 169.00 we paid per night in Vancouver - larger room in Victoria but again disappointing room (dust galore) and property itself had visible cobwebs and dust in the main walk-through areas which I thought was unacceptable but for that price I wasn't complaining.

Reviews.Title: “No Hot Water...Little Sympathy but otherwise Okay...”
Reviews.Author: marac
Reviews.Content: Hard to be forgiving when there is no hot water in your room not one day but TWO days. Surprised that there was little or no sympathy given this is a high end hotel. offered a breakfast as a way of saying sorry. Sorry but the response after being told of SECOND day with no hot water. "Well I think you are the only person who has complained." Umm is this a Motel 6? Perhaps the local staff were feeling gloomy given the depressing weather Vancouver was having that week. I've been to this place a few times..so was suprised with the latest treatment. This comes on the heels of my summer visit when we booked a non-=smoking room but were given a smoking....by mistake. I wonder how prepared these Fairmont people really are for the coming Winter Olympics. Hello Fairmont training department?

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ABCinATL
Reviews.Content: I've been traveling for years on business, and the Fairmont Waterfront Hotel in Vancouver strikes me as the standard business-class hotel. Typical furnishings that are of a nice quality, nice towels, etc. Room service was tasty and quick, but pricey (typical for room service, though!). The restaurant downstairs served a nice breakfast, and I was seated by the fireplace. The lobby and restaurant overlook the waterfront so it was a nice, cozy morning. My room did not have a water view, rather, it overlooked the city. Obviously I would have preferred the water view, but it didn't really bother me too much. It was pretty quiet, I don't recall hearing other guests, but I did hear the elevator some, but not enough for me to ask for a different room. The bed and linens were very comfortable. Most of the time when I went by the concierge desk there was no one there. I had to stand around a while 2-3 times waiting for someone to help me. The location was nice, you can walk along the seawall all the way to Stanley Park. The conference center and cruise ship terminal are literally steps across the street. There is a food court in the basement complete with a mini-mall and post office. Overall, if I were paying out of my own pocket, I'd probably opt for a cheaper hotel in the area, but for business travelers you will find it to be sufficient for your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: 2W3
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Waterfront is a contemporary hotel on the waterfront in Vancouver, BC. Most rooms have great views of the bay. It is within walking distance from most of the tourist spots, shopping and restaurants, but it is located a little off the main routes. This affords you a little peace and quite, but results in a little longer walk to most sites. The Hotel is modern and very well appointed. The lobby is tasteful and the staff is friendly and professional. Breakfast was served in the hotel restaurant with great views and terrific food. Again, the staff was quick, friendly and professional. Each employee with whom I dealt knew the hotel, the area and was openly willing to help. The rooms were very comfortable and our room had a great view of the bay. It was large and very tastefully appointed. The bathroom was large and two people could easily function in it. Overall, I had a great experience at the Fairmont Waterfront. The Hotel is very well appointed, the staff is extremely helpful and professional and the location is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: iwrileyi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the second time this year. This hotel is so convenient for almost everything in Vancouver. The staff are extemely helpful and the rooms are clean and comfortable. Breakfasts are great

Reviews.Title: “Lots of bloat, very little substance. Not worth the price at all.”
Reviews.Author: Desespoir
Reviews.Content: This hotel is actually the reason I started booking my own hotels and getting reimbursed as opposed to having it done for me. I never want to stay in this place again no matter how many stars they claim to have. I would rather stay at a Best Western with free internet. The room itself was okay, but everything was average or below average...at best. And I hate places that charge for internet and claim to be good for those travelling on business just on principal.

Reviews.Title: “Dated decor”
Reviews.Author: BusterCT1K
Reviews.Content: Some floors are nice, but I was in one of the unrenovated floors with dated decor that was not good value for money. Paid through the nose for a last-minute room. Also very odd that the Gold floor is the ninth, when the hotel goes all the way up to 23. Free highspeed wireless internet in the gold floor lounge. Could not get wifi in my room. Small swimming pool. Excellent breakfast in the Gold lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: foubi
Reviews.Content: We attended a wedding at the Fairmont Waterfront and thought that the hotel was beautiful. There is one restaurant which is open, not very cozy, but great buffets with large and delicious selections. The hotel is located on the water, but it was easy to walk all over Vancouver from this location with restaurants and shops just 2-3 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Fun for a family or a parents get-away”
Reviews.Author: visitor_13_9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a wonderful week alone in Vancouver. I had never been there and truely did not know what to expect. We stayed at the Fairmont hotel at Canada Place. The hotel was very high end and had a wonderful pool, hot tub and exercise room. Overall the service was very good unless you had a problem. We found them to be very poor when dealing with any problems. As would be expected at a high end hotel, everything cost extra, and was far overpriced. Though it was a nice hotel, I would not stay there again due to the prices and the service breakdowns when presented with problems. Our friends that stayed across the street at the Pan Pacific had a much better experience and I wished we had stayed there instead. The city overall was an unexpected surprise for me. There was so much to do! I could have spent the whole week just exploring Stanley Park. It was beautiful. We were lucky to be visiting in the early summer when the outdoor activities were at the peak. I found myself walking all around just exploring the beauty. There were hundreds of amazing restaurants withing a couple of miles (we walked everywhere). Gastown was full of those wonderful restaurants. Though we went as a getaway without our kids, I found myself noticing how family-friendly Vancouver is. There is a plethora of activities for families and I cannot wait to bring our children back there in the future. I am already planning our next trip! Don't miss visiting Vancouver-it is a beautiful destination!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to stay while in Vancouver, BC”
Reviews.Author: travelersabcd
Reviews.Content: The Fairmount Waterfront was a perfect location. We were only there for one night so we wanted to capture as much of the city as we could. This was a great location without having to drive. You can get on the "train", walk or we even borrowed a bike from the hotel and rode along the waterfront and around Standley Park. Restaurants and shopping are so close and it was a safe environment. The hotel had spectacular views as we watched the cruise ship depart, a platoon plane land and just people watch. Easy to find and the accomodations were wonderful

Reviews.Title: “That's What I call excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Ira w
Reviews.Content: The service was perfect! We were welcomed as soon as we arrived and given valuable information about the hotel and surrounding area. When we arrived in our room, we were in awe by the views. We would like to find something to suggest that they improve other than the cost, but in this case, this is an excellent value and I would go there antime. They make you feel special. Other hotels should study them and try to mimic the way they treat guests

Reviews.Title: “Be wary of this property”
Reviews.Author: teeitupbarrington
Reviews.Content: We were seeking an upscale hotel for a night before a train ride and three night stay in Whistler Canada. Booked the top of the night room, which was supposed to have a harbor view. Upon check in we were offered a room with no view on the third floor. The hotel is on a busy street, so passed on that. Was told our room would be ready in about an hour and left our cell phone to be called when it was. No call. Stopped back at he desk in an hour, and the room was ready. Our luggage was brought up from having been checked with the bell captain. Zippers that were not open when we claimed our bags at the airport were partially or fully opened, and the contents of the luggage were messed up. The room itself was, disappointingly ordinary. For $350US per night, a disappointment. The area surrounding the hotel was full of people begging for money -- even coming up to you at Starbucks or as you sat in a nearby food court. People in the street were also aggressive about asking for money. Did not feel safe in the area. The hotel was filled with many people on tours or cruises.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Standard”
Reviews.Author: TravelLoadsLondon
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, friendly staff and comfortable rooms but boy do they sting you on the internet charges (C$14.00 per day) and printing costs (C$0.5 per page) and the business center is only open 0830 to 1630....just when I was out at meetings! It is a good business hotel for location and comfort but they should review their charges.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ukkylie
Reviews.Content: Considering the 4 star rating, I expected a little more than what was provided. Our room had 2 'over size' double beds, though to me they appeared to be double beds - no internet without a surcharge in a hotel that is designed for business and higher class travelers. Staff were friendly, but overall the highlight was Tim Hortens in the underground food court.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service, good food”
Reviews.Author: GaryJordan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated for the cruise terminal opposite and for long scenic walks along the seawall to Stanley Park. We stayed in a harbour view room which was nicely appointed and a good size but the view wasn't really of the harbour, more Canada Place, the cruise terminal and another hotel. The room was recently decorated, a bit old fashioned perhaps, but it was in keeping with the place. Food is excellent and service good. They even have a couple of complimentary bikes that you can use to ride around Stanley Park if you book them in advance.

Reviews.Title: “5 star without the stuffiness”
Reviews.Author: E&JJJ
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel through Virgin holidays. Not quite sure how much we paid, but on arrival we were told we'd been upgraded to a portside view room. The view was fantastic. The beds were very comfortable, the bathroom, one of the best we've ever had. The lifts were fast and there were plenty of them. The reception staff and concierge very helpful. Can't fault the hotel.It's quite a hike to Stanley Park from here but it was worth the walk. We also took a Greyhound to Whistler ...again, worth a visit..but get to the bus station early. If we ever return to Vancouver, we'd certainly choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: sfconsultant
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont Waterfront Vancouver for the start of an Alaska Cruise. The Fairmont Hotel room was included as part of the Regent Cruise package. Very convenient location for a cruise - literally, across the street from the port. Plus, they take your baggage for you to the trip - this was a great service. As for the hotel itself, was a bit 'old school' for our taste. The front desk check-in staff was nice, however they did not have a King Size room on a higher floor, as requested, available. This was dissapointing, however we were given a King room on a lower floor with a view of the ocean. Room was pretty boring - nothing incredibly special in terms of furnishing. However, the bed was comfortable. Buffet breakfast was included, which was very nice with great service. If I had the chance again, I'd choose a different hotel that was a bit more modern and had nicer rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings...”
Reviews.Author: love2traveltogether
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I recently stayed at the Farmont Watefront hotel while vacationing in Vancouver BC. We were really looking forward to our stay there as the hotel site makes it look like a phenomenal place. Upon arriving we were greated by Gonzolo a wonderful Bellhop who was attentive to our needs the entire length of our stay. We then went to the front desk and were advised that since we were Gold Level Members we would need to check in on the 9th floor in the Private check in. That was very nice and made us feel special. The desk attendants were extremely helpful and friendly. We were told that our room would be 806 one floor down and that breakfast was served daily at no addiitonal charge in the Gold Floor lounge. We were then asked if we needed help with our luggage which we did not and took the elevator one floor down to our room. This is where we became a bit disappointed. The room is nice, however we have stayed in many other hotels, paid a lot less and had a much more spacious room. It was not the end of the world because we did not plan to spend too much time in the room but we were very surprised by how small the room was. On a posiitve note, the bathroom was huge and it was nice to have some space to get ready in (minus the freezing cold floors-they should offer slippers instead of robes in the room). Another positive was the view. We had a harbor view which was spectacular. Throughout our stay the staff were all extremely helpful and attentive. The lounge is wonderful to just have some tea and relax on a rainy day. The breakfast was good but we only ate there one day. Gonzalo was wonderful giving us tons of directions the whole time we were there and at the end of our stay he got us a limo that cost us only $15.00 to get us to the Amtrak terminal. Heron's is the hotels restaurant, we were going to eat there but when we saw the price for dinner we decided to go elsewhere. We were willing to spend the money but Heron's to us seemed more like a breakfast or lunch restaurant, not a dinner restaurant. Over all our stay was nice at the Fairmont Waterfront, but due to the cost of the room and the smallness of it, we probably would not return. There are many other hotels in the downtown area that we can stay at that are close to the accomodations at the Fairmont Waterfront without the high price attached.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Fairmont Waterfront!”
Reviews.Author: vinceg89
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont Waterfront in Vancouver on June 12 before going on a cruise to Alaska. The Fairmont Waterfront is truly a 5 star hotel. It’s was fantastic! The location is perfect. It’s in front of the Pacific Ocean and the cruise port is just on the other side of the street. If you can afford it, the Fairmont Waterfront is one of the best hotels in Vancouver. HOTEL PUBLIC ROOMS AND AMENITIES: The Fairmont Waterfront has stunning public rooms. The lobby is magnificent. The floor is made of marble and the high ceiling gives the lobby an open atmosphere. Herons restaurant is the hotel main restaurant. I just eat there the morning of the cruise and let me tell you that the food was delicious and the service was very professional. The breakfast buffet has a lot of selection to choose from. The chef can even prepare you a specific omelette if it’s not available in the buffet. The fitness center is not very large but the equipments are new. The pool is located on the roof of the hotel on the 3rd floor. The pool is not very large but at least it’s heated and the views of the Ocean are excellent. HOTEL ROOM: I stayed in a port side deluxe view room. The view from the room was spectacular because I was able to see the cruise ship arriving in port. The room was very large and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was nice with big, fluffy towels. The TV was not flat screen so that was a little disappointing for a hotel of this class. Overall, the room was really nice with great beds and great views from the floor to ceiling window. SERVICE: The staffs of the Fairmont Waterfront were really nice and professional. The front desk employees were friendly and efficient. The service in the Herons restaurant was attentive and courteous. Overall, all staffs were friendly and professional and really give the guests the 5 star experience that Fairmont hotels are known for. OVERALL RATING: I give the Fairmont Waterfront 5* out of 5* for its great amenities, large clean rooms and attentive service.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Canukgal
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved everything about this hotel---quiet, comfortable, beautiful beds and pillows, great food and service. Enjoyed our harbour view. Would stay here again in a hearbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Waterfront very nice”
Reviews.Author: dspolett
Reviews.Content: Big room, or maybe it just seemed that way after getting off a cruise ship! Very nice, quiet, clean and nice view from 7th floor window looking out over water. Good location as there are some "rough" parts of Vancouver and some of the major chains are in them so know what you are doing. Very close to gas lamp district which is pretty and has lots of restaurants and not bad walk to art museum or main shopping street , Robson I think is the name. Not too terribly far from China town but you need to get good directions from someone who knows area because if you get off track you are in the undesirable part of town with lots of aggressive panhandlers and such.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Vancouver and the Fairmont Waterfront”
Reviews.Author: VacationFunintheSun
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Waterfront exceeded our expectations from start to finish. I emailed in advance asking for early check in due to our flight times. When we arrived at 1 pm our room was ready. We were given a room on the 5th floor with king bed and an amazing view of the harbourfront although we did not pay for this.
