We could see the cruise ships come and go from our window! The room was a good size, modern furnishings, kept very clean and was very quiet and peaceful. The hotel pool (outdoors) on the 3rd floor is fantastic - there is a view of the harbour/mountains and also a small bar providing drink service. There is also an indoor hottub beside the pool. We used room service once and the food was great. We did not use the restaurant in the hotel. There is a shopping center connected to the hotel with a food court and a really nice diner called Ricky's that we ate breakfast at. Much cheaper than the hotel restaurant for breakfast. For those looking to sight see in Vancouver I highly recommend the Vancouver smart card. It gets you into the major tourist attractions and is quite a $$ savings over paying for each attraction separately. We booked through Expedia and they provided excellent service. The hotel is in an excellent location right on the harbour within walking distance to many attractions including Stanley Park. We used the local transportation and it was fast, efficient and easy to use. Membership to the Fairmont President's club is definitely worth it - it is free and gives you free local calls and free internet. Would definitely return to Vancouver and to the Fairmont Waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Average, boring, overpriced...big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: francophileguy
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vancouver. The city was beautiful, but this hotel is barely average. First, I booked non-smoking, but I when arrived I was told that they don't guarantee "non-smoking". They only note the request. Huh? Who even smokes nowadays? Its banned at most other upper class hotels (of which this Fairmont was not). Next, this hotel is located next to a big cruise dock port so you get a bunch of average folk bedding down here before their ship departs. There's always tons of ugly luggage/suitcases piled up in the lobby waiting for the bell men to store. Not a very classy welcome. The hotel has ZERO personality. No sense of character. No sense of style. Very "plain Jane/ vanilla". (Is this a symptom of Canada in general?) The concierge service was highly variable. The man from Spain was very good, but the woman with the English accent was terrible--lots of attitude. I asked her to book me a ticket to the Shakespeare play. She acted like this was a big hassle and taking up too much time for her. The room was a left over from the '80's. Old carpet, dirty windows, horrible ventilation. AC was on but never really got cold. Old coffee pot with coffee press in room. Odd choice. Bed was decent. Minibar was good. Phones were touch tone 1980 style. Bathroom was merely average. Conference room was plain and average. Very disppointed with this hotel. Not worth the money. Lots of improvement needed.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience”
Reviews.Author: LMC55
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in a waterfront deluxe room booked thru Victoria Clipper. The view was nice but the window needed cleaning. Good sized room. The bed was on the small side for a queen. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The concierge helped us plan our day with maps and useful advice. The hotel is located right next to a train station so you do not need to rent a car. We took the seabus to Capilano suspension bridge which was a fun experience. Close to the waterfront although it's about a 30 minute walk to the wonderful Stanley Park.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: laurielooEssex
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in June. Yes, the position in the harbour is good and the staff are friendly enough on arrival and during the stay (although one waiter at breakfast was far too overbearing, explaining what the butter was for and other useless comments). Also, do book the bed and breakfast rate as its well worth the additional cost when booking on line. However, the hotel needs a real makeover (once the new Fairmont opens a few blocks away, it doesnt stand a chance). It seems some of the 'top' hotels in Vancouver think that if they erect a modern looking entrance to the hotel, guests wont notice the rest of the hotel hasn't changed since the 80's. The communal areas are nice enough but the corridors and rooms (I went in 2 different ones) are so old fashioned. The curtains and drapes in our room were threadbare in part. The windows needed a good clean, inside and out. The bathrooms certainly hadnt been changed for years and years and were small by comparison to other hotels we stayed in BC. Simply, Its just not what you expect for £200 a night. We were upgraded (Presidents Club members) so we are grateful for the better view, but the beds (as per another review I read) were tiny by North American standards. A real shame as we have come to expect a lot from the Fairmont Brand.

Reviews.Title: “Sets the benchmark for 5 star hotels”
Reviews.Author: Trev01
Reviews.Content: This superb hotel sets the benchmark for 5 star hotels. A shiney modern hotel with all the best and latest facilties, spotlessly clean and run to the very highest standards. My wife & I rarely return to hotels as they never seem the same or as good as you remember, but this one is outstanding, we have been to this hotel 3 times now and plan to return again, it’s so difficult to find fault with, everythng is well managed, from efficient check and check out to the notes left in the room from the maid as well as personnaly addressed weather forecasts. The staff are all the friendliest in the business and can’t do enough for you. Fairmont Presidents Club; well worth enrolling in this free loyalty club as you get immediate benefits such as free broadband in the room, morning newspaper, preferential room rates, upgrades and discount vouchers for hotel dining and spa. Location; set in a prime location and as the name implies it is set on the waterfront directly opposite the Canada Place Convention Centre, Pan Pacific Hotel & Pier where cruise ships birth. There is a fantastic view from waterfront facing rooms, you can watch float planes taking off & landing, cruise ships arriving and leaving and all kinds of watercraft buzzing about, never a dull moment. Convenient for those on business and perfect for tourists, being near the main shopping areas, will be well used for the 2010 Winter Olympics as it is close to the brand new grass roofed Convention Centre which will serve as the Olympics Media Centre. Fairmont is building another hotel directly opposite the media centre, so there may be some spare capacity after the Olympics are over and prices may drop. Convenience; all of the major tour coaches and operators pick up and drop off at this hotel using the hotel layby. There is also a small shopping mall and food court under the hotel as well as a Translink rail station. Rooms; standard rooms are of good quality and reasonable size, cheapest have city view and if you aren’t bothered about the view then these are perfectly acceptable and represent good value. Next up are the Harbour and Waterfront View rooms which are basicaly the same as the City View rooms but have superb views of the harbour, some rooms have floor to ceiling glazing. Next up are the suites, we had a waterfront facing suite for one stay which had separate lounge & bedroom, TV & CD player in both areas and the loan of some CDs. The same high quality toiletries are used throughout the hotel regardless of room type. Restaurant; we used Herons Restaurant for breakfast & evening meals which serves the second best buffet breakfast we have ever had anywhere (the Fairmont in Banff will take some beating and needs to be seen to be believed). You will be addressed by name at Herons. As with all good quality hotel restaurants they cook eggs to your individual requirements and make a superb eggs benedict. In fact they say if there is anything you want but can’t see it, they will get it for you. It should be noted that you can dine in the evening at Herons and choose from the a la carte or bar menu, so you can enjoy the ambience on a budget, but prices are very reasonable and it should go without saying that the food is fantastic, using fresh herbs from the hotel roof garden, they really have superb chefs and the freshest ingredients. The room service menu is the same as the bar menu, but with a 12% gratuity and $4.50 delivery charge added, plus GST. Pool & fitness suite; one of the rare hotels in Vancouver to have a swimming pool, set on level 3, the same level as the roof gardens where herbs are grown for the restaurant, flowers for decorations and bee hives for honey used in cooking. Nice outside heated pool, reasonable size, nice temperature and surrounded by a terrace with comfortable sun loungers, tables & chairs, towels obtained from the fitness suite you pass through to get to the pool area, could do with some parasols as the weather was unseasonably hot while we were there and there was no shade. The fitness suite has plenty of modern equipment as well as a Jacuzzi pool. Conclusion; nice modern hotel getting it right in every respect, difficult to find fault, clean, nice friendly staff, sets the standard for benchmarking other 5 star hotels, it really is good.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel9999
Reviews.Content: The Waterfront Hotel couldn't possibly be any closer to the waterfront. The view from my room on the 20th floor was stunning. It overlooked the ferry teminal and had an unobstructed view of the harbour. The hotel is located in an excellent location within walking distance to Burrard and Robinson streets and the local bar scene at night. The staff are very friendly, courteous and helpful. I arrived around 10 AM after a long flight from Asia and needed to get washed up and dressed for a meeting with my client in a couple of hours. There was no problem getting a early check-in and she also made sure I got a room with a great view on a high floor. The gym has a few cardio machines but not much for weights. That being said, I am sure there are gyms close by if you want to get in a good workout. The pool and hot tub both were great. I did not eat at any of the restaurants or order room service so I cannot comment on the food, but I am sure it would up to Fairmont standards since everything else was.

Reviews.Title: “A very relaxing stay, excellent hotel and service!”
Reviews.Author: ToddsVacations
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Waterfront after a cruise from Los Angeles to Vancouver, the hotel was just across the street from the cruise terminal which was perfect. We got off the ship, crossed the street and checked into our room. The room was large with a nice sitting area and great view of the city. Service was excellent as I've experienced at every single Fairmont I have visited over the past few years. We didn't eat at the restaurant because of the large selection of restaurants within walking distance. I highly recommend this hotel if you're taking a cruise into our out of Vancouver, it's so convenient and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Front row, top drawer hotel”
Reviews.Author: tcook052
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a recent night at the Fairmont Waterfront, I can say I came away very impressed with this hotel as it more than exceeded my expectations which were alread set fairly high going in having stayed at several Fairmont's elsewhere in recent years. Having had plenty of notice of an upcoming business stay at the hotel I managed to reserve one of the lower rates in the standard Fairmont rooms which are well appointed though usually on lower floors and with less of a view than the upgraded room categories. For business though they're more than alright and so I was very pleasantly surprised to have been given an unsolicited upgrade to a corner room which features both city skyline as well as harbour views from both the bedroom and the bathroom. It seems rooms ending in either 16 or 24 are corner units in the hotel, which is a triangluar shape, and I was in 1524, a Signature room category I believe it is called. The photo's I've included do not do the room justice but the most interesting feature was the floor-to-ceiling wildows in the bathroom that allowed you to soak up the Stanley Park, Vancouver harbour and city skyline vistas while soaking in the large and deep tub. A great way to wash off the jet lag and prepare for meetings next morning. The hotel is location across the street from Canada Place, which is home to the Vancouver Convention Centre, The Pan Pacific Hotel and Cruise Ship Terminal so a busy corner when two huge cruise ships are disembarking 5,000+ passengers and embarking as many in the same day. Somehow it works and the staff do their best to handle the ebb & flow on these cruise ship sail days but you can't help notice how crowded the lobby is with luggage and how hectic the front desk really is. That having been said however I was quietly amazed at how well the staff took the pace in stride and seemed to deliver a consistently professional and courteous level of customer service. I left my luggage after checkin out at the Bell Desk for a few hours while I did a bit of Gastown sightseeing and the staff there was efficient and pleasant as well. A walk in the opposite direction would get you to the famous Stanley Park, which is a big draw for it's walking, cycling and jogging paths with stunning mountain and harbour views. Note that the airporter shuttle service in from Vancouver International Airport alternates service between the Fairmont Waterfront and the Pan Pacific across the street, stopping at one hotel one hour and the other the next however as they're literally facing each other even having to negotiate the short walk isn't too much of a downside. By the way, I found the airport shuttle very inexpensive at CAD$22 roundtrip. We had a working buffet breakfast at Heron's and enjoyed the spacious almost outdoor patio setting of the restaurant. Those guests opting to upgrade to a Fairmont Gold level room receive as part of the extra ammenities a private breakfast area that is much quieter than Heron's but like most hotels when you pay more you get more and such is the case here as well. Unlike many other Fairmont's the Waterfront isn't a restored heritage hotel and is modern in both decor and ammenities. Conference rooms and business services are also state of the art, though didn't have enough time to try the fitness facilities out during my short stay. A heated outdoor pool set on a terrace a few stories above street level offers a nice oasis in the downtown for some relaxation even in cooler months. It is worth it to sign up for the free Fairmont loyalty program called Fairmont President's Club as one perk is free internet access even for basic members. The other nice perk I find is that there is the regular check-in desk as well as one dedicated for President's Club members and it's usually much quicker. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Fairmont Waterfront Vancouver for either business or pleasure, especially to splurge and stay one night prior to sailing on one of the cruise ships that dock steps away.

Reviews.Title: “One of the greatest in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: BoutiqueHotelFan
Reviews.Content: If it has the "Fairmont" brand on it, no need to look anywhere else. Just two quick comments: 1. Just in case you're thinking about the spa, this hotel doesn't have a Willow Stream Spa, it just has a regular spa with fitness centre, an outdoor heated pool, an indoor jacuzzi, and there's a sauna inside the men's locker room. The location is the best in the city, in front of Canada Place, the Convention Centre and the Cruise Ship Terminal, and just 2 or 3 blocks away from the main shopping areas of downtown. 2. The internet connection is not included in the room rate, so, if you want to connect to the internet from your room, you have to pay for it, and again, this seems to be a general tendency in most hotels in Canada. Sorry guys, when I pay for a hotel room, I expect complimentary internet included, so for that reason, I will take away one point from the "Value" rating.

Reviews.Title: “Will this property remain a Fairmont when the new flagship property opens next year one block away?”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyerLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is by Canada Place in the Waterfront district and has a nice spacious entrance and common parts. We had a city view room overlooking the garden and it was much quieter than the other Fairmont property in central Vancouver. The rooms are spacious but the furniture collection was eclectic to say the least with painted furniture thrown together (from a garage sale?) with sleek dark wood side tables, maple TV cabinet, a glass and metal sidetable and poly mixed sheets (watch the static at night) on a bed next to wrought iron table lamps. We were invited to keep our towels for more than one day which seems a good initiative except that it seemed to extend to meaning don't bother to clean the bathroom so thoroughly either. The buffet breakfast is expansive and quite expensive but there are cheaper alternatives in the food court below the hotel. The hotel defnitiely scores on quietness and my husband enjoyed running along the waterfront but it's not well placed for the shops. That's why my husband wanted us to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot and Fairmont Gold is a must!!”
Reviews.Author: sportychick1977
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location for all the downtown sights and a brilliant hotel. The Fairmont Gold floor is a must and ensures you get breakfast included and also evening canapes and drinks in the honour bar which is very convenient. The rooms are very well furnished and we had a river view which was amazing! The food in the hotel was lovely and we ordered room service which was exceptional. The Fairmont Gold staff were very helpful, we managed to get tickets to a hockey game which was amazing and they also booked us the best tables at their recommended restaurants which meant we had great service!! The hotel spa was great and the treatments very good. Outdoor pool a little chilly but great gym and great views from the building! A must stay and a very elegant hotel for a downtown location, perfect for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK”
Reviews.Author: copan28
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights during April and was given a city view room. I didn't mind because I only planned to use it to sleep at night. With a water view room, it would be nice during the day but at night, the view is pitch black. The room was not luxurious but had a flat screen tv and a large bathroom. The location is ok considering it was close to the water and downtown offices but not convenient if you go out at night. The area is almost deserted at night. There are no good restaurants around and some of them only operates during the daytime (I guess there is no point staying open at night if there are no pedestrian traffic around). The food court below the hotel also closes around 6 pm. The gym facilities is small and very intimating. There are only few exercise equipment available and with people working out so close together, you will not be comfortable. The hotel personnel are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Large, clean room, good breakfast & dinner”
Reviews.Author: JRL12
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a deluxe room with breakfast thrown in (with wife & 2 year old child, who had a cot/crib) for 3 nights prior to a skiing holiday in Whistler. Room was large and clean. The bath could have been larger/deeper (but I have come across these very low baths in Canada before). Breakfast was very good, plenty of choise and helpful staff. Dinner was also very well presented / cooked. (& the hotel dog was very friendly). I would say the hotel isn't in that great a location for walking out at night for finding a selection of nearby restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “great location and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: wightgolfer
Reviews.Content: we had 2 nights here after skiing in Whistler the location is excellent on the waterfront close to shops, restaurants and gastown! hotel is generally very good and service also good would recommend for city stay

Reviews.Title: “For the traditionalist”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior4
Reviews.Content: This property, while much newer than most of the Fairmont chain, has a similar traditionalist atmosphere and solid four star level of service. Lots of natural light thanks to floor-to-ceiling glass in the rooms. If you want to be on the waterfront, it is a good choice, connected to the SkyTrain, ferry terminal and Sinclair Centre by underground shopping mall. Service and quality in the restaurant was top notch. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Fairmont123
Reviews.Content: Make sure you get a sea facing room as it is great to lie in bed and watch the sea planes taking off and landing! We had a Waterfront Deluxe Room. The rooms are very comfortable with lovely big bathrooms and the usual Miller Harris products. The location of this hotel is great for getting to most parts of the city and you can easily walk to the shopping areas. There is a Starbucks right opposite the hotel if you prefer to have breakfast there.

Reviews.Title: “Good room and polite staff”
Reviews.Author: Melissa056
Reviews.Content: Checked into the 'Waterfront' after a week in Whistler and was looking forward to some luxury. The hotel room we booked into was a city view room on the 14th floor. The room was fantastic with floor to ceiling windows that were not really overlooked by anything. The staff from check in to check out were professional, polite and helpful. Herons restaurant was expensive but their breakfast buffet was superb and set us up for the day. The hotel is only a few minutes walk from the main shopping areas and the tourist sightseeing buses leave from outside the hotel if you fancy seeing more of the further away areas. My only grumble with the hotel is the gym/spa facilities, which are rather dated and small. The lockers are all padlocked and there was no-one around to ask regarding getting keys for them. The swimming pool is small and there are only a few exercise machines. For the class of hotel I was disappointed with the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Loosing it's Sparkle”
Reviews.Author: towtaylor
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at the Waterfront during our honeymoon several years ago, when it was a CP Hotel. We enjoyed it so much we have visited every few years when we got the chance. The change to the Fairmont management style has not been so positive, staff attitudes have changed and there is a pervasive take it or leave it approach. Culminating in our last visit where we arrived after a long flight to be told the room wasn't ready but if we hung around it would be done soon. We wasted nearly 4 hours before giving up and going out as we were. Despite booking a portside room we were allocated a city view, again a further slog to get clarified. Even when we got to the room it had not been properly serviced. To cap it off our room rate was topped up with a marketing incentive charge - e.g. the hotel charges you another 1.5% for advertising itself and Vancouver to other tourists!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: funinthesun44
Reviews.Content: I just returned yesterday from a weekend stay.. this hotel is fabulous! The staff is very gracious, the rooms, the beds, the views are out of this world. Hotel is located right by Canada Place, a great hotel to stay a few nights prior to going on a cruise, you are walking distance to the restaurants, nightlife, shopping. Vancouver is a great city with many attractions and things to do. Don't forget to visit Granville Island while you are there!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mylo25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Waterfront for 7 nights in a "Fairmont Room". The room was large and had a great view of the port area and north shore mountains, which was nice as we were expecting a city view. The window itself was floor-to-ceiling and spanned the entire length of the room, we never closed the curtains and routinely watched cruise ships come into dock at 6am just as the sun rose above the mountains. The marble bathroom was pleasant, although the bath functions as a shower and you are not able to run and fill up the bath as no plug is supplied. Unlike other reviews we never heard noise from neighboring rooms, nor did we experience light from the corridor shining under the door at night. Moreover, the housekeeping was superb, supplying fresh bed clothes and bathroom towels daily. Overall the room was excellent, the only downside being the television was rather small and old (not a flatscreen as pictured on the website) and the mini bar was extrememly expensive. The concierge service was very friendly and welcoming as you may expect. I would suggest phoning ahead (before you arrive in Vancouver) and asking the concierge to book your day trips, we did this and everything was organised for us upon arrival. The Herons Lounge was superb, however you can certainly find cheaper and equally as good restaurants nearby, for example Gastown (a short 5 minute walk) has an excellent Italian. Lastly, the location of the hotel is second-to-none. Canada Place is right on the water front and access to the seawall, it is also close to the wealthy financial district. I would suggest you stay on a higher floor if you want a good view however as recent construction nearby may impede rooms on lower floors. This may be why Fairmont is building its new "Pacific Rim" hotel only a 2 minute walk from this hotel! If I were to go back I would probably stay at the Pan Pacific as I believe it may offer slightly better unobstructed views.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the "Dog" who greets you out front.”
Reviews.Author: BlueBear77
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Fairmont Waterfront Hotel in Vancouver, Canada was one of the best I have ever had. From the dog who greeted me at the front of the hotel to the entire staff at the hotel I felt at home. My room overlooked the cruise ship docks and I could see the ferry come and go. I watched the cruise ships sail. The hotel location was so convenient to everthing. My king size bed was just firm enough and so comfortable I slept like a baby. I am tall and the big tub was wonderful to soak in after a long day flying, etc. I just loved my room on the 12th floor. I traveled alone so safety was a concern. I felt very safe at the hotel. In all my stay was more than I had imagined! It was just wonderful. I sailed away the next day wishing I had spent more days at the Fairmont Waterfront. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “An old fashioned "Grand Hotel" in a great location”
Reviews.Author: NorfolkSpinone
Reviews.Content: Unlike other reviewers who booked through Expedia we had chosen a portside room (at a very good rate) and for the only time during our stay in Canada we were asked if we would like a high or low floor. We chose high and the views from floor 19 were excellent. The only downside was it had 2 double beds instead of the king bed we had booked. As we were only staying 2 nights the view was worth it. The reception staff were friendly and efficient and we had good service from the concierge. The staff in Heron's were particularily friendly (yes I know they want tips but if the staff are upbeat and appear interested in your day it starts the day well) The breakfast was excellent and all of good quality. The room was a good size perfectly clean and the bathroom was fine though not huge. One problem was our room had not been cleaned when we returned after 5 p.m. We were about to make ourselves comfortable with a drink before showering when the maid arrived. We had to vacate the room for 20 minutes not quite what we expect from a Fairmont. We were fortunate to meet the Hotel pat dog who demonstrated how at home she felt by rubbing her face in the rugs in the foyer. The position of the hotel so close to much of what holiday makers wish to visit in Vancouver has been well described it is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, if a little dated”
Reviews.Author: Net1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights. We had a signature room on the 6th floor which gave great views of the cruise ship dock as well as the mountains and the helicopter and sea plane take off and landings. Check in was fine and staff were very friendly and helpful, however I do feel the Fairmont is looking a bit tired. The carpets in the halls are dated, and our room I think was in need of a bit of TLC. The shower in the bathroom (which was absolutely huge - enough to have a small party in!) sprayed water all over the ceiling as well as the floor every time we used it. The furniture in the bedroom was a little tired as well and there was a stain all over the armchair. For a rather expensive room, I wouldn't necessarily expect this. Also, internet access was $14.95, which I resent paying, having had free wi-fi in all of the other hotels we have stayed in recently. I think a room on a higher floor would be best for views, as although our room had huge floor to ceiling windows, a new conference centre has been built (there is lots of construction work around the hotel, however this did not disturb us at all, unlike the rather friendly couple in the room next door on our last night - soundproofing between rooms could be better!) and this blocks the views for anyone below about level 10 I would think. All in all, the hotel cannot be beaten for location - 5 minutes into Gastown, 5 minutes to the Heritage District, and of course being right on the water, however I do feel the rooms need a makeover.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location - glamour, gloss and ghettos”
Reviews.Author: Snowgood
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 week tour of BC with my husband and 3 year old son. We used the Fairmont as our base whilst in Vancouver and personally believe it is in the best location. There is a lovely pedestrian friendly walk along the sea-wall past the float planes to Stanley Park and all its many wonderful attractions, gas town is close by, the main shopping area is a short walk and there is a sky-train station underneath the hotel that takes you directly to the bus-ferry port for Granville Island. The rooms are light and airy and a good size for a 'city' hotel, there is so much to do in Vancouver we spent very little time in our hotel. The staff were very courteous and gave us free milk and cookies for our little boy. There is a food mall underneath the hotel if you don't want to pay $30 for breakfast and we saved $100 over 3 days by using the car park across the road rather than the hotels. Just one word of caution - don't be tempted into walking the one block from Gastown to Chinatown as we did - big mistake - it is like walking into a horror movie. You have to cross downtown Pender Street which is a ghetto for the homeless - not for the faint hearted!

Reviews.Title: “First Fairmont Hotel - and a great start”
Reviews.Author: jayseetoo
Reviews.Content: We planned a trip to Canada including a cruise - which was cancelled. As we had booked at Fairmont Waterfront for the start of our holiday we used Fairmonts all the way through our ( rescheduled) trip and can't recommend them highly enough. First off join the Presidents Club - separate checking in queues matter when you are tired and just off a flight! This trip was an anniversary celebration so we were not scrimping but neither did we feel we had to pay over the odds. We chose to upgrade to Gold and were very glad we did. The Gold service was excellent in all of the hotels we used. For the Waterfront we had a room with a view over the harbour which was spectacular. The cruise terminal was just over the road and one of the highlights of our trip was to watch a huge white cruise ship sail into port at 6 am one morning ( our time zone changes meant that we were awake early and we kept our curtains open to watch the sunrise!) THe location was great. The food court in the basement was good. There is a great deli http://www.urbanfare.com/home.html a couple of blocks away which great food in portion sizes that we could cope with . Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Classy. Convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Axcl
Reviews.Content: Stayed a total of 4 nights. Rooms were not dark (furnishings / carpet), and large windows gave excellent natural light and a feeling of airyness. Room appointments were more than adequate. Bathrooms well appointed and laid out. Desk (Reception) service and assistance was excellent. Concierge assistance was accurate and excellent. Bell desk was good. "Herons" Bar & eating area serves as breakfast (buffet was more than adequate) and also drinks / food in the evening. Bar service was very good - a bonus is that the staff were nearly as good as the Concierge Desk for information. Bar food menu quite varied and all good. Shopping mall beneath the hotel. Hotel situated on the Vancouver waterfront adjacent to the Cruise Ship Ternimal (Canada Place), so is very convenient to travellers on cruises (indeed there was a lot of business for the Hotel from this source - quite busy every day in the Lobby). It is a 5 minute walk to the middle of Vancouver for shopping, etc, and there is a subway station under/adjacent to the Hotel (SkyTrain), and also the SeaBus. It is about 1 mile (1.6 km) to Stanley Park

Reviews.Title: “One night stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: jmjo48
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night at this hotel after we first arrived in Vancouver. The hotel is in a great part of town - it is right next to Canada Place and walking distance to a lot of the downtown sights and Gastown. The hotel is beautiful and busy. Given how close it is to Canada Place which is where a lot of cruise ships seem to take off from or land, there are a lot of people staying here. (I recommend checking out by TV or phone.) When we arrived around noon on Saturday, our room was not ready yet. We had requested a King size bed but it was not available. Instead of their standard room with 2 double beds on a lower floor, we were changed to a room with a Queen bed on the 15th floor with a harbor view which would be ready later that afternoon. The view of the harbor was great! The bed was a Queen size, but it was a pull down which didn't bother either of us. The room was a decent size and comfortable. The morning of check out, the fire alarm went off and they had a rough time getting the elevators to work. The staff was very nice and if was obvious they felt bad about it. We managed to get an elevator to the 15th floor, but couldn't get one back down. I called the front desk since we had bags to bring down and in less than 5 minutes, 3 bellman came running up the stairs to help us down. I definitely liked this location and we felt very safe in this neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasant stay at the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: YVR_guestservices
Reviews.Content: I booked in for 1 night at the WFC to accommodate a buddy who was passing through town. I had already gotten an amazing rate, but they very kindly reduced it because they blocked me into a Murphy suite (room 1002) - one normally used as a sitting room of a parlour suite, with a bed that folds down from a wall unit. No doubt many travellers would be terribly disappointed at not getting "a proper room" but I liked it very much. The sitting area was very large and comfortable, a long angled passage gave excellent insulation from sound in the hallway, the bed was perfectly comfortable. I liked the built-in aspect of it - it had very good recessed lighting over the pillows, and I do like pleasant lighting. I didn't really have the need to ask the staff for much, but everyone I dealt with was very pleasant and perfectly courteous. Every detail of housekeeping was impeccable, the bathroom was enormous (far more than I needed, really, but other travellers will appreciate this detail), and the amenities top quality. Thanks to my Fairmont President's Club membership I enjoyed complimentary internet access; it's worth signing up for this program before you go for this benefit alone. Once I figured out how to connect (one phone call to the desk was all it took) I found the internet service very fast and easy to access. Once again I found Fairmont well exceeded my expectations and I would recommend the Waterfront without hesitation. A heads-up to cruise passengers: the Waterfront, being right across from the Canada Place cruise terminal, does book a very large number of cruise travellers during the season. This results in very high occupancy levels which means it is hardly reasonable to expect rooms to be available when you disembark at 9 or 10 in the morning. (hotel full previous night + people like to sleep in and check out late on vacation and on weekends = few guests checking out early enough to give Housekeeping time to prepare rooms for early arrivals. That check-in time is there for a reason, people...) Also, ascertain before you go that your cruise line does dock at Canada Place, and not at Ballantyne which is a little further east. It's pretty simple: all cruise lines dock at Canada Place except for Celebrity and Royal Caribbean. It's still just a short cab ride to Ballantyne. The YVR Airporter stops right around the corner from the hotel, and sometime in late summer or fall 2009 the Canada Line subway to the airport will be in operation with a stop at Waterfront station right across the street so airport connections can hardly be easier. PS: overnighting at the Waterfront meant I was downtown in time for breakfast at Scoozi's, on Howe St, barely 5 minutes away, which must be the best breakfast anywhere in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel but not faultless”
Reviews.Author: PeterRUk
Reviews.Content: Had 2 x 2 night stays here either side of a cruise. On the first occasion we had a 21st floor room with views over Stanley Park which was fine until the elevators failed for 2.5 hours on the second day. We managed to walk the 21 floors down but had to wait until at least a service lift was working before we could get back up to pack and check out. On our return we were eventually allocated a room on the 12th floor overlooking the harbour but in the alternative direction. Unfortunately this wasn't ready for the official 3 pm check in time. not ideal when we had spent 3 hrs getting off our cruise ship! The hotel has a nice ambience but there is a lot of construction work going on nearby and as we found, not all cruise ships leave from the Cruise terminal opposite! - there is another terminal a short taxi ride away. Overall, very comfortable, nice location but not flawless.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fairmont Waterfront, Vancouver, B.C.”
Reviews.Author: LouLasVegas
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Waterfront is really a very nice hotel to stay, very clean, hotel staff are very friendly. The food was excellent, the location is very close to the shopping district, Gas Town, and downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Great views, fantastic room”
Reviews.Author: YoPhilly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated directly across the street from the cruise ship terminal. The lobby is open and airy. The staff at the registration desk were courteous, friendly and helpful, always addressing me by name. My room on the 16th floor had a fabulous view across English Bay. The room was big, well-furnished and had a super large marble bathroom. Coffee maker, tea kettle, selection of teas and coffee were provided in the room. Although I didn't use the pool, it is a very nice outdoor pool on the 3rd floor rooftop. Overall a beautiful hotel, well-located, with an excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: myscreenname29
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The room I had was at the end of the hall and was shaped like a half circle ( I think the room numbers that end in 09 and 22 are like this). The bathroom had floor-to-ceiling windows... which was interesting but pretty. Beds are awesome!!! Housekeeping went above and beyond by folding my PJ's every day and placing them neatly by the pillow. They also arranged my make-up and other toiletries each day. I know other hotels do this too, but there seemed to be a special touch here. The restaurant was great. They learned my name on the first day and called me by name all week long. The view from the room was awesome!! Fairmont was all I thought i would be.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: salswife
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel as part of our APT tour of Canada and Alaska. First class hotel right on the waterfront where the cruise ships dock, close to gas town and shopping and eateries. Our room was a huge corner room with view out over the harbour. The bed was a king size and so comfortable and we could have held a party in the bathroom it was so big. In the basement of the hotel is a shopping arcade with eateries, post office, camera shop, newsagent etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very disapointing”
Reviews.Author: GEERSA
Reviews.Content: Being a regular business traveler, and never having stayed in a Fairmont property before, I admit that I was actually quite keen to experience a Fairmont property. Unfortunately it was a very disappointing experience... On arrival at around 22H00 no porter was available to assist with 4 pieces of luggage (I contrast this to a recent stay at another chain where I arrived at 02H00 in the morning I received very rapid assistance). After this first blip, I made my way to my room. On opening my door I was assailed by a foul smell, and my room stank of smoke (was meant to be a non-smoking room). On calling front desk they were hardly helpful. Sending up housekeeping to spray air freshener, if anything made things worse. I took a sleeping pill in order to be able to sleep in the room. On complaining the next day I was finally moved to a new room, which was actually pleasant. The Fairmont Waterfront's rooms are a bit tired and the colour schemes and amenities provided were a little tired and dated. The rest of my stay was uneventful, but nothing memorable. On mentioning on checking-out that I was surprised to be charged for my horrible first night, all the manager offered me was a $50 discount for that that night… If this was the best the hotel could do I found it amazing. Being a regular guest of Starwood, Four Seasons and InterContinental, I must admit my stay in the Fairmont Waterfront Vancouver was a sub-standard experience and was not what I expected from Fairmont. I'm really not sure if I'd take a chance on a Fairmont again.

Reviews.Title: “Great property!”
Reviews.Author: lifeisamountain
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont waterfront is a great choice in Vancouver. I was given a complimentary upgrade to a Portside Deluxe room (oceanview) on the 21st floor. The room had a huge cushy king size bed - incredibly comfortable! The room also had an LCD TV and all new furniture. Herons Restaurant downstairs is excellent, but not cheap. The service and food was both top notch! We ordered breakfast to the room in the morning and it was delicious and came right on time. Parking is not cheap, but it isn't anywhere in Vancouver. $28/night. Join the Presidents Club for complimentary internet and other great perks!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel w/ pretty views”
Reviews.Author: Heard
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice. It is in an excellent location and has some pretty views of the water. The service is outstanding!! Rooms are nice and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful vancover.”
Reviews.Author: dustcart
Reviews.Content: we had a portside deluxe room on the 18th floor, the view was fabulous.The staff were very polite and helpful. The housekeeping staff put clean sheets on our beds every day, and kept our room spotless.May we recommend Inlets for breakfast which you can find in Robson Street.The Reception staff and porters were so kind and helpful nothing was ever a problem.If you do want to stay in vancover we give The Fairmont Waterfront Hotel 10 out of 10. Thankyou. Allan and Dianne Watkins. from Hereford ,England.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice....”
Reviews.Author: raylee11
Reviews.Content: Nice stay for a weekend meeting. Had a large deluxe room on the 19th floor with view of North Van, mountains and harbour. King size bed very comfy, LCD TV, etc. Heard the sea planes but that adds to the waterfront nuance. Staff pleasant and very helpful. Skip buffet breakfast. Underground mall includes Tim's, and Starbucks right across the street at Canada Place. Easy walk along sea wall and then downtown/Gastown and then to Granville Island. Again, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing stay after skiing”
Reviews.Author: ramjudd
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here before flying out of Canada. We upgraded to The Fairmont Gold on arrival which meant we had use of a private lounge, with added facilities such as cocktail hour hors d'oeuvres and a complimentary deluxe continental breakfast. It was too wet to use the terrace but the extra space of the lounge made our stay with two young children all the better. Some people would not like the sound of all the seaplanes taking off - especially since they fly from 8.00am but they entertained our children and we live in a city anyway. overall a very relaxing location and a great experience for all the family.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: emtoothfxr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont while in town for a convention across the street at the convention center. We had a deluxe Harbor view room on the 18th floor. The room was a little bit small but the view was wonderful. You can hear the sea planes taking off and landing during the day and also the construction but it's not too bad and there isn't any noise at night. The staff was extrememly kind and helpful. We'd stay there again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Free morning lobby coffee awful”
Reviews.Author: Isky
Reviews.Content: This hotel is direcly across the street from the cruise ship terminal/convention center. Our convention rate was $227 per night. The restaurant food was excellent! The dungeness crab soup was $14 a bowl and worth every spoonful. Housekeeping came everyday by 9:30am. Free local papers were delivered daily. Free coffee in the lobby at 6am is awful! Free bottled water is near the bellstand daily around 6am. The room is large and the king size bed was very comfy. Bath robes are in the room. Double pane glass windows helped, but did not eliminate the early morning and all day sounds of seaplanes taking off, helicopters landing and cruise ships that blew their horn as they left the terminal. Under the hotel is a food court with a Starbucks, sit down diner, health food cafe with excellent morning oatmel that always ran out, and fresh fruit. There is also a hair salon, shoe repair shop, card store/post office. (Beware that a 30 cent postcard costs $1 to mail to the U.S.) This area is also where you connect the skylink train that will take you to Chinatown and the "mega" Metrotown mall that's about 20 minutes away, at a cost of $3 one way. The seabus/ferry dock is also here and takes you across the water to North Vancouver for about $3. There is a two story small mall there that has a lot of food for sale, local trinkets and not much more.The 15 minute ferry ride across the water is well worth the view. Taxis are readily available outside the hotel and a Vancouver tourism site is on site. An airport ride is about $28. The airport is easy to navigate and full of shops and restaurants..

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: bucnbee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I cruised from Los Angeles to Vancouver for our anniversary and stayed at the Fairmont. We stayed on the 12th floor and it was wonderful (see pics). The room was spotless, service was excellent and the view will take your breath away. Two of the windows in the room opened and we were greeted by the herb garden aromas from in front of the hotel. Also, on the 12th floor is a beautiful patio and study room. Free internet service is provided if you stay on this floor. There is also snacks and drinks and reading material. This hotel made our trip the best experience yet! We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag.”
Reviews.Author: ducs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont Waterfront for three nights for a business conference. I was surprised and disappointed given the Fairmont's excellent reputation. The room was very tired and not exactly clean. The sink in the bathroom was cracked, the furniture was worn, and the carpet was stained. The tv was tiny and there was no desk. The bedroom and bathroom were not well lit. I spoke with some people at the conference also staying at the Fairmont Waterfront and they had similar issues with their rooms. The housekeeping staff was unacceptable as they did not replace the coffee or the cream, I found someone's razor in the sink when I arrived and old grounds in the coffee maker. At least the room had windows that opened for fresh air and the bed was comfortable. This hotel claims to be "green" yet they changed the sheets every day and there was no card to leave if you didn't want the sheets changed as I have seen in other hotels. On the bright side, the location is fantastic with only a short walk to Gastown, Granville Street, Robson Street, lots of restaurants, and the sky train. The views of the ocean and mountains from the room were gorgeous. There is a herb garden open to the public on the third floor which was unique. Heron's Restaurant in the lobby was not inexpensive, but the food and wine were well worth the price. Room service was prompt and polite. In fact, all of the poeple were friendly and helpful from the front desk to the bellman. If the rooms were renovated and housekeeping improved, this would be an excellent hotel. I paid $185 per night during the week.

Reviews.Title: “Plush but expensive”
Reviews.Author: tanddEssex
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our anniversary trip across Canada, and en route to joining the Rocky Mountaineer. This was our first Fairmont (but not our last) and was everything we expected it to be. We booked it because it has an excellent location near to Stanley Park and the main shopping areas and because we wanted a quality hotel. Arrival was smooth; met at the taxi, bags whisked up to our room, check in smooth. The room had an excellent view of the harbour with window the width of the room. Large room with a small sitting area and two chairs, writing desk, tv, coffee making facilities, built in safe box. Very large bathroom, twin sinks, bath and shower excellent. Huge comfortable (which for us means soft) king size bed. We used the gym a couple of times (small but well equipped and mostly underused by guests so no waiting). You are provided with huge fluffy bathrobes, and we used the rooftop pool as we were blessed with good weather, and passed a pleasant hour sunbathing on the deck. This hotel is very clean - maid service excellent, is well equipped and in a good state of repair. The concierge was extremely helpful and knowledgeable, gave us a streetmap and marked directions so we could catch the seabus (up to Grouse Mountain and Capillano). Very friendly people all round. One evening around the lobby and restaurant and bar there were a lot of dressed up folk, and and as we're 'small casual' sort of people this wasn't our scene.The restaurant in the hotel was too much: far too formal (and perhaps pretentious) for us and very expensive so we didn't use it. It did look nice, and we have no reason to think the food wouldn't be good, so if you like that sort of think it may be the place for you. But there are many, many good places to eat just a short walk away. We really like Earl's, which is a sports bar and restaurant: informal, nice food, great service and good value. We did use the bar for early morning coffee, and once for late night drinks. They have a pianist in the evenings and that makes for a nice experience. They serve food in the bar but it's a poor choice (pizza or burger) and over-priced. This is a chain hotel; so if you are looking for a family run, cosy hotel this isn't it. But after this hotel we stayed at three more Fairmont hotels and we would do so again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Spa_Girl_011
Reviews.Content: A group of friends and I stayed at this hotel for a weekend away - we experienced great service and we were very pleased with the location. I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: luckystrike
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here with two friends from 1st – 4th January 2008 as the conclusion to a self-organised trip around the Rockies. The Fairmont Waterfront is really well located on Canada Place, with immediate access to Downtown, Gastown and the waterfront. Yaletown, Granville Island and Stanley Park are all close by in a taxi, or half an hour on foot. The seaplane terminals are only a few minutes walk from the hotel’s front door. Our room on the 21st floor had a great view of the waterfront, Stanley Park and the mountains beyond. It was exciting to watch the seaplanes appear in the distance and follow their path as they swooped in and landed on the water directly below us. We had a large Queen bed and ample storage space, and the bathroom was huge. As with all Fairmont hotels, there are plenty of luxury toiletries. The only meal we ate in the hotel was in Herons restaurant in the lobby on New Year’s Day, and even though it was very quiet there was still a full menu and the food was excellent. We also found ourselves stopping here for a nightcap on more than one occasion as it was very relaxing! The Concierge was extremely helpful, booking return seaplane flights to Victoria for us at 1 hour’s notice. We had been drawn in having watched them landing and taking off! The bell service was also excellent and on two occasions they drove us to restaurants in one of the hotel’s cars. Furthermore, they lent us umbrellas when it was raining. For other dining options in Vancouver, Cin Cin Ristorante on Robson Street is well worth a visit if you want to splash out on good Italian food and a bottle of wine from the impressive list. And as we were leaving for the airport on our last day we noticed a Morton’s Steakhouse right beside the hotel, which is bound to be excellent. If we had known it was there we would have definitely booked a table. We would have no problem staying here again should we return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the 'Waterfront'”
Reviews.Author: onemadcow
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 nights at the Fairmont Waterfront in a 'Portside Deluxe Room'. Room was extremely comfortable - king size bed, lounge chair, business desk, internet access, cable TV coffee maker and well appointed bathroom. Great view across the port to North Vancouver and mountains. Friendly staff who were more than happy to assist with anything. Hotel has a great 'Health Club' with plenty of modern excerise exquipment - cardio machines, freeweights, swiss balls etc,indoor and outdoor pools (was a bit cold for the outdoor pool while we were there tho!!!). Great access to public transport - internal access from the hotel to the sky-train and the ferry terminal. Tourist info office right next door. Easy walking to downtown shopping, attractions and restaurants. The hotel restaurant definitely looked very nice - but we ate out as part of our exploration of the city. More than happy with our stay, and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service from club class”
Reviews.Author: stuey44
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location on the waterfront, and only a few blocks away from areas like gastown, downtown and stanley park. The club class level offered superb service from staff, very good breakfast each morning, snacks and drinks during the day and the staff were able to book and recommend anything you needed. The hotel was well presented, very clean and everything you would expect from a 5 star resort. One of the concierge asked where our tour took us next, and when stating 'to a sheraton', he stated 'there are no other hotels that fairmont'. After staying here i definately want to stay at other fairmonts around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of early departure fees”
Reviews.Author: ServiceNow
Reviews.Content: At a recent convention I attended, I stayed at this hotel as it was the conference headquarters. Able to finish business early, I decided to go home one day earlier than I had originally intended. When I went to check out I was advised that I would be charged an early departure penalty that was actually greater than the room rate. After some "discussion" the penalty was reduced to the room rate and I was then told that had I booked on my own rather than going through the conference office, I would not have been charged this penalty. Nowhere on their reservation information does it indicate that this penalty would be charged!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely nice, okay value.”
Reviews.Author: travelducky2
Reviews.Content: Where: Fairmont Waterfront, Vancouver When: September 07 Who: I spend approximately 20% of my time on the road. I typically stay at Hiltons and Marriotts Why: Business Location: The Fairmont is located on the waterfront. It’s within throwing distance of the ‘gastown’ area, which contains some great restaurants, interesting shops, regular shopping, and the famous ‘steam clock’. The view from the water-facing side of the hotel is very nice, especially if you enjoy watching sea planes take off and land. This Fairmont is connected to a below-street-level mini mall, which adds another level of convenience. It’s about a 20 minute walk along the waterfront, to the famous Stanley Park. Check-in: The check in process was extremely quick, courteous, and professional. Layout: The lobby and restaurant area are all conveniently located on the first floor, and it’s not at all difficult to navigate to the rooms from the elevator. Rooms: The rooms are spacious and very clean. The bed was very comfortable, but the pillows were just so-so. The linens were exceptionally clean, however. The water pressure in the shower was a little anemic, but there was plenty of hot water, and the consistency of the water temp was good. I did notice that the water was “soft”, in that you have to wash twice as long to get the soapy, ‘slippery’ feel off your skin. I’d imagine that’s the same anywhere you’d stay in that area, however. The room had an iron / ironing board, and fridge / minibar. Besides the view, my favorite part of the room was the wide-screen HDTV. Very nice. Service: The housekeeping service was just fine. I haven’t had many experiences with Fairmont hotels, but one of the things that seems to be consistent among them, is the presence of many doormen, pursers, concierge personnel, and others who are happy to give you whatever help you need. For elderly travelers, or for those with special needs, this would be enough for me to pay a little more for the Fairmont level of service. Restaurants: There is a restaurant on site which serves 3 meals a day, but I didn’t eat any of them there. Internet: There is a fee to use the internet, but I never had trouble connecting or staying connected. The speed was just fine for everything I needed to do. Gift Shop: There isn’t one...you have to go downstairs to the attached mini-mall, or down the street to the shopping district. Summary: The Vancouver Waterfront Fairmont is an extremely nice place to stay. My satisfaction, however, is largely based on the fact that someone else paid the bills, and the fact that we were able to get a discount thru a local university, which resulted in paying about half of the original $400+ nightly rate. While I was extremely happy with everything, I think I probably could have found better value for my own money somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but business orientated.”
Reviews.Author: December_snowdrift
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Waterfront for 3 weeks for our Honeymoon, which included Christmas. We were very pleased with our room, which was lareg, clean and had an amazing view across the harbour. I would say that at times we felt out of place as there were a lot of business people around but we were never looked down upon. I would probably fault the travel agents for not making this clearer, certainly not the hotel! The outdoor pool is heated but still feels cool, especially considering it was December!. Once aclimatised, the view around is amazing to see whilst swimming, we could even see poeple enjoying their office christmas parties! The location is fantastic, within walking distance of Stanley Park, Robson Street (main shopping area), restaurants and every else you could want really. Every evening we would go and walk round Canada Place, which is directly opposite. Christmas day was dealt with in a 'professional' manner, everyone was very friendly, the food was good and they put little gingerbread men in our room. The trouble was that none of it felt warm or special, I think this was down to the hotel being more geared to the business community than tourists. If I had the choice again I would certainly have visited this hotel for a while but gone up to Whistler for Christmas as it is truely magical there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Bobbin2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a two week honeymoon at The Waterfront. When we first saw our room I was devastated as they had given us a small room overlooking the city. We had asked for a harbour view and thought we would get it due to being on our honeymoon! My husband rang through to reception who sent somebody straight away to show us two other rooms. We chose a much larger room on a corner with views of the harbour and the city. The reason they gave for giving us the original room was that as we were there for so long those on weekend breaks would miss out on the rooms with best views but they 'found' these two rooms! Still, at least it was sorted straight away. The staff were all very helpful and courteous. At times we felt out of place as there were a lot of business people around but we were never looked down upon. The outdoor pool is heated but still feels cool. But once used to the temperature the view around is amazing to see whilst swimming. The location is fantastic, within walking distance of Stanley Park, Robson Street (main shopping area), restaurants and every else you could want really. One block down is the Tourist Info Centre. All in all a fab place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: Brian_from_Scotland
Reviews.Content: The Waterfront is more modern than it's sister hotel (Vancouver Centre) and has undergone refurbishment around 2001. Initial impressions were excellent as we were met by the very courteous doorman who dealt with the car and luggage imediately. Check-in was flawless too. This stylish hotel is idealy situated for great views of North Vancouver across the bay and the mountains beyond, but sadly the views of Stanley Park & Lions Gate Bridge are blocked by the on-going construction across the street of the Vancouver Conference Centre for the 2010 Winter Olympics. It should be noted that construction noise was not an issue during our stay. As a 5 star hotel The Waterfront lives up to expectation and staff were excellent and couldn't have been more helpful and friendly. Breakfast was a top class buffet, as was Lunch. Dinner in the hotel restaurant, Herons, was flawless with amazing food served along with tremendous service. The hotel has a resident Golden Labrador called Mavis who acts as an ambassador for the hotel. See the doormen to book Mavis for walks. Located on waterfront adjacent to Canada Place & cruise ships, the Waterfront is a mere 5 min walk from Gastown and Vancouver Lookout, 10 min walk along waterfront to marina / float planes / bay cruises. Ferries run across the bay to north vancouver and a 2 zone ticket can be purchased for $6.25 that includes a 10 min bus journey at the other side to take you to the gondola up to Grouse Mountain. Eating out close to hotel we would recommend Trans Continental, Al Porto Ristorante, Herons, but avoid Steamhouse at all costs as the service was shocking. This is a first rate hotel with service to match and if it's good enough for Queen Elizabeth it must be ok!! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: adnelg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Waterfront during our BC road trip, and I must admit that by the time I got there, I was starting to get a little hotel-ed out. Luckily, the Waterfront was a step up from where we had been staying, and revitalised me entirely! We had a gorgeous corner room with windows all around, permitting views of Canada Place and the cruise ships as well as the city. The room was very modern in appearance with a huge bathroom -- a big difference from the traditional Fairmont hotels that I am more accustomed to. Room was very clean with a large and comfortable bed overlooking the city part of the view. Bathroom was also very clean and large ... but no fan? It got very steamy after showers! The remainder of the hotel was very nice -- breakfast was included in our rate and the buffet was very tasty. I liked that the hotel was connected underground to a food court and mall ... helpful during those standard Vancouver rainy days. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Before a Cruise it's a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: drjj
Reviews.Content: The public areas are quite nice, the attention at the desk was very good, the luggage service was excellent and the location could not be nicer for evening walks around the existing convention center or to Gas Town, that area which has been pretty much revitalized. Next door there is a large food court which made a very reasonable and quite good breakfast, individually cooked, possible at the Greek place. Like the Fairmont San Francisco, the public areas are generally more impressive than the room size, although this Fairmont is, naturally, much newer and the room is quite adequate and clean and the beds were quite good. We were pleased that it was up to date with the bed linens and did not have old, flowery, heavy bedspreads, but rather the white sheet covering and a colorful throw . . . sort of the uniform of the day since the bedbug "scandal" hit hotel rooms a year or so back. A very good place to stop before or after an Alaskan cruise experience.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: noriboating
Reviews.Content: This hotel did everything right.Beautiful views,spotless rooms,and the most efficient, pleasant and accomodating staff we encountered on a two week stay involving multiple high end hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade to gold”
Reviews.Author: dreaminofsunshine
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend at the Fairmont Waterfront Hotel. What a great time. We decided to upgrade to a gold service room. It was worth every penny. The room was clean and had a wonderful view of downtown. We left for breakfast and it was clean when we got back half an hour later. They also have an evening turn down service. It was so nice to get back to the room and have soft jazz playing, the coverlet put away and the duvet turned down. You get your own concergie, who were the most helpful staff I've ever dealt with. There is an outside patio with a great view of the harbor just off a large sitting area. They have a complimentary breakfast and evening snacks everyday. The honorary bar is self serve but the staff is right there to help you out if you need it. Vancouver still allows smoking but only on patios, so be prepared for that.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, considering the price.”
Reviews.Author: JR1004
Reviews.Content: Our first 10 minutes were fantastic - we arrived several hours early and were immediately given a room, and the concierge made an excellent recommendation for lunch. Otherwise, I don't believe the cost of this hotel was justified. The rooms were of average size and decorated in a very average fashion. No wireless internet access was available, and wired access was $14+ per day. If you don't want to use your cell phone in Canadian airspace, expect a $1.95 charge per call, every time you pick up the phone. Overall, I was disappointed in the lack of features and "extras" that are now mainstays at non-luxury-class hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Neil-from-Dallas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 days after cruising alaska on Regent. The hotel is great and well located with excellent views of cruise terminal/waterfront. We stayed on the club level and I would recomend this as the breakfast and snacks were great. If you decide to go the Victoria Island by helicopter (which is wonderful) you can walk to the heliport easily from the hotel. The only draw back is the construction that is going on across the street on the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, best location for cruisers!!”
Reviews.Author: piperlexi
Reviews.Content: We flew into Seattle Intl Airport, rented a car and drove to the Fairmont Waterfront. We stayed one night before getting on our cruise the next day. Although we don't know what the cost to stay for one night was because we used our AMEX reward points and stayed for free. It is literally across the street from where the ships dock. The hotel was nice, our room was very nice - the only complaint we would have was the service in the restaurant for breakfast the next morning was VERY slow, like we were putting them out by eating there and I had an omelette which was not even fully cooked - very very runny. Other than that, I would suggest anyone who is going on a cruise to stay there. You can park your car in the underground garage, which they don't tell you, but they want you to pay for valet. Don't bother paying the extra money for them to take your luggage to the ship, walk down the ramp yourself, or drive your rental car with your luggage, drop it off at the cruise terminal and then return your car. That is what we did. We returned our car at the Hertz location which was within walking distance if you are in somewhat good shape.

Reviews.Title: “Average room - great service”
Reviews.Author: JohnSocal
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Fairmont Waterfront for 4 nights in August 2007. We stayed in a deluxe portside room on the 23rd floor ( top floor ) with an excellent view of the harbor. We received excellent service from everybody. The room was very clean and nice. However, the room was not what I would expect from a luxury hotel at $450 /nt The room was average size and the bathroom was very small with just a shower over the tub. However, this is pretty well standard for Canadian Hotels. The hotel restaurant was quite average and extremely expensive. We paid $145 for an average dinner for 2 with no alcaholic beverages. Again, thsi is pretty standard for Canada. In summary I would rate the room as 3* at 5* prices.

Reviews.Title: “Considerate Service”
Reviews.Author: dei0
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel and had a nice stay. The room was slighlty above average. We liked the location and the hotel was very accommodating and considerate. We hope to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Pay Extra for a waterfront view, it is worth it”
Reviews.Author: Bobbio
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend here early July 07. Agent had booked a city view room but we decided to treat ourselves to a waterfront view room for an extra $40 per night (Plus the inevitable tax North Americans never seem to include in the quoted price). It was well worth it, we had a comfortable room with a splendid view overlooking the harbour and the Cruise Ship Terminal and saw a new ship come into port both mornings. We could have spent all our time looking out of the room window at the harbour but the hotel has a splendid restaurant, one of the best we sampled in the whole of a four week tour of North America. The food and service were superb, but the view is being spoiled by some construction work diagonally across the street. There is direct indoor access to shops and a train station from the hotel and it is in an excellent location for both the Cruise Terminal and downtown shopping such as Hudsons Bay Company and Macys. Definitely a place to return to.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic break”
Reviews.Author: Whitehorsecombat
Reviews.Content: What a great stay at a fantastic hotel. Beautiful lobby, great food, nice rooms and outstanding service with a smile – every time! Also, we were able to easily get around the city via the Skytrain, easily accessible thought the hotel. We elected to stay on the Gold Level (floors 8 and 9) with a harbor view and would do it again in a heart beat. Beautiful views, but would advise the Fairmont to wash those big windows often as they seemed slightly dirty on the outside. Spent two nights here and fully enjoyed all the hotel had to offer as well as some fine dining at Metro, Herons and Lumiere. Stayed at the Sutton a few years back and this hotel easily blows the Sutton out of the water based solely on service. We look forward to our next visit with great anticipation!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hillary6503
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Spend a little and stay on the concierge floor. It turns out to be very good value due to all the extras. Also, join the presidents club on the Fairmont website if you haven't already. It's free to join and you get tips on how to get those "extras" that seem to make a great hotel. Try for a room with a view. My wife and I had a great view of the harbour. I won't stay anywhere else in Vancouver. The location is great. You can walk just about anywhere from the hotel. Take the hotel dog for a walk for fun.

Reviews.Title: “Club Level - Worth Every Penny”
Reviews.Author: 5*fan
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Fairmont Waterfront recently and were pleased that we were able to stay on the club level. Our room was pleasant and we had a good view of the harbor. The only negative about this hotel was that it seemed to struggle to handle the large number of cruise/tour/convention guests that would descend upon the lobby at the same time. This made for long lines at check in/out, breakfast, concierge, valet, etc. Once we learned that there was a separate check in, concierge and breakfast on the club level, we were very pleased. The club level lounge, with a roof-top seating area, was always well stocked with delicious snacks and staffed with very helpful personnel. If you are planning to stay at this property and looking to avoid the crowds, consider the club level.

Reviews.Title: “Will return to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: picturejoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this place for two nights in May. The hotel's location is great, underground access to seabus and sky train provides easy access to other places if you don't have a car. The lobby is nice decorated, the gym is not big, but clean, the pool is small, but what can you expect from a pool in the hotel? I asked a quite room on high floor, and I get all that. My room is big, very big window with nice city view, and very quite. The service is good too, and the maid didn't even take the tips we left on the night stand after the first night! Some people complaint about long check in line, even though I didn't experience it myself, I did see one time that there is a long line in the lobby. When we got there after regular check-in hour, our room is not ready, we wondered around the hotel for 20 minutes, and it was still not ready, so they sent us to have a drink at louge and they picked up the bill, we are totally ok with it. After I came back, I found out a charge from the hotel which I don't recognize, I called the hotel, they told me that is a charge from mini bar, I explained to them that we didn't use anything from mini bar, two days later, they called me back and told me it was corrected. So, overall, this is a very nice hotel, with good service, and yes, the people at front desk are very helpful, and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Would not return”
Reviews.Author: lovetotraveloften
Reviews.Content: I would not return to this hotel. It is right next to the conference center - so that was convenient, and the lobby is nice. But, the mattresses were very uncomfortable. We stayed 5 nights. Each night we were awaked by people talking in the hallway. They were not even being overly loud. Just normal conversation levels from the hallway were clearly audible in our room. The curtains and furnishings seemed dated and a bit worn. The breakfast buffet/restaurant staff were slow and inhospitable - except for Darrian - he was wonderful. This is not a 5-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wigglies
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Fairmont Waterfront in Vancouver was a joy. The staff were efficient, friendly, helpful, knowledgeable and we had a great time. The views were fantastic, the location is great. The room was ready when we arrived and they had taken into account all our requests, ie. feather pillows. etc. We then asked the concierge to help us plan our time and they were fantastic. They booked everything for us and gave us lots of tips. The weather in Vancouver tends to rain a lot so probably better to visit in June onwards, may was a bit early i think

Reviews.Title: “Good location good hotel”
Reviews.Author: adamandcelia
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Waterfront - I think we were upgraded to a large corner room as we had views of the city and of the harbour. The beds are lovely and comfortable and the rooms immaculate. Staff are efficient. Nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Return”
Reviews.Author: Starryeyed25
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from my 4 night stay at the Waterfront. First of let me say I was impressed with the look of the hotel, the lobby big and grand etc.. I was quite alarmed at how long check in took, and the very rude front desk lady, who was talking down to me like I was a child really started our trip off with a bang. My only request the entire time of booking was water view. This request was flat out denied unless we wanted to pay an extra $150 a night on top of the $389 a night I was already paying. Now looking back to my booking, $389 a night was for 2 beds and portside view. But apparently, this was over looked. We ended up with room on the 20th floor overlooking the city. The room itself was nice, large bathroom, and comfy (but small) beds. The worst part that made me almost fall off the bed was the size of the t.v.! What a joke, my 7 year old daughter has a bigger t.v in her room. Usually I don't care about the t.v size but this was tragic. I just think that a 5 star hotel should be mind blowing with all the bells and whistles. The pool was good, and the hot tub was a treat from all the walking we did. The steam room was also nice to relax in. The housekeeping staff was A+ and so were the concierge. Always walking around with a smile and quick hello, how you doing. All in all I would say give this hotel a try, but as for me I would maybe try somewhere else. I have stayed at many Fairmonts in the past, and plenty of times just been upgraded with no extra cost. I'm sure I caught this lady on a "off" day, but it really just made the trip have a bit of cloud over it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Views”
Reviews.Author: Keen_Bean_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on various occasions over the past couple of years.
