This hotel is in a great location and has amazing views - even the standard city view is spectacular - but request a higher room if possible. There is a swimming pool on a roof terrace, so you can go a few laps while absorbing the views. The service is great and the food excellent - if a little overpriced. There are some great restaurants within walking distance. However, that would be the same with all hotels! However, I really don't think the size and decor of the rooms warrants a 5* grading...I have certainly stayed in much smarter hotels - but this is the only reason I am marking it down.

Reviews.Title: “Five star but not that special”
Reviews.Author: DublinCarla
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the fairmont for one week in February. it is a 5 star hotel but don't expect the rooms to be of the standard expected of a 5 star hotel. i felt that the decor was in some need of updating as the furniture appeared old and a little grotty. beds are comfy though and the room i stayed in was a good size. the staff were extremely friendly and helpful with any of my queries. the location was excellent for exploring the city and we did enjoy a nice view of the skyscrapers from our room. the outdoor heated pool was a nice place to relax early in the morning or at the end of the day. i think that this hotel is most suited to business people rather than people on holidays looking for the more intimate and personal touch.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, with amazing staff !”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELBUG011
Reviews.Content: For a luxurious stay, you will be hard-pressed to find anywhere better than the Fairmont Waterfront. We stayed for 2 days, and then returned for a further 2 days, following a visit across to Victoria. All the hotel staff were friendly, welcoming and attentive, especially the Reception staff and nothing was ever too much trouble. They appear to treat everyone in this same courteous manner. The rooms are a generous size, bright, immaculate and well-furnished and the bathrooms are the same. The beds are so comfortable - a must when you've been travelling long hours. The location of the hotel is wonderful, in a safe area, with the Sea Walk just a couple of minutes away, Canada Place just across the road and the Harbour infront of you, and good shops and restaurants a couple of blocks away. This hotel has the unusual treat of having two hotel dogs which guests can take out for a walk - many people send Xmas cards to this pair after a visit here ! The only minor niggle was the slow service in the restaurant, even when they appeared to be fairly quiet, but the standard of food was high and made up for the wait. If you're able to get a deal on prices, as we did thru our travel company, then this piece of luxury is a bargain ! We now try not to stay anywhere else on our trips to Vancouver and highly recommend this hotel to friends and family.... my best friend has booked a stay here as part of her honeymoon trip, after we raved on and on about it !

Reviews.Title: “Great view of the bay”
Reviews.Author: Cardiff2
Reviews.Content: The big selling point of this hotel is the view over the bay. Our room presented an excellent vista of ships, boats and the coming and goings of seaplanes - and the snow covered mounatins in the distance. However, a new conference centre is going up, so the view won't be so good on lower floors in the near future. The hotel is unlike the other Fairmont, in the city centre. It is far less plush and, as a newer building, has less ambience, too. However, the our room was spacious, and very clean - with all the facilities we needed. We found the service very good indeed, everyone we encountered was pleasant and eager to help. The restaurant area is quite small, and the bar didn't appeal to us much. Should the mood take you, there's the hotel labrador available for walkies. The hotel is just around the corner from Gastown, which we found disappointing. You only need to go down a few stairs to take the skytrain, which is cheap and frequent. All in all, we enjoyed our stay - and will always remember the superb view.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service but great location”
Reviews.Author: JonaVSeattle
Reviews.Content: I was highly disappointed with our stay on New Year's Eve at the Fairmont. The front desk lady was very rude, condescending and argumentative. She even made my girlfriend cry. There were three of us checking in together yet she still booked us in a queen bed room when we had asked for 2 doubles. She didn't even apologize and made it seem like it was our fault. For the price, I've seen better rooms in Vancouver. The location is good but I would reccommend another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be updated”
Reviews.Author: LM101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from Feb 15-18/07 and they were several positive and negatives: Positives: the locations is great - close to downtown and right on the water. the service was outstanding - room service was great and everyone was helpful with any questions we had, the food was good, the fitness facility was clean and never very crowded, rooms are clean and comfortable. Negatives: parking is very overpriced - we rented a car and had to pay the parking charge of $27/day - as there was no alternative for parking we had no choice (we thought maybe they would give the hotel guests a break but no), the food is also overpriced ($5 for a glass of juice or a pot of tea) but I guess that is expected for a Fairmont, the rooms that have not been update are also in desperate need of it - I understand that they are in the process of doing this so if possible request a room that has been updated!!! Our was not and was done all in pastel colours and the furniture was chipped and outdated. If you can get a decent price on this hotel and/or an updated room I would recommend staying here as as always the service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Little Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: acehole007
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel after reading good trip advisor reviews. Generally the hotel is a good standard with great views. My only comment is that the rooms were a little dated. It definitely isn't a 5* room and the bathroom fixtures were disappointing. Apart from that service was excellent as was breakfast. An enjoyable stay but there may be better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: MartinPh
Reviews.Content: After a honeymoon trip of nearly three weeks, we had chosen the Fairmont Waterfront for our last two nights before returning to London. After our experience of the Fairmont in Calgary (see review) we were a little wary, but we need not have worried. The Fairmont Waterfront is in a completely different league: great location, fabulous views, very quiet, stylish & with great service (the concierges deserve a special mention). Unfortunately, we did not see Vancouver at its best (heavy wind and rain/snow for the entire two days), so we can only imagine what the views must be like when conditions are better. We were fortunate to be given a double-aspect room, with views in two different directions, and we enjoyed watching the sea planes take off and container ships some and go. The room was spacious, stylish and the bed was very comfortable. Its worth staying on the club fllor if you can, as there are 'free' canapes every day at 5pm and an honour bar. You also get free broadband access. All in all, highly recommended and we will return when we return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel, good service, magnificent views”
Reviews.Author: seaward14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Waterfront for one night in December of 2006, and found it to be a lovely, relaxing hotel. Our room was North facing, and the views were magnificent - Coal Harbour, the North shore and Stanley Park. Without exception, staff were courteous and helpful. We arrived quite early in the day, and expected to leave our bags until check-in. The front desk staff informed us that a room was available and that we could check in immediately if we liked - this was very much appreciated. Our room was pretty standard, but very clean, newly renovated and tastefully decorated. The beds were extremely comfortable, and in the morning we both commented on how quiet the hotel had been during the night. The pool is small but well worthwhile. Open year-round,it has impressive views of the surrounding city and the mountains in the distance. Overall, a very pleasant hotel. If you can manage it, get a room with water view - we had a hard time tearing ourselves away.

Reviews.Title: “Moments turned into wonderful memories”
Reviews.Author: Continentalred
Reviews.Content: We have always experienced excellent service at Fairmont Hotels and the Vancouver Waterfront lived up to our expectations. The comforable surroundings are enhanced by a genuine commitment by staff to make your stay a memorable one. The location of this hotel is very cental and has a great view. If it is within your budget I recommend staying in one the Gold rooms where you will enjoy the offerings of the private dining room. Special thanks to the lovely bartender Marta who provided us with excellent information on dining and other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever”
Reviews.Author: Loisstella
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Canada and it was perfect. Our whole trip was amazing and the Fairmont Waterfront certainly added to that! I travel a lot for work, I organise international conferences and events and so often have big budgets to spend on 5 star accomodation. I guess I know the hotel industry... At the fairmont waterfront we had a booked a room with harbor view. Nice room, large, weird and crazy (but fun) view, wonderful bathroom with great toileteries. The best thing however was the service. this is a large hotel, yet people know you by name, remember you and your preferences, offer the hotel car for drop offf and pick up to your restaurants (which we made use of on a few occassions). We weren't in a suite and I wasn't a corporate guest spending large amounts of money... these guys just get it - they get it perfectly right! 10 out of 10. Would recommend it to everyone! Wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel great view, outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: Capt_Tom
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Fairmont Waterfront several times and always found the hotel and its' staff exceptional. By all means book one of the suites that includes a very fine breakfast buffet featuring delicious Lox and other delights. One word of caution: do not request the hotel to pick you up or drop you off at the airport as they will show up with a vintage Rolls Royce at a rather high (non-vintage) cost. Also included in the suite price is an afternoon tea that again includes Lox and some rather nice wines. The front desk staff is exceptional and so is the concierge. While there have the concierge arrange a visit to Victoria where there is a extraordinary native natural history museum and also a short bus ride out of Victoria there is a beautiful garden complex. Make sure you fly back and forth to Victoria as the boat rides waste the entire day.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Waterfront, what a gem!”
Reviews.Author: capitol5555
Reviews.Content: Recently, we vacationed in Vancouver, BC. and for the second time we stayed at the Fairmont Waterfront Hotel. What a location! Even with bad weather, we still an enjoyable time. The Fairmont Waterfront Hotel is a palace. In fact, they are building another one just down the street. The views are spectacular. Make sure you have a room that faces the harbor. There is so much to do in Vancouver, even with bad weather. Shopping and restaurants are near by, plus other points of interest. I reccomend a day trip to Whistler, BC, the site of the 2010 Winter Olympics. The bus costs less than the train. We traveled on a Gray Line tour bus. A very nice bus, modern and clean. If you enjoy seafood, I highly recommend the Boathouse, excellent seafood with a view and great service. The staff at the Fairmont Waterfront are very courteous and make you feel at home. We will definitely return to the Vancouver Fairmont Waterfront Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Variable”
Reviews.Author: UK-CB4
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Waterfront. When I tried to make the booking online, about 6 weeks ahead, it failed repeatedly. So I resorted to the phone – the first thing I tried to do was to tell the phone booking agents that the website had major problems, but they simply ignored my comments – I simply couldn’t get anyone to promise to let the web side of the organisation that there seemed to be a major problem with their website. They just didn’t want to know. One of them even suggested that if I was concerned about it, I should e-mail them! Excuse me!? Your website booking system is broken, I try to tell you that you may be losing thousands of dollars and not only do you not want to know, you also suggest that I should spend even more time telling your organisation!? Isn’t something topsy turvy here? Amway – the stay itself … as before we booked one of the corner rooms with the spectacular views over the harbour (a little more money, but worth it the extra) and requested the highest possible floor. When we arrived, they offered us floor 5 (the top floor is 23). After a lot of persistence, they got us three days on 22, but said that we would have to move down to 5 for the last two days. Two days later, after further persistence on our part, we got to stay in the same room. So – good marks for that! One of the front desk staff worked hard to make that happen. All the pile driving for the new conference centre has ended, so noise levels were quite acceptable. Overall, the service was reasonably good, but what irritated us beyond measure was the constant interruptions we had to suffer in the restaurant. “How are things?” “Is everything all right?” “How is your food?” Honestly – it was happening every two minutes!! My partner was looking at the guide book and … “Hi! Do you need any help? I’m a native of Vancouver and I know the city really well!” It was SO intrusive that we decided to eat elsewhere after the first couple of days! Their so-called customer care actually drove us away! As many hotels do, their phone system displays your name to them every time you call someone on the internal phone, or go into the restaurant. They then work your name into every single sentence. They seem to labour under the delusion that this makes you feel especially valued – well, Fairmont, I have news for you – we KNOW it’s a cheap trick, and that makes us feel worse, not better! You know, the good old-fashioned “sir” really works for me. Not getting my order wrong (twice) and getting the bill wrong (twice). They need to learn the first rule of excellent customer service – good service … REALLY good service … is one thing above all else – unobtrusive. Great location, great views, but very variable customer service. But eat elsewhere if you don’t want to know the waiters and waitresses’ life stories!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service but maybe just a notch overpriced”
Reviews.Author: EastBayTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights on business. The hotel itself is very attractive and sits across from the convention center and cruise terminal. The room had several excellent features: large window; very good beds; nice linens; good-sized bathroom; a real closet (with a light -- that actually comes in very handy); plenty of drawer space; comfortable desk and chair; tasteful decor. I heard a little more noise from the hallway, and a few times from the next room, than I would expect in a hotel at this price point. Not paper thin walls or interfere-with-sleep noise levels, not even close -- just noticeable when it really shouldn't be. But on the other hand room noise is very hard to eliminate. The staff was really terrific. I think Four Seasons provides the best customer service, and this Fairmont met Four Seasons level. Examples: maid arranged all of my bathroom stuff very neatly,and I think she even cleaned my shaving cream can; reception staff was very friendly and welcoming when I arrived (at midnight); valet was very helpful with directions and general send-off in the morning; waitress at Heron's saw that I only had one plate of food at the lunch buffet and adjusted the bill downward; staff at concierge lounge (Mike) was very friendly in setting up use of their small conference room, letting my colleague hang out in the lounge while I took care of some other business, and remembering my name. The lounge is well-stocked with soft drinks, beer, and spirits. The breakfast is good and can sustain you until lunch, unless you need the big lumberjack breakfast. I did great with the pastries, yogurt, hard-boiled eggs, and a smoothie. Room service is expensive -- like NYC expensive, but sonofagun, the $17 hamburger and fries were delicious. The above-referenced lunch buffet was just outstanding -- sushi, Indian, seafood, salad, and all of it fresh, flavorful, and very attractive. I was very busy during my stay, so I didn't get to partake of the bar, which looked nice. It's an easy walk to the more happening part of downtown, and even with the construction in the area, it was nice to be so close to the water. The seaplanes didn't even register with me, I doubt they will with you. But $329 a night plus the healthy premium on food and parking just struck me as maybe five or ten percent higher than what felt right. I easily could just be unfamiliar with what the going rate is in Vancouver these days. This was a business trip, so it was not on my dime. If I could get a better rate, I'd be very pleased to return here even on a personal trip.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced, average rooms, but really good service”
Reviews.Author: ACPACPACP
Reviews.Content: It don't think its worth the money, as the rooms are quit okay - but really nothing special. Things are coming into age. A really positive surprise was the breakfast and the pool-view - you shouldn't miss it. Servicelevel is also above average. Rooms are a bit noisy, both from the outside (seaplanes leave & arrive all the day) and from the inside (dunno why).

Reviews.Title: “no hot water”
Reviews.Author: joydavis
Reviews.Content: the hotel fairmont waterfront was wonderful , the beds were great, the view was spectacular , but when we got up in the morning ,there was no hot water. when i called the front desk they explained that there was no hot water anywhere in down town vancouver. they did nothing to accomadate for the hot water other than to say were sorry but this happens. We had paid 375 per night , I agree that things do happen, but no consesion offer was made at all. so i wont stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SurfaceTravel
Reviews.Content: This is a typical North American 5-star city hotel. Excellent large rooms with excellent views and decent service. It is a fair walk into the city centre, though. I wouldn't stay there again, but only to try out some of the other hotels. Over-all, it was good.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ronfaddison
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to read about criticism of the staff of this hotel. Immediately we arrived someone took our luggage and made it clear that it would be delivered as soon as we had checked in - and it was. The receptionists were helpful, the waitresses at breakfast superb and the general ambiance between staff and residents seemed excellent. We had a bed and breakfast package so i cannot quote the price of the breakfast but the food was very good. The warm food was actually warm - and that's a tester for hotels these days! Our bedroom had a very good view across Canada Place (from where the cruise liners leave); it was spacious (certainly by British standards) and quite well appointed with a mini bar and most of the other common hotel accoutrements. But there was no room safe which was disappointing for there should be in a hotel of this standard. For an ordinary tourist the location of the hotel is superb - just across the road from the cruise liner terminal (excellent place to stay if you are going on a boat), about 3 or 4 minutes from the sea bus terminal and the Sky Train terminal and maybe about 5 or 6 minutes from Gastown. For those who really need to go shopping the main shopping areas are only about a 10 minute walk away. The sea planes are not far away either. My main criticism is the bar which is basically an adjunct to the restaurant. When it is busy it can be reasonably pleasant ( though expensive) for people watching but when it is quiet (e.g. late in the evening) it can appear quite uninviting. There is a British style pub a couple of minutes away - left on leaving the hotel, next left and it is across the road. The beer was very good, the ambiance pleasant and they do wonderful steaks on Saturdays. I think it is called "The Lions" As for the construction work which has been covered in earlier reviews I don't totally understand the problem unless it has all changed. Yes, there is construction going on but it is not very immediate to the hotel, there was not a lot of noise and I scarcely noticed it. Unless you are of a really delicate constitution I wouldn't worry about it Overall we had an excellent stay and would thoroughly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view”
Reviews.Author: DTierman
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Waterfront May 3, 2006. We stayed in a lovely corner room with a gorgeous view of the pool; mountains; waterfront and city! The staff was very professional and efficient. We received a nice senior citizen rate and I will surely stay again my next time visiting Vancouver (I enjoyed it much more than the Pan Pacific we stayed at last year),

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: yugesiw
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. We stayed here off-season (winter) when the rooms are considerably cheaper and had a spectacular view of Vancouver. Our room had floor to ceiling windows offering a spectacular outlook over this city. Location is superb and they will let you walk the hotel dog! Public bar and cocktail list is also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: bukkles
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the fairmont Gold level with our beautiful dog and loved it. They walked our dog, gave us a free car to our restaurant of choice, had a special lounge with food all day... It is excellent. Be sure not to miss it and of course walking to town and Robson street is a quick 10 min walk that feels great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Views, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: qaz123
Reviews.Content: Based on the positive reviews the Fairmont Waterfront has garnered in the travel press, the hotel was a letdown. Though the rooms were spacious, the furnishings were quite bland--if not for the size, you might think you were in a Holiday Inn. The bathroom was a standard hotel bathroom--again, very Holiday Inn--though the toiletries were nice. The gym was perhaps the biggest disappointment--crowded, dingy, and very small--especially since the Pan Pacific apparently has constructed a huge new Spa and gym facility. The only real positive of this hotel were the views of the bay and mountains from the room. The hotel is located, as the name suggests, on the waterfront, which is a positive and negative. It affords the aforementioned views but means that you must walk 5 or 10 minutes to get to anything of real note in the city. It's a tradeoff. All in all, I would not recommend this hotel to leisure travelers. The Fairmont on Robson Street might be a better choice, as might the Opus Hotel in Yaletown, which looked very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Arrogance Galore!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Staff at this Fairmont are the most arrogant I've ever encountered. Doorman that turn the other way, focuse d on their dog than people arriving and needing a hand with luggage. Inside, more of the same. The sleeping room was large but quite out-dated. The desk clerk said some rooms were being renovated, but only a few floors each year. She offered to put me in a gold floor room (upgraded room), which was renovated, for an extra $80!! The hallways did not warrant a fine Fairmont - damaged wall paper, marks, etc. The hotel's lobby lounge was nice for meeting friends, lively & comfortable. But construction noise from a new office building across the street became unbearable - even laughable - so we left early for dinner. My recommendation - stay away until they train the employees on welcoming guests and until the rooms are renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations not met”
Reviews.Author: Bobs-big-vacation
Reviews.Content: Second time visit to Vancouver and decided to book the Waterfront having stayed in Fairmont Royal York, Toronto, and with expectations of Fairmont quality and great harbour views. The bell boy and reception staff was typically classy as, it must be said, all service was. However, once you leave the lobby, the corridors and rooms don't quite seem to hit the same heights and, dare I say it, decor and furnishings need freshening up or updating for the new millenium. (Sorry Fairmont) Furthermore, a "deluxe" room appeared to be no more than any other standard room, so I would be wary about paying extra as I don't think you get any additional benefit. Worse still, and little could be done about this (and nor will it be able to for some time) but there is a new convention centre being built a few hundred feet away in the waters of the harbour. Even on the 20th floor, you could hear work starting on driving pilons into the harbour from 7am onwards...and though not necessarily heard, you could see heavy work going on past 10pm. Fortunately we weren't jet lagged, in need of sleep or staying for so long in downtown that it made a tremendous difference but it might to you. Breakfast buffet was top class but I'm not sure I would have paid full price if it had not been in a package, price is steep. Next time, I would not rule out the Waterfront but I would be reading the small print to look for a refit and what the extras actually amount to... and I would certainly wait for the Convention Centre to be built!

Reviews.Title: “Panoramic view of a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: Robbieinvictoria
Reviews.Content: Arriving with my dog in tow, I was placed in a room with curved panoramic view windows extending into the bathroom. I expected to be relegated to a "pet" room. The Fairmont Waterfront has succeeded in creating a very comfortable experience--no hotel "smell", tastefully appointed but not over-the-top decor, good bath products and helpful service. The doorman gave me excellent advice on where to walk the dog. I cannot say enough good things about Fairmont Hotels with respect to pets. Two things I'd like to see at this hotel are: 1) larger, higher end televisions and 2) shower wand/massage.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accommodations and Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: RCCLWW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in early November 2005 as part of a tour package. The hotel is across the street from Canada Place (Cruise Ship Terminal). The room was very comfortable. The king bed and bedding was outstanding. Service from the front desk, bellman and restaurant were exceptional. Everyone was always offering to assist. The hotel has direct access to underground transportation, shops and food services. The next time I visit Vancouver I will definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Far From Four Seasons / Ritz Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had heard about how wonderful this hotel was - their website even says "Rated Best Hotel in Canada" -but I can't see how. The lobby is very nice & luxurious, but the rooms are in a seroius need of updating. A business associate joined me for a drink in the nice lobby lounge, but we joked about not being able to hear each over over the construction nearby, due from constant jackhammering...which started EARLY the next morning! (apparently a new Convention Center is being built next door over the next couple years). My associate mentioned this hotel was similar to Four Seasons and Ritz Carltons, but I found it to be FAR from it. The service was somewhat pompous & distant, similar to most Four Seasons & Ritzs, but those hotels are immaculate & luxurious..worth the rates. This hotel is very overpriced and definitely for Vancouver. Most employees here were more focused on their dog (a beautiful lab - PR stunt) at the front door than greeting & assisting their guests.

Reviews.Title: “End of Honeymoon... Noisy buiding work!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the end of our honeymoon in July 2005 and were disappointed to find our Gold level room was overlooking a building site outside (some new conference centre). Enormous hammers then piled foundation work into the bay finishing at 7pm that night,,,, AND starting at 7.30am the next day!!!! We requested a change of room and to give the hotel credit we were shown 3 other rooms to choose from. We choose a top floor room with great views AWAY from the building site. The hotel is very plush and the honor bar was a nice touch. We ended up sitting by the pool for the last 2 days to chill out..... and even almost got used to the hammering noise. It is a nice hotel but I wish our travel agent had warned us about the noise as there is another Fairmont inland a bit which would have been a lot quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont = Excellence”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont, Vancouver, after an Alaska Cruise Tour. Fantatic panoramic views of the area of Vancouver, extremely pleasant (yet non-obtrusive) staff,comfortable large rooms. Excellent location - within walking distance of many attractions. Lovely, clean harbor views and next to Canada Place. The Fairmont knows how to to things right, and they make you feel extremely comfortable while doing it. I was ill, and my husband went to the desk to ask about a doctor. The doctor was on the phone to me - via the front desk - before my husband returned to our room on the 19th floor! The Fairmont staff truly cares about all their "residents." Our luggage was even "steel cabeled together" - for safety - while it was waiting to be taken to the room. We felt very much "at home" there. Very reasonably priced for such fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Noise Complaints Are All Too True”
Reviews.Author: booksnoop
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont Vancouver Waterfront from 15-19 October 2005. We booked in advance via the internet and got a prepaid rate of $309 (CAD) per night for a cityview room on the Gold Level. My husband achieved President's Club Premier status with this stay, which may be why we received an upgraded room with a harborview. Gold level guests have a separate check in on the 9th floor, just outside the lounge. Everyone working the concierge desk was pleasant and helpful. Our room had a king sized bed, comfortable reading chair, desk, armoire with tv, bar, a rather smallish but adequate bath, and a large picture window overlooking the harbor (side where ferry boats dock). It also had a clock/cd player and several cds were provided. It's definately worthwhile to stay on the Gold level, due to all the perks given. There is a very extensive free continental breakfast served every morning, with cereals, cheeses, meats, fruit, pastries, breads and a hot entree, as well as juices, milk, tea and coffee. This alone would cost you $17.00 per person from room service. Coffee, tea, water, soft drinks and cookies are available during the day, and in the evening, a nice selection of hors d'oeuvres are served. There is also an honor bar, which many guests took advantage of (ie didn't pay). I checked out the fitness room which has a great view, but the equipment is pretty old. There is a small outdoor pool, not big enough for lap swimming. On our first night the hotel fire alarm went off about 6:30 pm and continued off and on for about 45 minutes. A recorded message played periodically saying that they were investigating the alarm. Finally we got an all clear, false alarm. Speaking of noise, previous reviewers have noted the construction noise in the area. There is an extension being built to the Convention Center across the street and it's true that the pile drivers start early in the morning and go on into the evening, sometimes 3-4 at a time. This makes quite a racket which you can clearly hear in your room. This would be very annoying if you had to spend a lot of time in your room. If this would be a problem, you might want to consider staying in a hotel away from the waterfront for the next few years. There is another Fairmont, the Fairmont Vancouver, just a few blocks away, which is more centrally located and definately less noisy. This is a really nice hotel with great staff. I probably would not stay here again though, until the construction is completed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnsFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed in late July before a cruise. Had a beautiful room. Lots of construction across the street but we really did not notice after the first afternoon. Hotel is within walking distance to all areas and close to a trolley station. Hotel was beautiful and clean. All help was very nice and informative. Hotel food was very pricey but just below them is a food court which had a great diner for breakfast, and lots of choices for fast food takeout. Would recommend this hotel and would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, great service and product!”
Reviews.Author: antonella
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I stayed one night only - I was going back to England the next day - but I can say the Hotel is great. Fantastic service from the Reception staff, knowledge of the loyalty programme, and excellent value for money. I had booked a Standard room but I have been given a complimentary upgrade to Harbour View Deluxe room. Ok, there was some view of the construction site but overall nohing can beat the view of Stanley Park and Lion's Gate Bridge. I had been staying at the Palliser in Calgary and can fairly say the standards at Fairmont Hotels is possibly the best.

Reviews.Title: “over rated...will not return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed less than 19 hours before embarking on a trip. In that time, the construction site was very noisy....we did NOT have view of the water, nor could we see the ships docking, as we were told when checking in. An alarm sounded in the afternoon, with no instruction....upon calling the front desk, I was treated rudely and they would not tell me why the alarm was sounding. I suggested we wondered if we needed to evacuate while they were deciding what the cause might be.....she didn't seem to think that was necessary and directed me to wait for further instructions. Since we were on 12th floor, we chose to leave. Firetrucks in the front when we emerged from stairwell. Finally told it was a water leak. We asked the bellman how often this sort of thing happens, and were told the last one was about 6 weeks ago. Terrible communication with customers. When I complained about it, learned there were 3 different levels of alarms, and this was the middle one..... there was no information about this on the door panel, nor in the directory in the room. We had snack in dining room in the afternoon that was not as described in the menu, and overpriced. Breakfast took an inordinately long time to be served (not crowded), was cold, and overpriced. I will not return to this hotel. I did fill out evaluation form and have heard nothing from them since.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Good views, walking distance to gaslamp district and shopping. Beautiful rooms - clean and nice decor. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Close your eyes - block your ears”
Reviews.Author: familyabroad
Reviews.Content: Very surprised by previous review and the range of views offered by photographs. Fairmont Waterfront is a good hotel, excellent staff etc. But two things you need to know about this hotel at moment. The main views of the waterfront are currently dominated by a construction site - if you can lift your eyes above that ugly vista then you'll have no problems. But if you booked, asked for a waterfront 'deluxe' room view then you are in for a surprise. The photos in the previous review show the sideways 'portside' view from some of the hotel rooms. It's not the primary 'waterfront' view from the hotel. The photos of the pool point to the other sideways outlook and if a slightly wider angle were used you would have another ugly vista of the construction site. Second issue is noise. The construction work is pile-driving. A repetitive bang with an echo off the surrounding tall buildings. It starts at 0730. Fine if you don't plan to sleep late - but leave you to imagine what a quiet dip in the outdoor pool or breakfast on the verandah can be like when this is ocurring. This isn't the hotel's fault. And Pan Pacific is another hotel with a ringside seat of the construction work. If you choose a hotel in the Canada Place vicinity, then I advise you to ask hard questions of reservations staff or your agent about room views and noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice For Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wintersummer
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our entire stay at the Fairmont Waterfront. The views are great. Just take a look at the photos. This is a modern hotel, with all the comforts. Restaurant is pricy but very good. We had breakfast there every morning and lunch several days. Fairmont had a program where they would loan you dogs...to take for a walk, to pet, just to play with. I'm attaching photo of one of their dogs. You can tell they just get too much attention! They were sleepy most of the time! Also attaching photo of lobby as swarms of media arrived. There had been a big hockey fight the night before and one of involved players was on his way to lobby to speak to press. I couldn't get any more photos because the crowd was so big. Just an additional moment of excitement in a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Waterfront - Fantastic location, fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GLORIA7991
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 9 night stay at the Fairmont Waterfront. We found the majority of the staff to be very professional, friendly and extremely helpful. The room was large, very clean, and in a quiet location. The pool area was also very nice, and after a while you did not notice the noise of the construction work. The only negative comment would have to be the prices in the restaurant which were a little on the high side. Having said that the choice of food was excellent, particularly the buffet breakfast. We would definately stay here again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Waterfront - a great disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Sad to say I have to add to the negative reviews of this hotel. Halfway through our trip to Alberta and British Columbia we had already stayed in three other hotels and been delighted with our accommodation. It can be expensive travelling as a family with an 18 year old daughter and 15 year old son, but so far we had been very happy. Unfortunately, far from being an expensive treat, the Fairmont was a great disappointment with very strange ideas about North American bed sizes! Suffice to say that we will be travelling according to the availability of Sheraton "sweet sleepers" in future.............. It felt to us that the Fairmont had fallen for its own hype and, with the exception of the delightful Elijah who offered to drive us to our dinner destination free-of-charge, after my less than satisfactory discussion about bed-sizes with reception, the staff considered themselves all rather too grand to offer an efficient service. Our tip for Vancouver would be to stay at any of the more reasonably-priced chains downtown and then to use the very cheap taxis to get about, or walk.

Reviews.Title: “So so, not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: hon-hon
Reviews.Content: After rading the reviews, I was looking forward to staying in the Fairmont. Upon arrival, we upgraded to the Concierge Floor. We were very disappointed! I don't know which concierge other people had, but we had a very rude woman who basically acted like she was too good to help us. My only satisfaction was backing out of the Concierge Floor after reporting this. Honestly, this hotel is only average. The amenities and service are nothing special - certainly not justified by its price. The views are also ony average. I would consider the Pan Pacific next time - it is a much more elegant hotel overall and has great views.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: AKWKirkcaldy
Reviews.Content: Located right at the heart of the town. Excellent service, excellent accomodation, a bit expensive, but worth every penny. Oh by the way, if you want to do some whale watching it's a day trip to Victoria. None in Vancouver bay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: CracklingRosie
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay with Fairmont Hotels and we were really impressed. The location of the hotel is excellent, right on Canada Place and about a 10 minute stroll to Robson Street. Gastown is only minutes away and there is a great little restaurant called Steamworks within 200m of the hotel. Must sees are Granville Market and it's worth making the trip to Yaletown for some lunch. The hotel is right next to the seaplane terminal and we'd recommend the 20 minute tour over the mountains, it was amazing. When we arrived we were given the option of upgrading from a harbour view room to a signature room (corner room with a ceiling to floor picture windows). For 2 nights it cost us an extra £15 GBP and was well worth it for the view over the harbour, mountains and Stanley Park. If you're travelling to Canada from the UK this hotel is great value given the current exchange rate. We booked through a UK company called Canada Options which was great value. 5 star luxury for 3 star prices. The room was nice but the bathroom was a little cold and the tv could certainly have done with replacing. Join the Fairmont Presidents Club before you book so that you can take advantage of their loyalty scheme and free local phone calls. Our room was on the 15th floor and what a view (ok, so the construction for the Olympics spoils it a little but it was still a fantastic view). The hotel has a nice bar downstairs where you can sit and watch the world go by while you ponder over which martini or cocktail to order from the menu! The staff were very pleasant and the hotel dogs (Holly and Morgan) wander around the lobby greeting guests. This hotel has a lovely relaxed atmosphere for a luxury hotel. We didn't eat in the restaurant but were so lazy one night that we ordered room service and when it arrived the waiter set it all up on a table for us in front of the window. Fantastic. I don't think there can be many restuarants with a better view and we didn't even have to leave the room! If we return to Vancouver we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, Loved, Loved IT”
Reviews.Author: JavaHeaven
Reviews.Content: Stayed a few years ago with my boyfriend. We parked upfront, the bellman offered to watch our car while we checked in. The bellman went straight for the bags without us asking. This was a last minute check-in and we wanted a suite to face the water so the clerk found a suite very fast. The room was fantastic, nice linens, robes, and even a phone next to the toilet, which I chuckled about. All in all, very nice staff and awesome breakfast.
